author: a student and reviewer
title: great! Another update.
content:
We update the app as often as possible to remove all of its negative reviews and fool more people into getting and using uber. Check back next week to see the latest way that we exploit our drivers, incentivizing them to work long hours without developing any new skills or educating themselves, all the while using the profits we make off of our drivers' hard work to steal self-driving car secrets from google so that we can deploy a fleet of self-driving cars in 10 years (or less), thereby rendering our drivers, who have spent 10 driving driving and making loads of money for us, totally redundant to the workforce and thus unemployed (and unemployable). Oh, also we track your location when not using the app, and we don't let you tip your driver without cash.

Love gender discrimination? Rate us! Your feedback keeps the Uber engine from appropriately dealing with rampant gender discrimination and harassment internal to our company.

Have a question? Tap Greyball in the Uber app or visit curse-out-our-employees dot uber dot com

author: infuriated time hopper
title: Abandoned by Uber driver, STILL charged full price.
content: This past Saturday evening I requested an Uber pick up from the hotel my friends and I were staying at, this happened around 10:15 PM. After waiting 15 minutes the driver, Cuong, called twice telling me he couldn't find us. He said a street was closed and he had no idea how to get to us. In the middle of the second call he hung up and charged me, without EVER reaching the pick up point. Somehow, I am being charged for the trip he took to try and find us instead of him actually driving us anywhere. We had to wait another 20 minutes for a shuttle to drive us. After reporting this to customer care I was told 4 times that "based on previous rides" that it was likely I took this trip. I can guarantee I did NOT take this trip considering the starting and end location were NOWHERE near the hotel we were at! Countless messages where I throughly explained how this was an inconceivable pick up and drop off were disregarded by customer service and I was told they'd be closing the case without any effort actually exerted by the company. I will have to dispute the charge with my bank and also cancel any relationship I currently have with this terrible ride service. It's a shame the good drivers will have to miss out on fares and income due to Cuong's lack of direction and customer services lack of, well, customer service at the very least. Not a surprise the overall company and app has MAYBE 1.5 stars.

author: liber8
title: From OK to bad to really slimy: invades privacy despite user requests
content: Uber continues its downward spiral and has lost my trust (and that of countless users). The perpetual location tracking in the recent versions is totally unacceptable. Making matters worse, they have *removed* the option to use iOS's native privacy controls to allow location tracking only while using the app. Lyft respects users' privacy, unlike Uber. Also, I'm no longer able to rate drivers, since after turning off location tracking there's a nag screen every time one opens or returns to the app, and that nag screen blocks the page where typically one would rate the driver right after a trip (dismissing the nag screen also dismissed the rating screen, which is a major design flaw). Uber has officially gone from hit-and-miss to terrible. And, on top of that, now Uber wants access to your contacts as well as your location. Pass.

author: Cloudspills
title: Horrible
content:
I've been using Uber for the past 2 years and I've noticed it's been getting worse and worse. Recently I moved to LA and it's just ridiculous out here, drivers driving completely past you, getting canceled constantly, and just the overall attitude of some of the drivers(a lot of pervs too). Yet even with all that I wouldn't rate it 1 star until what happened recently. A driver decided to NOT pick me up, and start the trip without me.
 Of course I give the guy a call ... doesn't answer, so I call again... no answer. Third time I call he picks up(at this point he is already at my destination without me), he goes on to say the app was being "weird" and wasn't working... so instead of trying to contact me he ignored my calls and finished a trip without me in it. 

Any sane person would want a refund right? Wrong. According to Uber's customer service I "completed" the trip and can't be refunded. It's obvious at this point he did all of this on purpose so I couldn't get a refund and he gets free money. Extremely frustrating, horrible customer service! This is the first time I've ever tried to refund a trip, so I'm not abusing it by any means. I deleted the app and won't be supporting them any more, think twice about using Uber!

author: Naedeon
title: Terrible service
content: On many occasions my Uber app will freeze or the time is inaccurate and my ride would come and I would not be aware of it and I get charged a cancellation fee. Also when I request an Uber the time would say 7mins for example which is do-able for me then it changes to 14 mins which is way too long and I have to cancel but get charged a cancellation fee b/c the app gave me two different times. Also, one time I had caught an uber pool and there were two other people there as well usually it's one other person and if it's two their together. So the lady had to drop all three of us off. She drop the one girl off then dropped the guy off so I'm thinking I'm next but then the app tell her to pick someone else up. She picked her up dropped her off I am still in the car my trip should have taken me 7 mins but took 30 mins instead. She had to turn the uber app off b/c it was telling her to pick people off instead of dropping me off. On top with of that I had my son with me who was hungry b/c it took us so long to get home. On top of that when you take an uber pool sometime the other passenger is not on the way to where you going.

author: Whyamihere
title: Adios
content:
You took away the option of sharing location only while using the app. Guess what's easier than having to go into my settings every time to re-enable location and disable location?? ...using Lyft from now on. Put location sharing back to the user's choice.
ADDITIONALLY, I consider this company to be a bunch of scumbags for releasing a new update every few days to wipe out the negative reviews. There are no real updates to the app. If there were it would be from listening to the rage of their users and giving back the option of location while only using the app. And I'll continue to give 1 star until they do!

Update: Uber recently sent an email "noticing" that I disabled location for the App. Well no crap, that's what happens when you don't care about user privacy. I'm sure they had to send out a lot of those emails to others. My location will remain disabled until they bring back the option for only when using the app, and my business continues to go to Lyft.

author: AbsolutelyTrash103947283
title: Bad app, bad company
content:
The Uber app gives you the option to have location tracking either always or never. They claim it's to enhance the user experience by monitoring you for 5 minutes after a ride. Not only is that creepy, if you give Uber location permission, it's all the time, it doesn't have to shut off after 5 minutes. Uber makes the app almost unusable if you select the option for never. Even if you have location services enabled, the map will place you in a completely different location and then they charge you when you're picked up at your real location rather than at the erroneous location they selected in their app. Drivers will cancel on you if they don't like your drop off location or drive away from you to force you to cancel. When this happens you get charged. Customer support, or rather lack of support, will reply with cookie cutter responses that don't address any real problems or concerns and they refuse to give refunds, only credits, even if you shouldn't have been charged in the first place. What good is a credit if I don't want to use Uber again. On top of all of this, there are multiple allegations of harassment internally at Uber, and allegations of assault by drivers.
You would be wise to avoid using Uber!

author: Eric L789
title: Former Uber evangelist, now I know better...
content:
I started using Uber when it launched in NYC in 2010 and have taken probably 1500 rides all over the world since then (have had Uber's "VIP" status in 3 cities and actually got rid of my car in LA for a year to just use Uber). 

What legitimately started as an excellent operation with super customer service has devolved in to customer and driver hell as the business grew too rapidly. If you have ANY issue customer service is a total disaster. While I have a 4.85 rating and am a perfect customer in every way, Uber today inexplicably suspended my account stranding me and causing me to miss a flight to an important meeting. Absolutely no communication, no reason, no way to contact anyone except by email to a surly foreign "call center" type worker who will spit meaningless "customer service" scripts back at you. 

The good news is, Lyft is great!!!!! STAY AWAY from this horrible mess. If Uber hasn't screwed YOU yet, trust me, they WILL.

author: liber8
title: From OK to bad to horrible, and invades privacy
content: Uber has been in a downward spiral and has lost my trust. The extended location tracking in the recent versions is unacceptable— and now they want access to your calendar, too. Forget it. Worst of all, they have *removed* the option to use iOS's native privacy controls to allow location tracking only while using the app. I'm switching to Lyft, at least until that feature is restored. Also, I'm no longer able to rate drivers, since after turning off location tracking there's a nag screen every time one opens or returns to the app, and that nag screen blocks the page where typically one would rate the driver right after a trip (dismissing the nag screen also dismissed the rating screen, which is a major design flaw). Uber has officially gone from hit-and-miss to terrible. And, on top of that, now Uber wants access to your contacts as well as your location. No thanks.

author: sincityangel
title: Riders Beware!!!! Would use zero stars if I could!
content: DO NOT USE UBER ESPECIALLY IF YOU LIVE IN A LARGE CITY. I was given this info from an actual Uber recruiter who told me that Uber tracks all the events in the city and hikes up the normal ride cost because of "increased demand for rides due to any concert/ show / convention- when is there not one of those going on in a large city especially here in Las Vegas. She explained how this has made her job a nightmare because people using the service for a safe ride home after a night of clubs and fun while still being responsible and NOT wanting to drive under any kind of substance intoxication. The customers were waking up the next day and realizing their safe ride home cost them in the hundreds for a ride that should be no more than $10. All she could tell these extremely irate customers was that they were shown the ridiculous price for the fare and they accepted it even though they clearly told her that they thought it was a glitch in the app and there was no way that could be the actual price for the ride, in addition the drivers get 0%of the insane inflated due to city events causing the "severely increased demand" as if this wasn't enough they are also tracking your location even when you are not using the app or service at all. Please don't get ripped off by these thieves use any other ride sharing service!

author: Gorberg
title: Learn from my mistake, Don't get involved with uber...
content: I find Uber's business practices to be sneaky and despicable. I'm not going to recommend this app from Uber. The Uber app pulls the resale value out of your car to Pay YOU. Uber needs to compensate and pay the drives real money, so they can fix and maintain there car's. Uber doesn't pay much to the drivers at all (Uber keeps about 60% of what the rider pay UBER). Once you consider your fuel cost, extremely high cost of ride-share car insurance, car maintenance and the terrible wear and tear on the car itself plus significant lose of value of your car at resale, especially because of the super high miles on your vehicle. The Uber app is a very bad deal for the drive. However the riders are getting a great deal on your dime and time. Sorry for the bad new.

author: MisturHuynh
title: Uber Is Trashhhhh
content: i've always used uber and i had little problems but not as important as the one i had today, so i ordered an uber and she kept passing up the right turn for the apartment, i was just looking at her passing up the turn and she finally comes into the right turn for my apt building, she is talking on the phone and keeps driving really slow, im walking towards the car waving my hand but i guess she can't see me cause she is on the PHONEE!! keep in mind i was like 5 feet from the car walking towards it, then she just keeps driving off so i canceled it and uber charged my card $5.... ik it doesnt seem like alot but to some people (like me) it takes like 45 min to earn $5 at being 18 and working a minimum wage job and still in high school with bills to pay, so i reported it and all the uber company has to say back is "you will be charged after 2 minutes of waiting time" and you know i had to send another back saying "i told yall it wasnt my fault ima switch to another app and leave some "good" reviews" and well i want to see their response back

author: Torley
title: Uber is broken on iPad Pro 10.5" with iOS 10.3.2
content:
As other users have reported (thanks, good to know it's not just me), Uber instantly crashes when you try to start it — shows the black screen with logo and then suddenly quits. Works fine on previous iPads. No amount of restarting, reinstalling, etc. will fix it.

Uber support is not being helpful and wasting my time. Told me to try basic troubleshooting despite me stating clearly that I had already exhaustively done that. They don't have a clear channel to report issues like this, which is even more frustrating. If you're experiencing this problem too, please post, because they aren't acknowledging it.

Uber, please escalate this issue and fix it so your app will work on the new iPad Pro 10.5". Thank you.

author: manhattanIovestory
title: $20 coupon: 87DА3
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride!!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the promotions tab on the app and enter the coupon there. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing!!! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button!!! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic!!! I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away..

Also, I'm no longer able to rate drivers, since after turning off location tracking there's a nag screen every time one opens or returns to the app, and that nag screen blocks the page where typically one would rate the driver right after a trip (dismissing the nag screen also dismissed the rating screen, which is a major design flaw). Uber has officially gone from hit-and-miss to terrible. And, on top of that, now Uber wants access to your contacts as well as your location. No thanks.

author: Runfree86
title: Don't support this company
content: The future of our generation depends on our support for trustworthy, reliable, and transparent companies.  Uber is just a horrendous company on many levels. Their drivers hate them, they ignore and abuse their driver (the ones that actually make them money), they ignore or abuse their customers (the ones with money to give), they track you even after you uninstall their app, even as competitors they're a bunch of whiney losers who harass their competitor and their competitors' customers. They also surge prices up as high as 7 times the regular price. I've had to pay as high as $100 to drive 20 miles, making it more expensive than my round trip flight! Uber does not like you. They don't care about you. Stop f'ng supporting them.

author: pgk2008
title: Invasive GPS tracking policy even after many user complaints
content:
Location tracking is all or nothing with Uber. Normal apps offer "track only when using", but Uber demands "Always track". If the past year has taught us anything, it's "don't trust Uber to do the right thing". 

It looks like they're not in a hurry to listen to customers' complaints, since we're at least nine updates in since I started paying attention to the GPS issue. It also seems like they abuse the app update system. Weekly 170MB updates with no change log. That's half a gig per month, thanks guys..

Partial workaround for tracking: disable GPS for the Uber app, and only turn it back on if you absolutely need to use the app. And then turn it back off when you get to the destination. 

In the meantime I've been using the friendly Uber competitor, and so far it's worked like a charm. Thanks Uber, for encouraging me to check out other apps!

author: Lance J.
title: Avoid update - serious issues with current version.
content:
This "new" version of the Uber app has a serious issue where it pretty much wants you to give it rights to your exact location ALL the time - while you sleep, while you're at work, while you're driving your own car - literally ALWAYS. 

All-the-time GPS drains batteries, and I don't want to give Uber the right to sniff my every move every minute of the day. This is just stupid of Uber. 

I suggest you try some of excellent alternatives that don't abuse personal information.  Most of the same exact drivers work for the alternatives too, but without the troubling personal privacy practices offered by Uber.  And most alternatives, I have learned, are less expensive.  We all win!

Original Review: 
Since the app and service are tightly coupled, my review is for both. 

Overall, very good. Generally better than a cab. I have had one problem driver - crazy guy - but likely no less crazy than some cab drivers I have had. 

App could be easier to use, but it is quite good.

author: another customer lost to lyft
title: cancellation fee policy needs to improve
content: I've been an avid Uber user but lately my drivers are always one street off, even if I entered my location, and they now charge cancellation fees. I ordered an uber recently and immediately cancelled because I realized it had my location wrong. Boom. $5.15. Ok, sure, I order another one with a manually entered location this time. I watch my driver drive around for 15 min trying to find me (ETA was 3), and he would not pick up when I called. I could not cancel or I would be charged another fee. Eventually, he cancelled the ride and I used Lyft to get one in less than 2 minutes. I contacted uber wanting a refund but the best they could do was give me a $5 uber credit. Why would I want uber  credit when I won't be using it again?

author: Dregunnz
title: I shouldn't have to pay a charge when the driver doesn't even want to pick me up
content: I requested an uber after the gym at around 1 am. After he accepted the ride he calls me and tells me that he won't be driving me. I called him numerous times to see if she can cancel because I don't want to be charged,but he kept hanging up. I walked home, which took about 40 minutes. I noticed when I got home that he finally cancelled the ride after driving about 4 miles away from me. Then Uber decides to deduct $5 from my credit card to compensate the driver. Are you serious? How is it my fault he kept hanging up and clearly stated he would not drive me. After this I am no longer using uber

author: Weather pain
title: Location always on!
content:
Location is always on! Make it so it's "while you are using the app only" or you'll get a one star rating forever from me! Stop stalking me!!!!

Update: Ok, I'm sick of this app updating all of the time just to clear bad reviews. I would give you zero stars for that if I could! 

Apple needs to look into your app and see if you are actually updating/fixing anything because I don't see any changes after I update!

author: User Acceptance Tester
title: Flawed app
content:
Inefficient pick up

Rider's app is allowed to send and driver's app is allowed to receive such a poor quality pick-up data (wrong addresses due to pin dropping, wrong side of the street, wrong pick-ups in alleyways, block ranges instead of street numbers, etc.), that the rider has to confirm the address over the phone for the driver to manually enter it into Waze or Google maps.

The riders are still not allowed to submit their photos for easier pick-ups, so they sometimes have to call and tell the driver who to look for.

Riders sometimes have to google to find out what particular makes and models look like, since uber will not provide them with a clear picture and color of the vehicle - they only get the picture of the driver's face. 

Substandard ETA estimates by Uber navigation have riders rushing out of the door or waiting outside.

Safety: Riders can't request the trip only from those drivers who submitted their fingerprints for taxicab-style background check.

Safety issues during the trip

There is no appropriate driver's vetting and mandatory security video monitoring  during the ride to assure the rider's safety. 

Inconvenient, inefficient tipping
Lack of in-app option forces riders to use third party apps (Square Cash, Venmo or Paypal) for tipping, which is tedious for both riders and drivers.

Other problems

The riders are forced to share their location with Uber 24/7.

Also, I'm no longer able to rate drivers, since after turning off location tracking there's a nag screen every time one opens or returns to the app, and that nag screen blocks the page where typically one would rate the driver right after a trip (dismissing the nag screen also dismissed the rating screen, which is a major design flaw). Uber has officially gone from hit-and-miss to terrible. And, on top of that, now Uber wants access to your contacts as well as your location. Pass.

author: Miah B
title: Terrible
content: I use uber at least 4 times out of the week going and coming trips. If it's not that I am getting double charged it's that I am getting triple charged. They gave me a $5 credit for a bad experience with a drive and two days after it was gone and they charged me full fair to then tell me in a week they will credit my banks account back the $5! Ridiculous! Most of the drivers I have had are either rude, drive reckless or they pick me up two blocks from my home and I have to walk to the car. Some Uber drivers have no sense of direction even with gps. I waited one time about an hour for a pick up because he couldn't find me. Another experience my driver spoke no English and didn't know where he was going. I can honestly say I been using uber for 4 months And I rather take a regular taxi. I am thinking of switching to lyft but reading there reviews I don't know who is worst. Oh let me not forget how one uber driver called me one time couldn't find me hung up canceled the trip I was charged then another uber showed up. Unprofessional rude this was not the first time I would say this had to be the 3rd time! Uber just lets anyone work for them!

author: Petrovafossil
title: Uber is Over
content:
If the constant flood of bad news out of corporate weren't enough to turn me off, the driver rating system has done the job. Every time I get in an Uber, I feel like I'm having tea with the queen, I'm so worried about offending the driver. 

 But drivers will agree to pick you up from the hospital and then ding you because your child is in pain after surgery. Or they ding you because the traffic is bad on your trip. A good percentage of the time it is basically like riding with your cranky, bachelor great-uncle who is obsessed with his car and hates kids etc. In part I think Uber is so crappy to its drivers their only release is ding passengers for things beyond the passengers control (crosstown traffic is awful, but I can't control that).

Anyway, why would I pay for that abuse? I am always on time, always where I'm supposed to be, always polite, don't eat drink or phone and I tip. I take my role as a good passenger seriously but in the end it just makes me feel tense and I avoid taking Uber. The kind of people who care are driven away by this system and your corporate reputation.

author: Cracker903
title: Awful customer service
content: A driver messed up my carpool ride and cancelled the trip when we first dropped off the other person who we carpooled with. He drove us through weird streets in the OPPOSITE direction (15 minutes away) from our drop off location. He sat there for 5 minutes looking at his phone, then tried kicking us (my friend and me) out of his car (the driver barely spoke English so it was hard to communicate.) We told him he should honor his mistake and drive us directly to our initial drop off location, but he refused and YELLED at us! My friend and I finally got out of the car because at this point we were in that spot in his car for 10 minutes. He was being rude and greedy yelling at us to order the ride again but we refused. He left us there STRANDED. When I had first requested pool, the amount said $5.99. When I got out of his car, Uber had charged me $9.29! I contacted customer service and told them about my issue and experience, and they refunded me $2!!! I had to message them again stating I wanted to be FULLY reimbursed before they did something about it. Untrustworthy drivers and poor customer service. Use LYFT instead. A lot more friendly drivers and customer service is excellent! Sometimes the price runs a little higher but you get what you pay for!

author: pgk2008
title: Invasive GPS tracking policy even after many user complaints
content:
Location tracking is all or nothing with Uber. Normal apps offer "track only when using", but Uber demands "Always track". If the past year has taught us anything, it's "don't trust Uber to do the right thing". 

It looks like they're not in a hurry to listen to customers' complaints, since we're at least fourteen updates in since I started paying attention to the GPS issue. It also seems like they abuse the app update system. Weekly 170MB updates with no change log. That's half a gig per month, thanks guys..

Partial workaround for tracking: disable GPS for the Uber app, and only turn it back on if you absolutely need to use the app. And then turn it back off when you get to the destination. 

In the meantime I've been using the friendly Uber competitor, and so far it's worked like a charm. Thanks Uber, for encouraging me to check out other apps!
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 开发者回复：Feedback such as this will only improve the app and experience with Uber. Let us know more by heading to t.uber.com/contact. We'll be sure to follow up with you from there.

author: G-Mo
title: Great service, Sick of fake reviews
content:
These fake reviews are ridiculous. Uber's policy doesn't allow tipping, never did. I have a 4.82 rating with no tipping. I don't use Lyft because they allow tipping (which is inconvenient), and spam you with marketing notifications. Location tracking "even when you're not using the app" is to help insure you're picked up and dropped off properly, which is clearly explained when you turn it on (to extend the tracking a few minutes beyond your pick up or drop off, it needs this permission from iOS).

I hate the lack of release notes, so I'd rate it one star for that except that I feel the need to counteract the other reviews, and I do use and like the service. So, Uber, include release notes so your app's ratings can go up, because people that actually use your app and leave reviews also read the release notes. No release notes means we won't leave a review so you'll just get the crap reviews you've been getting.

author: Whyamihere
title: Adios
content:
You took away the option of sharing location only while using the app. Guess what's easier than having to go into my settings every time to re-enable location and disable location?? ...using Lyft from now on. Put location sharing back to the user's choice.
ADDITIONALLY, I consider this company to be a bunch of scumbags for releasing a new update every few days to wipe out the negative reviews. There are no real updates to the app. If there were it would be from listening to the rage of their users and giving back the option of location while only using the app. And I'll continue to give 1 star until they do.

Update: Uber recently sent an email "noticing" that I disabled location for the App. Well no crap, that's what happens when you don't care about user privacy. I'm sure they had to send out a lot of those emails to others. My location will remain disabled until they bring back the option for only when using the app, and my business continues to go to Lyft.

title: Adios

author: bicoastalgirl
title: Be more upfront with pricing!
content: As a new Uber user due to the new benefit from my American Express, I was excited about using Uber. But, today I found out that after I price out my ride that the price you quote me is the price AFTER my credit has been applied. Not only that but I also had an additional $15 referral credit. Annoyed because I thought my ride was $4 and I could use my credit but instead my ride was $19 and you deducted the $15 credit which left me to pay $4 for the ride. Then you deducted the $4 from my other $15 credit. Ridiculous. And I didn't realize or see a breakdown until my trip was over and I got my receipt. Had I known my ride was $19 for the short distance I was going I would've never booked it or chose to spend my credit that way, which is probably why you do this to deceive your riders about pricing. I should have been allowed to see how much the ride was before I applied my credit so I could judge for myself whether I should book the ride or not. But, you decided to not show me the price of the ride. YOU NEED TO SHOW US HOW MUCH A RIDE IS BEFORE APPLIED CREDITS!!!!!! What you do is SO misleading when it comes to price. Get with it! Now I know why I never tried Uber because of all your issues and hidden pricing. Your losing customers so fix this!

author: gordonf238
title: Stay Away!
content:
Uber is simply not what it used to be. The app no longer shows when Surge Pricing is in effect. You are essentially quoted a different price for the same route every time. It's like black magic. No consistency or transparency. Uber's drivers have been complaining to me about their dropping pay, and urging me to try alternatives like Juno. In the last year, whenever I'd request a ride, there was roughly a 50/50 chance that the driver would actually show up, as many drivers (upon being hailed through he app) would drive in a direction away from my pick up location. I later learned that this is a form of protest from Uber drivers in response to their dropping pay. By driving away from your pick up location, they would leave the passenger stranded, forcing he to cancel the ride, which would then yield a small payment to the driver. Uber's cars are also not what they used to be. You'd normally get a newer model vehicle that's clean. In the last year, more and more of their vehicles have been neglected and drivers have been more and more unhappy. Last but not least, after deciding to write this review here on the App Store, I've noticed duplicate 5-star reviews by users with random alphanumeric usernames praising Uber and offering coupon codes. These are word-for-word duplicates no doubt designed to raise this app's freefall rating. 

Best of luck Uber. I've since decided to spend my money on better alternatives.

author: Zuoan
title: Terrible
content:
Uber app tracks you location even if you are not using it. Combining this with the todays report that uber tried to track your identity even after you deleted its app in 2015, I can clear see that this is a really shady company.

Latest update (may 15) still has all or nothing for location privacy setting. Really terrible.

author: liber8
title: From OK to bad to egregious: invades privacy despite user requests
content: Uber continues its downward spiral and has lost my trust (and that of countless users). The perpetual location tracking in the recent versions is totally unacceptable. Making matters worse, they have *removed* the option to use iOS's native privacy controls to allow location tracking only while using the app. Lyft respects users' privacy, unlike Uber. Also, I'm no longer able to rate drivers, since after turning off location tracking there's a nag screen every time one opens or returns to the app, and that nag screen blocks the page where typically one would rate the driver right after a trip (dismissing the nag screen also dismissed the rating screen, which is a major design flaw). Uber has officially gone from hit-and-miss to terrible. And, on top of that, now Uber wants access to your contacts as well as your location. Pass.

author: Lippydippyd
title: 171mb?
content: Why so big?  Seriously this is a Transit app, not Wikipedia. How about trying to optimize it a little?  Seems to be going up by 10mb/week now.

author: JToma
title: Simply Amazing
content: Uber has changed my life. Truly. I don't drive nearly as much anymore. Saves on gas and keeps the mileage down on my car. Never have to bother looking for parking downtown or at large events. Never have to get behind the wheel after consuming alcohol. Always on time. I've never once had a bad experience or driver, in fact I've met some really cool and interesting people in the process. I get picked up in a flash, unlike waiting forever on traditional taxi drivers like in the past. The fares are very reasonable and much cheaper than large taxi companies. The convenience and ease of use with my iPhone and Apple Watch is just awesome. This is the future. Less driving. Less cars on the road. Safety. Thank you Uber!

author: Rinks361
title: Lyft instead
content: Terrible! Horrible! Overrated! If these words sound familiar it's because they're famously tossed around by Trump in regards to anyone or anything that stands against him. However these words couldn't be more "truer" for Uber. I'll use all the best words to describe why. You see they - Uber - the people who run this, "business," support Trump. And as of such, because of this, the Uber-Trump alliance, drivers have become unpresidently very ignorant towards specific people. In additional, including their Exchange Leasing program, there are never any, and I mean any, cars to lease. Months and months of waiting. Nothing. Zilch. Nada. Terrible business people. Horrible. Businesses aren't supposed to be ran this way. Terrible service. What's even worse is the people - if they really are people, I mean come on. These people type email responses like they're from a third world country. Sound like it too when you're on the phone with them. Terrible. More jobs we could have for our American citizens. The legal ones. So and as such, then, I advise you to get Lyft. It's so much better. The most betterest app there is. Make transporting with complete strangers great again.

author: DanielleMargaret
title: Rip off
content: Be careful. If an Uber driver misses a turn and decides to cancel a ride, they'll charge you $5.00. I stood on the corner of a street immediately next to a parking lot, making it easier for a driver to turn into the lot to pick me up. The driver missed the turn, cancelled the ride and then claimed they waited for me for the requisite 5 minutes. I watched the driver on the GPS approach the intersection from a couple miles away, pass the light then cancel the ride while still driving and they charged me the $5.00. I fought the charge, Uber responded quickly that the driver waited 5 minutes and I would still be charged. I, of course, responded back quickly that's not what happened, explained the driver canceled while driving (something I'm guessing they can verify and should have before charging me). They refunded my money but they don't do a good enough job holding their drivers accountable. A few months ago, I was asked to pay a driver cash "for their troubles" after a friend left their cell phone and airport bags in the Uber car (I called my friend's phone trying to help track her down)... eventually I drove my friend to meet the driver (at midnight in an empty Amtrack parking lot) and had to pay her "for her troubles" to get the bags and phone back. I haven't used Lyft yet, but I now plan to. Enough already. I started using Uber because I was getting scammed by cabs... hopefully Lyft is better.

author: Rob Hackett
title: Poor tracking across borders
content:
I don't use the app very much, but I do use it when I travel. I had used it a couple of times in America, then a couple of times in China, then in Dubai, then in America. After that, my account was frozen. 

There were no problems with payment or any fraud, so I'm not sure why my account was blocked. Nobody at the company's customer service center can tell me why either. I think if you travel across borders too often you are flagged as a potential fraudulent user. Be careful and stay in one country when you use this app.  

Otherwise, it's a decent enough app.  Not great compared to others, but acceptable.

author: Papa Chanoli
title: New app hurts both drivers and passengers
content:
I drive for Uber, from San Francisco  to the Central Valley of California and everywhere in between. One problem drivers encounter a lot is the app placing the pickup pin differently from where the passenger actually is. Savy passengers know, (knew) this and moved the pin directly to where they knew the driver could get to them. In a city like San Francisco this can be a huge safety factor as well as a major issue for the quality of the experience for the passenger.    

This app takes that option away. Perfect example...a passenger at a grocery store requested a ride from me yesterday. Map software looks at the pin and gets you as close a it can. In this case, I was directed to the loading dock behind the store. The passenger said he was already standing in the front of the store when he set up and requested the ride. He was a very experienced uber customer and knew the nuances of how to use the app well.

How can this be a good thing?

This alone wastes time for both the driver and passenger. It reduces the quality of the ride experience for both the driver and passenger. It creates safety issues in areas of cities where the back alleys may be a lot more dangerous than the main streets.

The app does more to make the driving experience more difficult,  but these are the issues I see affecting riders, from the perspective of a driver who actually cares what the ride experience is like for passengers.

author: Lance J.
title: Avoid upgrade - serious issues with current version.
content:
Watch out - the "new" version of the Uber app has a serious issue where it pretty much wants you to give it rights to your exact location ALL the time - while you sleep, while you're at work, while you're driving your own car - literally ALWAYS. 

All-the-time GPS drains batteries, and I don't want to give Uber the right to sniff my every move every minute of the day. This is just stupid of Uber. 

I suggest you try some of excellent alternatives that don't make the same private data management error.  Most of the same exact drivers work for the alternatives too, but without the troubling personal privacy practices offered by Uber.  And most alternatives, I have learned, are less expensive.  We all win!

Original Review: 
Since the app and service are tightly coupled, my review is for both. 

Overall, very good. Generally better than a cab. I have had one problem driver - crazy guy - but likely no less crazy than some cab drivers I have had. 

App could be easier to use, but it is quite good.

author: ASA505
title: Location
content:
Can you please switch the location service or add a third option like many app (While using the app) 
Instead of the two currently we have (Never or Always) 
Thanks
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 开发者回复：We appreciate the feedback. Let's connect. Send a quick note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll follow up with you.

author: Tony_AZ
title: Pervy uncle location tracking / predatory
content:
Their support just blows you off!!!

Consider the other guys!
Gee, maybe you should not have my GPS records since then you would know where my doctors office is, then you could seek out my medical records. lol uber is a joke these days.

Poor service that has gotten ruder and ruder.
Poor user interface.
Poor ethics.
Problematic location tracking!! And drains the battery.

Apple, is this really the type of app you want in the store??

Criminal behavior.  Apple - remove from "essentials".  Stories about Apple CEO lecturing Uber do not impress, take action!

Not a consumer friendly company.
Will my location data get hacked when Uber gets hacked?
Why do you need my location when not using the app???

PRIVACY CONCERN!!  And app quality getting worse not better.  Go with the other guys.

Apple- this app should be removed from "essentials" as nobody needs a battery draining 24/7 location tracker to hail a ride sharing service.  This is not essential to anyone...

Uber, the update you tried to sneak past us right before thanksgiving changes the location services to being able to track me even when not using the app.  That is unacceptable.  Just deleted the app and will NOT be using Uber anymore.  #badpolicy #shameful Really a step backwards for Uber.

author: Ital Stew
title: Nightmarish experience!!!
content: I have just deleted my Uber account, after having one hellish experience after another. It's only been a few months since I've been using the app. The drivers are unprofessional, rude and think they're doing you a favor. I don't know what type of screening process the drivers go through, but the bar needs to be raised. I could go on and on about each and every trip I took, each and every time there was a problem of some sort. The fares are quite high considering, and quite frankly I'd prefer to take a regular taxi in my city. They are more professional, and they need to make money too! Uber is taking money out of the working man's mouth! So I've decided to keep it strictly roots and go back to the basics. There's no problem at hailing a regular taxi in my city. The streets are full of them thanks to Uber!

author: AlexP916
title: Uber is Evil.
content:
If you thought Google is evil, Uber is worst. They should be ashamed of themselves with the way they operate.

Update: 
Stop tracking us!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Uber should be banned by Apple for doing so, Apple shouldn't even allow having "no option" to just allow when using. All apps should require this. Uber is taking full advantage of it!!!! It draining my battery, and it's evil on their part. They are acting like it's really speeding up some data when it's on when doing the same thing after turning it on and off. I really believe they just want to use that data for other reasons. Sometimes I forget to turn location off and it's F'ing annoying!!!! I shouldn't need to go to my settings every time I'm done using it.

Update 2:
This guy who wrote review saying "tips create war between drivers and riders..." have no idea what's he talking about or understand how Uber Driver app works. No they don't wait until you tip or not. Unlike this app, drivers need to rate quickly in order to get another request and keep working. Stop making up fake stories. With Taxis, you can also tip. SMH!

author: D. G. Car
title: Bad customer service and discriminatory policies
content: The last straw was their policies. It seemed pretty unfair that they only enable some of their users to buy passes. I had a high rating and had used it more than some friends, but while several people were able to buy passes, the company just stated they were only able to offer limited passes. I understand offering limited passes, but when people I know are buying passes at the same time as me, and some have bought more than one while I am seeing that the company "is out of passes" at the exact same time, that seems very unfair. Uber doesn't care about employees, customers or even frequent customers. (I deleted my account.) It doesn't care about laws, safety, fair policies, etc. - as it's demonstrated, it only cares about the money.

author: raz673
title: No reason for location services change
content:
Update: This review will be posted every time there is a "bug fix" update that doesn't do anything other than remove bad reviews until their stance on unnecessarily tracking riders changes. 

There's absolutely no reason for Uber to track my location AFTER the ride is over. I do not want to share my location with Uber all the time, but now that's the only way to use the app. It's a completely sketchy move that does not benefit the user in any way. You can have an incredibly accurate, reliable app with the "Only While Using" location services option. 

The only real reason I can see for this is Uber wants to track user movements and sell the analytics to the highest bidder, which is deplorable.

author: Mallard06
title: Horrible use of location services
content: How about adding a feature to only track users while they are using the app.  This is a massive invasion of privacy. 1 star until you fix location services.

author: ,,l, (^_^) ,l,,
title: Only because I can't give it zero starts
content: Never came for my pregnant wife looking to go to hospital while I was at work and charged her for not showing up while she was outside waiting. Never use them again LFYT for now on.

author: Slavin4u
title: Location Always? - Use Lyft!
content:
Why do you need my location? It kills my battery and I don't want you to know where I am always! 

I use Lyft because of this feature alone!

author: Hdhsvsveodowcwyc
title: Uber is a terrible company
content: Background tracking all the time. Super sketchy company. Don't use.

author: Mallard06
title: Privacy nightmare
content: The crisis in leadership at Uber has manifested itself in this company's inability to listen to its employees, drivers and customers. Since Uber began forcing users to 'Always' allow location services, countless customers have complained.  In typical Uber fashion, expediency has overruled compassion and empathy and customer complaints have been ignored. Stop telling customers that you are interested in their feedback if you're just going to ignore it.  Boycotting this app until the fix this.

author: Byronic_Hero
title: Silly update
content:
Interface has been changed for the sake of change. Now it's just less user-friendly and is missing the pin to show the GPS where you exactly are when it gets it wrong (OK maybe you can still do this somehow, but if you can't figure it out in five seconds then it's UI failure). 

Another casualty of the new app is the lost ability to quickly scroll to any town you can possibly think of and instantly tell if there is Uber available there or not. When planning for our honeymoon I would just slide the map pin over to whatever city in Portugal we were planning on visiting and I would instantly get an idea of how available ubers were in that area. It was great. I just tried to do the same thing to prep for my work trip to Manchester UK... And nothing. Now I have to go outside of the app to figure out whether I can rely on Uber there or not. Thanks guys… I understand the drive to make iterative changes to your app, but please don't go around breaking things that work. My honest assessment of this version is the loss of some great functionality with no discernible gain in features :(

author: MGhostSoft
title: Watch out overcharges!!
content:
When you search the airport of your city, check the route carefully because possibly the destination is set to the middle of a runway and the route is several miles longer than it should be. As a result, you're paying $4~$6 extra for the distance you won't travel. I reported to Uber several month ago and never heard back.

And, do they think people are used to the "Always on" location tracking? No reason for me to allow them to track my location 5 minutes after drop off, and no reason to trust them only doing what the claimed to do.

And, people like me still haven't forgotten that Uber requested hundreds of Lyft cars then cancelled them and did so again and again. What a mean company.

Not that I'm still using this app. In fact, I have not used it ever since I found the overcharging trap. Not to mention the location tracking. I'm just keeping this app installed so that I can get back and leave a 1-star review whenever it is updated.

author: App Critic and Criticism
title: DO NOT DOWNLOAD
content:
Just in case you weren't aware, Uber tracks you location 24 hours 7 days a week. Not when you use the app or when you order a ride, but every second of your day. 
Plus, they were recently caught breaking the law and tracking your location AFTER YOU DELETE THE APP. 
If you are in need of a ride sharing app, please just download one of the many other available options, like Lyft for example. Even taking a traditional taxi is better than being illegally stocked, and personal data being stolen from you with out your consent or knowledge.

Uber disgusts me

author: Yecampos
title: The Uber Scam
content: This app is a scam! I resorted to using uber since lyft had its prime time rate and I was in no rush too get to work so I figured I would download the uber app and it resulted in a colossal mistake! The app was set to uber pool which was fine since I figured I had time to spare and work wasn't that far, boy was I wrong. The driver was 5 mins away, at first, they didn't move from there spot for 4 mins then the app told me that they where picking up another passenger and it would be 6 mins before my pick. Keep in mind I wasn't in a rush so I waited the 6 mins, but when I looked back on the app the car hadn't moved since the first time it was said to pick me up and the app still said it was 6 mins away and my route time started to get worse since traffic started to pick up! I canceled and was charged two dollars for nothing!!! My time was the one wasted, it seemed like that was there form of getting money, and they make u pay for nothing! Do not get this app!!

author: Greeted Urchin
title: Battery draining and intrusive location tracking
content:
Uber is desperately trying to get rid of its bad reviews with these frequent, useless updates. Uber wants access to my location at all times even when I'm not using the app. The only options in location services: "Always" or "Never".  Every other app allows me to select "While Using". 
How intrusive - Uber was working fine before and didn't require this. 
Even if I didn't care about being tracked at all times, this invasive tracking feature was draining my battery faster and adding to my data usage. 
Lyft doesn't require this. No, you may not have access to my location when I'm not using the app. I deleted the Uber app and have been using Lyft for my taxi needs.  Lyft is just as good as Uber used to be and they seem to respect people's location preferences.

author: Anonymous User 23579
title: Lyft is better
content: Uber took away the option to track location only when using the app. Now the only options are either allow Uber to always track your location even when not using the app, or to never allow Uber to track your location in which case the app doesn't work properly. I also don't like how I can't tip drivers from within the app so that it gets charged to my credit card. Fortunately, Lyft allows tracking location only when using the app and allows tipping drivers using their app. So I use Lyft now instead.

author: Upset about Uber
title: Uber=SCAM
content: The discount offer as a first-time user never worked. Because it was a lame fraudulent fake-publicity hook. The very first time I requested a driver, it took 15 min. to order, just to get a message saying the "driver canceled the trip, please request another trip". I closed the app and never used it again. Later, I received a message saying I was charged $5. I thought it must have been an error, since I never received the services. After emailing Uber requesting a refund, they explained it was part of their "terms & conditions" to charge me (regardless if they provided the services or not). However, they were "kind" enough to offer it as a credit to my account on my next ride. They lied again, it never happpened. Therefore, I decided to cancel Uber once and for all. Be aware, they are a company of white-collar criminals.

author: maplebeam
title: refuse to take responsibility for their drivers
content:
I had a very negative experience last night. The driver waited about 30 minutes before texting me (he didn't answer any of my calls) and said something was wrong with his app and asked me to cancel my ride (for which I was charged a cancellation fee of $5). The next driver was fine, but because I had waited so long for the first driver to respond I missed an important business appointment. I requested a refund for the cancelled trip and the following trip. Uber credited my account $5 (not a refund) and refused to refund the $27 of the trip that finally got me to where I was going. 

Extremely poor customer service. Deleting my app.

author: Whateveropolis
title: Always on location access
content: Nope. You don't get to track me all the time.

author: BubbaJoeBobMac
title: Uber Arrogance
content: Always on location tracking is unacceptable. There is no justification to exclude the option for customers to choose "while using." Luckily it appears Apple is paying attention and it is rumored that the next release of iOS will remove the ability for developers to exclude the "while using" option. author: legitdanen
title: Two stars is nice.
content: Uber is a useful app, however, none of the drivers know how to use their brain. There could be a driver down the street from you and the one from the other side of town is the one that accepts to pick you up. As if people wanna wait 30 minutes for an uber driver when one could wait 5 minutes for one. People use this app to go to work and get places. Uber drivers should be more considerate of the fact that people have to be certain places in a timely manner. Not everyone has time to wait 30 minutes to be picked up. If Uber had an actual manager to go to I have plenty of Uber complaints about drivers.

author: manhattanIovestory
title: $20 coupon: 87DА3
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride!!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the promotions tab on the app and enter the coupon there. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing!!! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button!!! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic!!! I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away.

author: Hella.Killa
title: Better than Lyft
content:
Uber is better than Lyft. 

My only issue with Uber is that recently I left my cell phone in a drivers car. I contacted the driver and he said he had my phone. I asked him if he would mail it to me since he claimed he was working 60 miles from my home. He asked who would pay for postage and I told him I would pay him for it however he prefer Venmo or Paypal etc... then he told me he was too busy to go to the post office and that he would not do that. So I asked him to drop it off at any hotel, again he refused. He told I'd have to pay him 60 dollars or request another Uber to bring me the phone. But he told me he was working in North Logan, Utah and he could meet me. I went with a friend 60 miles from Orem, Utah and to get my phone. One I got there he told me he was too busy and could not meet me. After about 30 minutes of trying to get him to meet me anywhere for just 2 minutes, he said he was in Park City. It was not until I Uber contact him and I sent him a message letting him know that if I did not get my phone back I would be contacting the police. After which he agreed to leave it at the police statation in Salt Lake City. I went there the next day after driving 120 to North Logan and back home for no reason, only to discover that it was instead at the Murray, Utah police station. I did get my phone but Uber refused to refund me as I requested.

author: appleuser392588
title: GPS always on
content: Provide a GPS option for "only while using app". Uber has poor privacy governance history.

author: HS7
title: GROSSLY OVERCHARGING RIDERS
content:
As a driver, I'm able to view what the rider pays and the breakdown between ubers commission, black car fund (NYC), sales tax, and obviously my payout. 

Ubers Payouts in NYC used to be 25% commission and 8.875% black car fund. Lately they have been overcharging the rider and paying the driver as little as 50%. 

I've had trips where the driver payout is $14 but rider is charged $26. Ubers commission alone is $10. For another ride, the total fare was $106, Uber commission was $33. The reason why this happens is Uber grossly miscalculates the route, or outright OVERCHARGES the rider. They do this on X rides to subsidize their pool rides. Honestly it is such a shame, such sleazy tactics. If we use faster routes, Uber ends up keeping the difference, rather than crediting the passenger or paying the driver. According to this, it is in our best interest to take the LONGEST possible route. 

Do yourself a favor as a rider and calculate the mileage and time driven. Then look at your overall cost. The rates are listed publicly I'm each region. YOU WILL BE SHOCKED AT HOW MUCH MONEY THEY'RE TAKING. It's straight manipulative, deceptive and demeaning. This has to change and stop. 

On top of that their support downright disgusting; they have a system where as soon as they respond to a question it is selected as RESOLVED. I've had completed Quests where I have not received my bonus, they listed as resolved and say wait 24-48 hours, after that they say wait till next pay statement, how is this issue resolved if I haven't received the funds nor is it reflected in the balance? It should instead say responded, or replied back to. 

UNBIASEDLY this is the WORST rideshare company. Everything I have said is OBJECTIVELY true.

author: fugly_mofo
title: Bad Uber - Don't Track Me
content:
Well, I hope chopping the head off of the evil Uber beast helps to bring a semblance of privacy back to the app. 

Tracking us while NOT using the app? No thanks!

Tracking us even when we've deleted Uber app from our phones? Wow... a new standard of evil. Congrats Travis, I hope you enjoy your "time off" :P

author: ex-slither addict
title: Deleting Uber and Using Lyft
content: This app has a incredibly horrible customer service. They overly protect their drivers. I have had a driver stop to the gas station at 10pm in a very urban area, leave me in the car and still expect a 5 star rating. I have had an uber driver take an hour and a half to get me to my destination when I was only 12 minutes away from the designated destination. I have also had the experience of being charged $5 for a false cancelation fee. I was waiting for my driver for 20 minutes outside, but not once did they appear to my pickup. I was then charged a cancellation fee and then given the $5 as credit. As many times as I have tried to get a refund for each of these events, uber support has failed each time and show no remorse for their actions. Therefore, I will now take Lyft as a confident alternative.

author: ufasfhkj368
title: $20 coupon: nealej1
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “nealej1" to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: mfgdog
title: Are you listening, Uber?
content: How Uber can keep reading all of their customers' frustrations and ignore them is amazing to me. Keeping location always on is a violation of privacy and a drain on battery life. They need to set more policies about drivers cancelling trips. People have been asking to be able to tip drivers for how long now?? And when will you change the current horrible logo back to the "U". As my grandmother would say, "You threw your candy in the dirt." Au revoir.

author: Acostal751
title: Terrible
content: Uber does not care about its riders or drivers just about making their money. I've had an incident where I was trying to get home after a long day of work and the driver they linked me to did not want to pick me up due to the construction in the area. He kindly told me he would cancel and I agreed. Once it was canceled I requested another ride. I did and surprise, I was linked to the same driver that canceled on me who was much farther away now. He called me again and let me know he would cancel again which he did. At this point the app is on the home screen no rides or requests have been made. I used lyft instead so that I wouldn't be bothered with connecting with the same uber driver again. Imagine how upset I was after already being in my lyft ride to get a call from another uber driver stating he is at my pick up. I DID NOT REQUEST ANOTHER RIDE AFTER BEING CANCELED ON TWICE. I was charged a cancellation fee for a ride I never requested and tried multiple times to contact uber help about this issue, which they blatantly ignored me. They even deleted the help messages I have sent because it is no longer available for me to see it. I had to call my bank to dispute the charge. This is not the only problem I have but it is the most upsetting. I've heard bad stories from drivers as well. My recommendation is to stay away from uber and use lyft.

author: liber8
title: From OK to bad to horrible, invades privacy, ignores users' wishes
content: Uber continues its downward spiral and has lost my trust. The perpetual location tracking in the recent versions is unacceptable. Making matters worse, they have *removed* the option to use iOS's native privacy controls to allow location tracking only while using the app. Lyft respects users' privacy, unlike Uber. Also, I'm no longer able to rate drivers, since after turning off location tracking there's a nag screen every time one opens or returns to the app, and that nag screen blocks the page where typically one would rate the driver right after a trip (dismissing the nag screen also dismissed the rating screen, which is a major design flaw). Uber has officially gone from hit-and-miss to terrible. And, on top of that, now Uber wants access to your contacts as well as your location. No thanks.

author: Sara3bey
title: Wants access to my location at all times, no thanks.
content: I only had this app on my phone for my husband, since I stopped using Uber after a very uncomfortable & bazaar interaction with a driver. Today he sent me his trip so I can see whether he'll be stuck in traffic, or home any minute. I opened the Uber app and it prompted me to let Uber access my location even when I'm not using the app, so of course I declined. After that it would not allow me to do anything with the app such as track my husbands ride home, unless I change my location settings to always allow them to access my location. I even tried turning it on and it still wouldn't show me my husbands ride. Waste of time and invasion of privacy, I'll stick with Lyft.

author: MGhostSoft
title: Watch out overcharges!!
content:
When you search the airport of your city, check the route carefully because possibly the destination is set to the middle of a runway and the route is several miles longer than it should be. As a result, you're paying $4~$6 extra for the distance you won't travel. I reported to Uber several month ago and never heard back.

And, do they think people are used to the "Always on" location tracking? No reason for me to allow them to track my location 5 minutes after drop off, and no reason to trust them only doing what the claimed to do.

And, people like me still haven't forgotten that Uber requested hundreds of Lyft cars then cancelled them and did so again and again. What a mean company.

Not that I'm still using this app. In fact, I have not used it ever since I found the overcharging trap. Not to mention the location tracking. I'm just keeping this app installed so that I can get back and leave a 1-star review whenever it is updated.

author: Iamdrell
title: Bad experience
content:
I've been using the app now for about 5 months because I recently moved to Georgia. I use my commuter benefits that I get through my employer which is pretty nice since I have a family of four and my wife normally takes the care to work. I was able to schedule rides using my commuter benefits card with the app until recently ( BAD UBER ). Using my benefits I experience longer wait times then someone using a debit or credit card which I don't mind but talking away the ability to schedule the ride in advance before going to work or an appointment was really helpful and now I'm stuck waiting on the ride of which several times had made me late thanks to some of the no count drivers who can't follow simple directions that I text then before even picking me up. This is such an inconvenience not being able to schedule rides just because I'm using my commuter benefits. It spends the same way and they have always gotten the money. This practice seems kind of discriminatory because your putting people who want to use those benefits as last on the totem pole and not giving the use to the dance features as everyone else. This is bad customer service and I do know what great customer service is because I do work for a very well respected and reputable company. 

Fix this....

author: manhattanIovestory
title: $20 coupon: 87DA3

Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing! The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. author: SPStakem
title: New version is a "downdate"
content:
I can honestly say I never wrote reviews, however I feel that it is prudent for me to do so. 

I'm a daily Uber user. I loved it before the new "upgrade". However this new update is terrible. They have now made it all "fancy" and "sleek" but removed functionality in doing so. 

It now forces me to put a destination before I can see what types of cars are available and what the fare rates are. I can't figure out a way to skip the "destination" request and I am very tech savvy so if I can't find it within 60 seconds then it either can't be done or it is a terrible design. 

The photo of the driver still remains very tiny! This needs to be made very big so we can see who is picking us up! It also doesn't show the color of the car nor a photo of what the car looks like. 

I really hope Uber realized that they should start from scratch and try to remake the interface.

title: Watch out overcharges!!
content:
When you search the airport of your city, check the route carefully because possibly the destination is set to the middle of a runway and the route is several miles longer than it should be. As a result, you're paying $4~$6 extra for the distance you won't travel. I reported to Uber several month ago and never heard back.
