author: VintonC
title: Quit tracking after my ride
content: The new feature that tracks me after my ride is over in unacceptable. This app has no acceptable reason to request my location after I'm dropped off. It shouldn't have access to my location until I request another ride.  The only choices given in location service are Always and Never. The While The App has been disabled.  Apparently spying on it's customers is more important than the maintaining the customers privacy and trust.

author: xsarahyu
title: ZERO STARS
content:
ABSOLUTELY LIVID

Here is the complaint I sent to Uber: "I called an Uber XL (for 6 people) and the driver arrived with a regular Uber; the car could only fit 4 people max. I asked the driver why he was here because I had called an XL and he looked annoyed and didn't give any response. I proceeded to ask again, to which he responded with, "It'll be a tight fit. You know the XL is just a label right?" He assumed our 6 people would squeeze into a car meant for 4. I repeated to the driver that I called an XL and that his car would not fit everyone. He looked at me and said, "Cancel the trip so I can leave." He drove off right away. I canceled the Uber and was wrongly charged $5.00. The driver was extremely unprofessional and rude. I would like a refund for the $5.00."

I sent expecting a refund as well as the driver to be reprimanded. BUT UBER RESPONDED WITH "In reviewing the details of the trip, we can confirm you were charged a cancellation fee appropriately."

How has the driver not been punished? It's ILLEGAL for 6 people to fit into a car meant for 4. 1 person would've ridden in the front and 5 in the back.

I contacted Uber again through its website (THEY DON'T HAVE A CUSTOMER SERVICE NUMBER) and they put $5 back into my account. No actual refund to my card. This was all done by an automated system; never a real person in contact with me.

I will never be riding with Uber again.

author: C B 324
title: Uber driver here
content: I am an Uber driver and I wish people knew how the terrible Uber driver app sets us up to fail by taking us to the wrong location to pickup. It also doesn't clarify what freeway to take- just days "go towards Los Angeles" etc, and takes us in pointless circles...all the time! The passenger is mad at us as soon as they get in the car which is not our fault. To top it off we're taking all the risk, with our cars, paying for every repair and many hundreds of $ for gas, and getting very low pay. I don't know why people think the pricing is high- as drivers we get less than what you pay, and think of the time and money we spend. I think the main thing I've learned from  this job is how the general public is so lacking in empathy. It's sad.

author: Whateveropolis
title: Inappropriate location access
content: Inappropriately demands "Always" location access

author: Uber everywhere!
title: Ride Pass
content:
Although Uber offers the ride passes(which is a great way to save money for regular Uber customers) drivers at the end of the trip once you use your ride pass charge you whatever they want to charge you with a bunch of hidden fees. This problem happens to me multiple times using on my pass. Upon requesting my trip my price states one thing but once I get out of the car the driver then does something because the rate is sometimes tripled the amount that I should be getting charged. I think that it's unfair that we pay up front fee for a pass but then the drivers can do whatever they want to do once we get out so that they can get more money...

I literally use Uber every day twice a day, and  this situation has me outraged and ready to delete my account! Nine hours has pass and I have not received a reply on a issue that I reported. This is terrible customer service on Uber's part

author: iPad Paul
title: Privacy Grab continues
content:
I keep checking with each update to see if the "Evil Empire" (as a friend of mine calls it) has stopped trying to track me everywhere I go, even when I'm not using the app. But not yet. The latest update requires that you either give Uber the ability to track you at all times even when you're not using the app, or that you not be able to use location services at all (which you really need to use Uber conveniently). There is no non-nefarious reason Uber needs to know where I go after I'm dropped off. 

Uber: why do you want to surveil me when I'm not using your app? Why do you want my phone and battery life and data to be working in the background while I'm not even using the app?

Why is it the Lyft app does not need this data? Their app works with location data only while using the app. Perhaps Uber should try and hire some of the Lyft folks over to Uber to learn how Lyft gets the job done without invading my privacy. 

The selfish and immature conduct by the Uber Exec and apparently a lot of folks in management is well documented, so why trust Uber data they don't need. I've switched to Lyft (which unfortunately has less cars and a smaller footprint) until this shady disrespect for my privacy is remedied.

author: matthius1
title: Now requires users to let Uber track them 24/7 even when not using the app
content:
Now I have to go to my privacy setting and toggle between "never" and "always" every time I want to use the app. Under no circumstances will I let Uber track my location 24/7. I set it to "never" again as soon as I'm in the car. This nonsense has already caused me to use another ride service twice since this version rolled out. 

This must be one of the worst "upgrades" ever accepted on the app store. The new (actually from another awful recent update) is incomprehensible and offers no benefit for the confusion it causes, and this version takes a steaming dump on users' privacy for no good reason. 

I really hope some one in Uber-land bothers to listen to their customers in the future. A quick look at the reviews for this version shows I'm not the only one who is upset about this! At this point it looks like Uber is just releasing new versions to try and bury the flood of negative reviews. 

On the bright side, I've been weaning myself off of Uber. Alternative ride share apps are only one tap away!

author: Monoskier_
title: Privacy Fail
content:
Nope. You still don't need my location once I end my ride. Fail.   You want your stars back? Gives us back the option of "While Using"

One reason I started using Uber because of the "no tipping". Since that was built into the rate, and now we have to tip, why haven't you reduced your rates to reflect the change?  Oh, that's right, your a shady company that has no respect for your employees or customers.
I'd rather walk than give you another dime. The only reason I keep the app around is to continue with the 1 star ratings.

author: heykarinakarina
title: CHOOSE LYFT!
content:
Horrible for both Drivers and Riders! Horrible! First children under the age of 18 are not allowed to ride unattended on Uber, but it's not enforced for many reasons. Tons of kids use it (probably 40% minimum of Uber's business is minor children) and I have now read from a review that Uber has family plans. How do you e plain this when they TOS says no minors riding alone. This is child endangerment, it's not like I haven't read the news of child trafficking rings on Uber. The reason it is not enforced... If a Driver reports a minor after giving them a ride, the Driver forfeits their fare. If a Driver reports them at pick up and cancels the ride, the driver is out the gas expense of traveling to the minor. Uber doesn't at all reimburse Drivers for doing the right thing of which they want to do but can't afford to. This makes me ill. This crap does not happen on Lyft. Generally people are happy on Lyft and people know that if a ride is cancelled, the driver is going to be reimbursed $5 gas money for coming to the pick up location.

But it is probably true that Uber wouldn't have any business if the minors were blocked from riding and people using other people's accounts were also blocked rides. They would have like zero rides every day.

author: asm511
title: Tips creates war between drivers and passengers
content:
One main reason I use Uber and have for years (VIP user) is because the cost has been equal to or less than NYC yellow taxis and the convenience of the service.
With the addition of tips they have now lost both of these advantages. Yellow taxis are much easier to flag on the street now that Uber has taken so many customers and have become an attractive option again.
The drivers now wait until you tip them to give a customer rating and rate low scores if you do not tip - low scores negatively affect the rider's ability to get rides!

author: liber8
title: Current version aggressively invades privacy
content: Uber continues its downward spiral and has lost my trust (and that of countless users). The perpetual location tracking in the recent versions is totally unacceptable. Making matters worse, they have *removed* the option to use iOS's native privacy controls to allow location tracking only while using the app. Lyft respects users' privacy, unlike Uber. Also, I'm no longer able to rate drivers, since after turning off location tracking there's a nag screen every time one opens or returns to the app, and that nag screen blocks the page where typically one would rate the driver right after a trip (dismissing the nag screen also dismissed the rating screen, which is a major design flaw). Uber has officially gone from hit-and-miss to terrible. And, on top of that, now Uber wants access to your contacts as well as your location. Pass.

author: Adam s z
title: Unusable and login UI is super confusing
content: I rarely rate any app but I had to give Uber app a 1-star. I suddenly cannot use the app to request rides and the app asked me to update my phone number--but I always had my number in my profile! When I try to update my phone number it said that my number has been used--what?! I tried to log out but cannot log in and the app threw me several meaningless error messages that looked like those for app developers. Eventually I still cannot use the app and it asked me to fill in a form to add my phone number back. How can I trust my personal data with Uber when you cannot even get this simple thing right? Sorry Uber, you just lost my business.

author: DMRDeL
title: Gett or Juno are better
content:
As with any organization that grows too fast, Uber has had a serious decline in good service. Unprofessional drivers are not concerned about consequences and riders are powerless. I asked a driver not to play music so I could have a conversation with the people I was riding with and the driver ignored me 4 times then had an attitude for remainder of the ride. 
It's nearly impossible to get in touch with someone. All riders can do is send a message. What about during a ride when a driver started driving erratically. All o could do was call my mom. He was angry bc I asked him not to use the phone while driving. 
I will not recommend uber to anyone and I'm going to have to stop using their service. 
Alternatives: Gett, Juno, Via

author: Hagahaisj
title: Stop!!
content:
Stop letting uber locate you whenever they want. Do not allow their location services to find you when you're not using the app. It crushes your battery and gives them the ability to locate you and sell the information they get to anyone they want. Tell them,
"No". Tell them you're not okay with them knowing where you sleep and where you are from 9-5 or 5-10. They only want this info so they can sell it. It, in no way, helps you get a ride out or home.

author: Whyamihere
title: Adios
content:
You took away the option of sharing location only while using the app. Guess what's easier than having to go into my settings every time to re-enable location and disable location?? ...using Lyft from now on. Put location sharing back to the user's choice.
ADDITIONALLY, I consider this company to be a bunch of scumbags for releasing a new update every few days to wipe out the negative reviews. There are no real updates to the app. If there were it would be from listening to the rage of their users and giving back the option of location while only using the app. And I'll continue to give 1 star until they do!

Update: Uber recently sent an email "noticing" that I disabled location for the App. Well no crap, that's what happens when you don't care about user privacy. I'm sure they had to send out a lot of those emails to others. My location will remain disabled until they bring back the option for only when using the app, and my business continues to go to Lyft.

Why is it the Lyft app does not need this data? Their app works with location data only while using the app. Perhaps Uber should try and hire some of the Lyft folks over to Uber to learn how Lyft gets the job done without invading my privacy.

author: RandiMD
title: From great to horrible, really fast!
content: I'm a relatively new Uber user, but I usually only use the app and service when I am in other cities.  Originally, tips were not required.  Now, I have gotten crappy reviews from two drivers because I was unaware that Uber started encouraging tips.  Who lets their "employees" RATE their customers?!  What a joke!  Also, the fact that Uber needs to know my location regardless of whether or not I'm using the app is 1) a serious invasion of privacy, and 2) a major battery drain.  I have decided to stop using Uber and go back to using taxi cabs.  Uber used to have a good service where it was all inclusive and you didn't have to worry about calculating a tip, etc, but now, I might as well use a taxi service, which is just as economical now, and have a company to call if I have a customer service issue, NOT the other way around.

author: pgk2008
title: Invasive GPS tracking policy even after many user complaints
content:
Location tracking is all or nothing with Uber. Normal apps offer "track only when using", but Uber demands "Always track". If the past year has taught us anything, it's "don't trust Uber to do the right thing". 

It looks like they're not in a hurry to listen to customers' complaints, since we're at least twelve updates in since I started paying attention to the GPS issue. It also seems like they abuse the app update system. Weekly 170MB updates with no change log. That's half a gig per month, thanks guys..

Partial workaround for tracking: disable GPS for the Uber app, and only turn it back on if you absolutely need to use the app. And then turn it back off when you get to the destination. 

In the meantime I've been using the friendly Uber competitor, and so far it's worked like a charm. Thanks Uber, for encouraging me to check out other apps!

author: Gorberg
title: Learn from my mistake, Don't get involved with uber..
content:
Do not get involved with this company. I find Uber's business practices to be sneaky and despicable. I'm not going to recommend this app from Uber. The Uber app pulls the resale value out of your car to Pay YOU. Uber needs to compensate and pay the drives real money, so they can fix and maintain there car's. Uber doesn't pay much to the drivers at all (Uber keeps about 60% of what the rider pay UBER). Once you consider your fuel cost, extremely high cost of ride-share car insurance, car maintenance and the terrible wear and tear on the car itself plus significant lose of value of your car at resale, especially because of the super high miles on your vehicle. The Uber app is a very bad deal for the drive. However the riders are getting a great deal on your dime and time.  Sorry for the bad new.

Here's a timeline of Uber's troubles so far this year.

- Jan. 28: After President Donald Trump releases his first executive order on immigration, New York taxi drivers protest by refusing to pick up passengers at Kennedy Airport for an hour. Some protesters say Uber tries to capitalize on the protest by picking up passengers anyway, prompting a Twitter protest urging people to delete Uber's app from their smartphones.

- Feb. 2: Uber CEO Travis Kalanick quits President Trump's council of business leaders amid mounting pressure from employees and customers over the immigration order.

- Feb. 19: A former Uber engineer, Susan Fowler, discloses sexual harassment and sexism claims in a blog post about her year at Uber. Fowler says her boss propositioned her and higher-ups ignored her complaints. Kalanick calls Fowler's accusations "abhorrent" and hires former U.S. Attorney General Eric Holder to investigate.

- Feb. 23: Waymo, a self-driving car company spun off from Google, sues Uber. Waymo alleges that Anthony Levandowski - a former top manager for Google's self-driving car project - stole pivotal technology from Google before leaving to run Uber's self-driving car division.

- Feb. 28: A video emerges of Kalanick arguing with an Uber driver. It includes yelling and profanity and ends with a combative Kalanick dismissing the agitated driver's claims that sharp reductions in fares forced him into bankruptcy. In an email to employees, Kalanick admits he needs leadership help. "I must fundamentally change as a leader and grow up," he says.

- March 3: The New York Times reveals that Uber used a phony version of its app to thwart authorities in cities where it was operating illegally. Uber's so-called Greyball software identified regulators who were posing as riders and blocked access to them. The U.S. Justice Department is investigating Uber's use of the Greyball software.

- March 19: Uber's president, Jeff Jones, resigns less than a year after joining the company. He tells the tech blog Recode that his approach to leadership is at odds with what he experienced at Uber.

- April 18: Sherif Marakby, a global vice president who leads Uber's self-driving car program, leaves the company.

- April 27: Levandowski announces he is stepping aside while Uber defends itself against the allegations from Waymo.

- May 11: A federal judge in San Francisco rejects Uber's request for arbitration and refers Waymo's case to the U.S. Attorney's office for a possible criminal investigation. Days later the judge bans Uber from using technology taken from Waymo, but doesn't order Uber to halt its self-driving vehicle program, as Waymo requested. The case is set for trial in October.

- May 26: Kalanick's mother dies in a boating accident. His father is seriously injured.

- May 30: Uber fires Levandowski.

- May 31: Uber's finance chief Gautam Gupta says he plans to leave the company in July.

- June 6: Uber fires 20 people after a law firm, Perkins Coie, investigates complaints of harassment, bullying and retaliation. That investigation, which was separate from Holder's, checked into 215 complaints; 57 are still under investigation.

- June 11: Uber's board meets with Holder and adopts a series of recommendations based on his report.

- June 12: Emil Michael, Uber's senior vice president for business and a close ally of Kalanick, leaves the company.

- June 13: Kalanick tells Uber employees that he's taking a leave for an unspecified period, but will be available for "the most strategic decisions." Uber's board releases Holder's recommendations, which include removing some of Kalanick's responsibilities and replacing Uber's chairman and founder, Garrett Camp, with an independent chairman. Holder also recommends many cultural and policy changes, from establishing an effective complaint process to recruiting more diverse applicants to prohibiting alcohol and drug use during core work hours.

author: Whyamihere
title: Adios
content:
You took away the option of sharing location only while using the app. Guess what's easier than having to go into my settings every time to re-enable location and disable location?? ...using Lyft from now on. Put location sharing back to the user's choice.
ADDITIONALLY, I consider this company to be a bunch of scumbags for releasing a new update every few days to wipe out the negative reviews. There are no real updates to the app. If there were it would be from listening to the rage of their users and giving back the option of location while only using the app. And I'll continue to give 1 star until they do.

Update: Uber recently sent an email "noticing" that I disabled location for the App. Well no crap, that's what happens when you don't care about user privacy. I'm sure they had to send out a lot of those emails to others. My location will remain disabled until they bring back the option for only when using the app, and my business continues to go to Lyft.
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 开发者回复：Feedback such as this will only improve the app and experience with Uber. Let us know more by heading to t.uber.com/contact. We'll be sure to follow up with you from there.

author: Skellt
title: Draconian location services
content: One star for not enabling the option of only using location services while app is in use. I only rarely use Uber and I don't need my battery drained by having location services on 24/7. Not to mention the privacy issues. Just give me the option to have the app find my location when I start it. Typing in my address is a horrible user experience.

author: achang001
title: Stop updating for the sake of updating without new features
content: Please stop doing this. It's wasting time and bandwidth to update the app without any new features. Please stop.

author: Mommymm
title: Uber is an UNTRUSTWORTHY company
content:
I've used Uber since the beginning, and what once was a well oiled machine of a company is now definitely coming to an end. It's no secret that Uber has its problems, yet I've been a long time supporter. But my support has gone from waning to none. The straw that broke the camels back was the fact that I was incorrectly charged and after reaching out to the company, I was brushed off. Basically it was my word against there's, and they chose to not honor my complaint or my word. My issue was that the original price that was estimated was $10 + less than what I ended up being charged. 
So be aware- Uber does not respect the legitimacy of customer complaints. I rarely take time to complain to a company, much less write a review- but the awful customer service at Uber needs to be addressed. I don't imagine they'll be around much longer anyway.

author: Awakened Sleeper
title: Why can a driver rate a paying customer?
content:
How is it that a driver I'm paying is able to rate me as a customer? When you buy groceries, does a cashier rate you? When you hire a limo, does a limo rate you? No. 

As a female, half of the time, the male drivers ask me for my number, and when I say no, they get insulted! Then they rate me for saying no! Are you SERIOUS? They shouldn't be able to rate a paying customer. Nowhere else is that possible-- restaurants can't rate their diners. Shopping malls can't rate their customers. Hairdressers can't rate their clients. It makes no sense. 

People say, oh, well, let's say a drunk customer throws up in the Uber-- the Uber driver gets paid $150 for a vomit customer!! So how can they possibly be able to rate the customer when they're getting paid for the inconvenient behavior?  Stupid concept.

author: SeriouslyDave
title: Someone can add their phone to your account
content:
I am a rider, not a driver. However, I recently found that someone added a Russian phone number to my account as a driver/partner. I do not know where this information came from and I never got a notification from Uber that this had happened. I only noticed something was wrong because I got ride receipts in Russian. I have never been to Russia, I do not speak Russian, and I don't have a phone number in Russia. How could Uber software have let this happen? I don't know. Needless to say I have submitted a request to delete my Uber account. I have no plans to use Uber again in the future.

--

author: UppityOldMan
title: Poor customer service
content:
Recent customer service experiences left much to be desired. I had an old phone number on my account. Rather than allow me to update it online I have to contact customer service to do so. Turnaround time is several hours. Driver is unable to locate me at the hospital and cancels.

I believe the status quo when you breed a culture of sexism and your company's reputation is reflective of this - is to improve the customer experience. Unfortunately uber seems determined to buck the trend here. There is too much competition in the industry (i.e. Lyft) not to vote with my wallet.

author: Unseen disband bc
title: Horrible Customer Service
content:
I have been a loyal Uber user for the last 2 years, i'm a traveling student (which means my income in basically nothing). I took an Uber the other day: Normal ride, no issues, quiet driver. 3 days later I received a notice that I would be charged an extra $80 for a mess that occurred in the back seat during my trip. I reached out to Uber through the app (because unlike LYFT they do not have a customer service number) and tried to explain the situation: like always I was in the front seat as a personal preference, and that mess could not have been caused by me. 

I received emails from Uber saying they acknowledge my message but the situation had been "investigated" and they would not refund the amount. I tried for a day responding with emails back and forth trying to get my refund until Uber decided to stop responding. I will no longer be using Uber and I implore you if you're reading this to not waste your time and money. Lyft is just as effective and I have been happy with their service to date. Also they have a customer service phone number, so you can actually talk to someone about any issues! DELETE UBER, DOWNLOAD LYFT!

author: kdallakian
title: 5 star to your driver show your appreciation.
content:
If you're rating your driver less than 5 stars, that means he totally failed.
Thank You.

author: Elle.H1102
title: Uber is going downhill
content: Lately I've been taking uber everyday to my job. They keep changing my route to take me out of my way and have me pay extra money. It's come to the point where I have to direct my uber drive the shorter way until the uber app updates to the path I want. Once I took uber pool and my corider forgot her passport at home and my uber driver turned around to get it, which resulted in me getting charged an additional mileage fee and uber wouldn't even refund my money for what I should have payed, all I got was a sorry. Then I noticed friends of mine were able to purchase passes and I wasn't. I've been a loyal customer to uber amongst all its screw ups and they didn't extend that offer to me. The drivers are getting worse, the service is getting worse. Step up your game Uber!

author: Iansilv
title: Turn off location tracking when not using the app
content: I deliberately do not use the app as often as I would like because you do not have an option to only use location tracking when using the app.

author: liber8
title: From OK to bad to diabolical, and invades privacy
content: Uber has been in a downward spiral and has lost my trust. The extended location tracking in the recent versions is unacceptable— and now they want access to your calendar, too. Forget it. Worst of all, they have *removed* the option to use iOS's native privacy controls to allow location tracking only while using the app. I'm switching to Lyft, at least until that feature is restored. Also, I'm no longer able to rate drivers, since after turning off location tracking there's a nag screen every time one opens or returns to the app, and that nag screen blocks the page where typically one would rate the driver right after a trip (dismissing the nag screen also dismissed the rating screen, which is a major design flaw). Uber has officially gone from hit-and-miss to terrible. And, on top of that, now Uber wants access to your contacts as well as your location. No thanks. Pass.

author: KUOW-deprived
title: Not ok with your location harvesting
content:
Recently my Uber app began insisting on sharing my location "Always". They have eliminated the option for sharing my location only "while using the app". I find this disturbing and completely unnecessary for the purpose of finding a ride when I need one. That's called putting the cart in front of the horse. I'll be curious to see if Lyft is less invasive. 

Also uber's drivers do not like the new compulsory uberpool matching policy but they are too scared to say it to Uber so I'll add that the function is not going over well.

author: chwebb1
title: Privacy Violation
content: You aren't able to use the Uber app unless you give then access to your location at all times. If you only give it permission to use your location while the app is in use in Settings, it will not use that permission and require you to give it access at all times. I don't understand why this is, but this seems like an incredibly poor design. I will be using a competitor until Uber allows you to choose to give it access only while you use the app, since I won't give it permission to use at all times since I use services like this (Uber, Lyft, or Taxi) a few times a year. I hope Uber is listening.

author: liber8
title: From OK to bad to egregious: invades privacy, ignores user requests
content: Uber continues its downward spiral and has lost my trust (and that of countless users). The perpetual location tracking in the recent versions is totally unacceptable. Making matters worse, they have *removed* the option to use iOS's native privacy controls to allow location tracking only while using the app. Lyft respects users' privacy, unlike Uber. Also, I'm no longer able to rate drivers, since after turning off location tracking there's a nag screen every time one opens or returns to the app, and that nag screen blocks the page where typically one would rate the driver right after a trip (dismissing the nag screen also dismissed the rating screen, which is a major design flaw). Uber has officially gone from hit-and-miss to terrible. And, on top of that, now Uber wants access to your contacts as well as your location. Pass.

author: EhTilt
title: Location Services being misused by the app
content:
The latest version of the Uber Rider app has changed the way it uses Location Services. It now wants to use location services even when the app is not being used. This is a change from the earlier version.

If I decline to give Uber that permission, it completely removes location services and I have to manually enter my pickup location. The app no longer "pins" my location for pickup.

When I go into iOS settings to change location services settings for Uber, I notice that there are only two settings - Never, and Always.  "Only while using the app" setting is not available.

I do not wish Uber to track my location when I am not using the app - I see no reason for them to do so that is beneficial to me and not them.

Thank you.

author: Millionaire MOMMY
title: Done and over this garbage
content: Installed this app back in Nov/2016. I've used the app for a total of 3 times because after my 3rd attempt to use it, it will not allow me to book a ride. Keep getting a message "Request failed. Please try again or use another card". Yes, I've tried again. Yes, I deleted the app and re downloaded it. Still no luck! Yes, I even restarted my iPhone thinking this will help. No luck!, yes, switched payment method 4 times and still get the same exact error message. "Request failed. Please try again or use another card" frustrated as I decided to use Lyft this time and payment went through successfully with Lyft. No error messages. Lyft is a bit more expensive (as Uber is cheaper of course), but I don't even care anymore about the cost right now. I was able to book a ride using Lyft and get to where I needed to be, late! (Late because of wasting too much time fooling around with this Uber trying to get it to work). Lyft as an alternate usage. Will not ever attempt to use Uber again! Sick of trying to use it and the crap will not go through!

author: coffeebean99
title: Goodbye Uber!
content: Here's hoping that top Uber executives and anyone else on the company's board all suffer horrendous and terrible fates. Fiery plane crashes, unintended victims of gun violence, various types of terminal illnesses, etc. Every single time I open my news app there's an article detailing the shady, underhanded and dark activities that this company is involved in. Sexual harassment of women, spying on current and past customers long after the app has been deleted, the CEO Travis Kalanick caught on camera pretty much being himself, an unpleasant and terrible human being, and the straw that broke the camel's back? The suicide of one of your engineers, Joseph Thomas. I can no longer support this company. I'm deleting my info and the rest of you that praises this app can all have it!

author: Whyamihere
title: Adios
content:
You took away the option of sharing location only while using the app. Guess what's easier than having to go into my settings every time to re-enable location and disable location?? ...using Lyft from now on. Put location sharing back to the user's choice.
ADDITIONALLY, I consider this company to be a bunch of scumbags for releasing a new update every few days to wipe out the negative reviews. There are no real updates to the app. If there were it would be from listening to the rage of their users and giving back the option of location while only using the app. And I'll continue to give 1 star until they do.

Update: Uber recently sent an email "noticing" that I disabled location for the App. Well no crap, that's what happens when you don't care about user privacy. I'm sure they had to send out a lot of those emails to others. My location will remain disabled until they bring back the option for only when using the app, and my business continues to go to Lyft.

author: Lance J.
title: Avoid update - serious issues with current version.
content:
Watch out - this "new" version of the Uber app has a serious issue where it pretty much wants you to give it rights to your exact location ALL the time - while you sleep, while you're at work, while you're driving your own car - literally ALWAYS. 

All-the-time GPS drains batteries, and I don't want to give Uber the right to sniff my every move every minute of the day. This is just stupid of Uber. 

I suggest you try some of excellent alternatives that don't abuse personal information.  Most of the same exact drivers work for the alternatives too, but without the troubling personal privacy practices offered by Uber.  And most alternatives, I have learned, are less expensive.  We all win!

Original Review: 
Since the app and service are tightly coupled, my review is for both. 

Overall, very good. Generally better than a cab. I have had one problem driver - crazy guy - but likely no less crazy than some cab drivers I have had. 

App could be easier to use, but it is quite good.

author: Aaron-Himself
title: Old cigarette smoking drivers with no clue how to use maps
content: So great when first started, junk service anymore. The drivers have no clue and take forever. I quit uber for a few months to go lyft. I used them today because lyft is more expensive. I see why they are more expensive, they actually give you the expected service. I'm going Lyft from now and I won't be coming back 😔

author: Irlfruit
title: I would give zero stars if I could
content: Uber has screwed me over so many times. Being a student on a tight budget, I have no choice but to use uber when I can't take the bus so I tend to have an issue with uber almost every week. The surge pricing is a ridiculous way to scam its customers at the worst times ever and you have to wait possibly even hours for the pricing to go back down, also the navigation system is HORRIBLE. Yesterday 2 uber drivers couldn't find me because uber didn't pick up my location correctly so they both cancelled my rides and I had no way to get home late at night after class. Uber frequently over charges me on accident (?) so I'm constantly having to take time out of my day to email them to credit my money back to my bank account. It's incredibly frustrating. If I had a choice, I would never use this app. Lyft is definitely better but a bit pricier, and like I said, I'm on a college budget, so I stick to Uber's abuse. If you have the means to avoid using this horrible app, please do yourself a favor and don't use uber.

author: Dannyboy690
title: Difficult for both the driver and customer
content:
Drivers are very nice...most of the time. Sometimes the app will tell you the wrong meeting point. I had a problem when I was getting picked up at the airport, the app told me to go to arrivals ,which was downstairs , but it  told the uber driver to go to departure which was upstairs. I ended up paying a fee because the app told both me and the driver a different place for the pick-up spot. Another issue with the app is that it will tell you one price , but it will increase once you call the uber and have already signed up for the ride.
The positive side of the app , is that it's a lot easier than taking a taxi or bus. Also the royalties for uber is 25% , not very fair for the drivers themselves.

author: Michael X A
title: Uber just ruined themselves
content: Ever since this big new update Uber has become completely ruined. Glitches all over the place especially with payments. I paid $20 for the $2 flat fare package and the update caused my remaining rides to become $2 off rather than $2 flat. So every ride I take I get charged the full amount then I have to complain to get it fixed. And the remaining rides I still have are still only $2 off so the problem will definitely happen again. I also had a $20 coupon for referring a friend. This time I was charged $19 for the ride in advance and then refunded the money at the end. How is this acceptable? It's a credit/discount NOT a rebate. This update has destroyed any quality than Uber had left, which wasn't much considering so many of their drivers now are complete racists. I've never given so many low ratings to any lyft drivers but Uber is really going downhill fast with no end in sight. FAIL.

author: Chiquitita123
title: Bad Customer Service, Even Worse Drivers
content:
I use Uber in NYC, and so far it's been pretty atrocious. In fact, the absolute only reason why I still use it is because I live in a more remote part of the city where yellow cabs are harder to come by.

The customer service is lousy. They charge you cancellation fees out the wazoo, even when it was the driver's fault, and when you give them an explanation as to why you should get a refund, they're very picky about when they're willing to refund you. What garbage. 

I don't like the customer service, but the drivers are even worse. 9 times out of 10 they get lost trying to find my apartment- and next thing you know, my ETA has gone from 3 minutes to 10 minutes! Since I tend to only take Uber when I'm in a major hurry, I often have to cancel if the the ETA jumps like that. But then I get charged fees and get low ratings from drivers, even though it was *them* who got lost while I was waiting at the correct address the whole time! Really!? The drivers also have a habit of either taking long routes, or simply not knowing where they're going whatsoever. Uber needs to have much stricter hiring criteria and regulations, because I'm so tired of having to deal with directionally challenged drivers all the time.

author: FoxShepard
title: Incredibly inept "customer service"
content: I have never in my life encountered such incompetent "customer service".  I have a problem with my account.  There is no phone number to call; you have to deal with the customer service reps by e-mail.  I'm not sure if any of them have read (or understood) my e-mails.  They completely ignore what I'm writing to them.  And every time you send a reply, it goes to a brand new incompetent rep.  You would think that with it going to a brand new rep every time, it would eventually reach someone who knows what they're doing, but no such luck.  My advice to everyone out there would be to use Lyft or some other Uber alternative.  God help you if you ever need to deal with Uber "customer service".

author: RecentUpdates
title: Unusable (lack of privacy)
content: I will not be using this app anymore. Because I declined letting the app keep tracking my location even while I am not using the app, it is now next to useless. Good thing I still have Lyft installed, because with Uber there is not an option in the privacy tab in the phone's Settings app for setting the tracking of location "Only While Using", like there is for other apps (Including Lyft).

author: Diavolo07
title: Change location services options
content: Uber is the only privacy violating, greedy company mandating location services are always on. Add the option, like every other app in 2017, to "While using the app". The past excuses given are pathetic and Apple has also criticized Uber for this practice. Uber's reputation continues to get worse.

author: Micaiah24
title: Payment
content: Uber does not let me use PNC bank cards for some odd apparent reason. My card only works on occasion, and right now it is not working on the Uber app. They need to fix this problem ASAP.

author: Rudeabaga
title: App Requires to Know Your Location Always
content: As the title says. It is very hard to trust an app that constantly wants to know your location. They claim they only track for 5 minutes after the trip has ended, but even then, they don't give users the option (and this is still highly suspicious). It's either location services are on (so you can use the app) or it's off (and the app is useless). Please revert back to the original settings in which location services are "Only when the app is open"

author: Kgpnative
title: Convenient service, unfriendly app - not a happy rider!
content:
As a rider the service with the app is very good every time I have used it. 

However the process and instructions for entering/ editing the data for the app is very unfriendly. 

First, the app encourages creating two profiles - work and home - keeping them separate becomes a challenge in practice. When I book a ride, it says personal or work, but doesn't reconfirm that the charge will be on the appropriate card. On a recent personal trip, I went back and forth on the app to confirm the charge card, but I was never sure which card was being charged. The personal trip ended up being charged to my work credit card -- NOT GOOD. Ideally, it should confirm the credit card before the final order of the ride. I have now removed my work rides and will get a Yellow Taxi or a local limo service for my work related trips (mostly to/ from airport). 

Secondly, changing and deleting the credit card required looking up the help! Even after I had seen the instructions, the procedure was less than obvious. I could not update the card details and had to delete and re-enter all the details. Since I entered one incorrect digit in the card expiration date, I had to enter the card details a second time (deleting the first entry) instead of only editing the expiration date!  Overall, the app is unfriendly to use. 

I will use the app because there is no option but to use the app for Uber rides. Definitely not a happy camper.

author: Uncliqued
title: If I could put 0, I would
content: TRASH!! Left me stranded for two hours at a Baltimore bus station at 3 am because of app glitches! Horrible and will never use again

author: uznhieoa368
title: $20 coupon: "UBER-7UE"
content:
If you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon "UBER-7UE" and get $20 off your first ride!!! Seriously!! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it likely won't cost you a thing!!!

The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button!!! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: xiziphobia
title: No reason for Uber to need my location all the time
content:
Why you need to know user location even when app is closed.

And you constantly upgrades your app, maybe a technique to clear bad reviews?

Goodbye Uber

author: Punto_ITA
title: Ignore the fake 5 star reviews by uber employees!!
content:
The new version makes it more and more difficult to see the prices. Surge pricing is always on, so you will always pay more than a normal taxi. 

The new app doesn't even allow you to select the exact pick up point. It automatically suggests a nearby road to meet the driver. This is ridiculous... 

The drivers are inexperienced as well as rude. I have used uber for the past 2 years and have now moved to its competitors. I would advise you all to do the same!!!

author: Mrsaaaaaa
title: UNBELIEVABLY TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
content: Let me ask you this question. What if you're at a bar and you want to go home? You call an uber to pick you up from said bar. Except the uber driver never shows up, or maybe drives by you. He starts the ride and drives to your destination, WITHOUT A PASSENGER IN THE CAR. Once he gets there, he completes the ride, he gets paid, you get charged while you're still waiting for him at the bar. Whats stopping Uber drivers from doing that? Well that's what happened to me. I went through their bogus help system, all app based no phone number or anything which is asinine, and they refused to refund me my money. For a ride I NEVER GOT!  Please stop using Uber. Its horrible, from their customer service to their policies, everything about it is horrendous.

author: Ruben Rico Ramirez
title: Hostile Driver, Poor Navigation, Late Arrival
content:
Hi,
When I requested a ride in your app today, the driver took an excessive amount of time to arrive to my location. When he arrived in my complex he drove in circles on the opposite side of my complex. After finally arriving to my apartment building, I immediately began walking toward his vehicle on my crutches (I am disabled). From the point of arrival to the point where I reached his car door was about 30 seconds. He lowered his window and said "you are late where were you I am not your ride anymore"; I explained to him I had to crutch across the parking lot about 600 yards from where I had dropped my pick up location pin he said "well that's too bad buddy" I was also charged $5 cancellation fee! He was extremely rude and hostile, I've have had this experience with another uber driver also. These drivers are poorly trained in customer service, no sense of professionalism or basic courtesy whatsoever. The navigation for pick up and drop off is terrible! I have not had these issues using LYFT, their drivers are always respectful, courteous, on time, efficient and safe drivers! Another terrible experience with uber, I will now be late to work!

author: Hilarity23
title: Latest update is absolute garbage.
content: My issue lies mostly with the navigation within the Uber app. Forget about the crappy UX and the plethora of ads they've added. The navigation alone is enough to turn me into an exclusive Lyft user. There have been many trips in which the map has directed the driver to make ridiculous turns that make no sense. Just yesterday, it directed my driver to make a loop around some random street for no good reason to which I adamantly directed my driver not to follow. The UberPool algorithm is even worse. It's not "on the way" if you're picking someone up near where I was picked up if we're already halfway to my destination. So yes, we had to drive all the way back to my pickup location and then all the way back down, only to encounter heavier traffic than before. This has never, ever happen with Lyft or Lyft Line before. It baffles me that this version was released without rigorous testing around its navigation & Uberpool routing feature.

author: bkolar
title: Always tracking location services
content: I have enjoyed using uber in the past, but this latest update forcing the user to allow constant location tracking is an invasion of privacy, and incredibly detrimental to battery life of your iPhone.  As of today, I decided to delete Uber and have downloaded Lyft. I urge everyone to join me until Uber decides to allow for location service "while using the app".

author: Bluestreek1206
title: Uber drivers who can't use a gps
content: I have been using Lyft exclusively for the last year and I just tried Uber again and I cannot wait to delete it and go back to lyft. Taken about 15 rides with Uber so far and every time the driver got lost on their way to pick me up and I have the same map in front of my face I can clearly see where they are making the wrong turn so I don't understand why they can't and then they've taken crazy ways to get me places to guys almost got into an accident when driving me and one almost fell asleep at the wheel and told me he was still hung over from the night before and then proceeded to hit on my friend and I and made us so uncomfortable that we asked to be dropped off on the side of the road just to get out of his car. I've contacted who were about these things and I've gotten no response about their safety issues or their navigational issues and it is really difficult to even attempt to contact them. Do yourself and the entire world a favor and don't use Uber use anything else I would rather take a taxi.

author: Luluferg
title: Wrongfully charged cleaning fee
content: Like another reviewer on here, I was wrongfully charged a cleaning fee for damage I did not cause and Uber refused to refund me the extra $40 they took out of my bank account. While I was traveling in New Orleans, one of my drivers claimed that my friend and I damaged the back seat of her car. All she had to do was provide photos of liquid damage on the backseat and say that it was from us. Needless to say, we didn't have any liquids in the car and weren't drunk/sick during the ride. I went back and forth three times with Uber customer service and they refused to explain to me how they verified her claim aside from saying she sent them random photos. They also had the nerve to say that I wasn't being accused and that they were interested in hearing my side of the story...yet they had already charged me for the damage. They basically sent me the same four lines over and over again. If you still decide to take Uber, PLEASE take pictures of the inside of the car before and after you enter it since the burden of proof WILL be on you if your driver is like mine and submits false photos of damage against you. Better yet, don't give them your business because you will NOT get your money back. Also if you are traveling in NOLA, do not ride with a woman named Arnell (aka Nell)! I never had problems with Uber before this incident but I refuse to take the chance of going through this experience again.

author: MGhostSoft
title: Watch out overcharges!!
content:
When you search the airport of your city, check the route carefully because possibly the destination is set to the middle of a runway and the route is several miles longer than it should be. As a result, you're paying $4~$6 extra for the distance you won't travel. I reported to Uber several month ago and never heard back.

And, do they think people are used to the "Always on" location tracking? No reason for me to allow them to track my location 5 minutes after drop off, and no reason to trust them only doing what the claimed to do.

And, people like me still haven't forgotten that Uber requested hundreds of Lyft cars then cancelled them and did so again and again. What a mean company.

Not that I'm still using this app. In fact, I have not used it ever since I found the overcharging trap. Not to mention the location tracking. I'm just keeping this app installed so that I can get back and leave a 1-star review whenever it is updated.

author: Doombeeyah
title: Horribleeeeee serviceeeeeeee
content: THIS WAS THE WORST RIDE IVE EVER BEEN ON!!! First off I confirmed a ride of "$5.38" , the driver re-routed to pick up another person and got lost on his way. The other pooler spotted the car and sat inside after her ride was cancelled. The driver would not move the car because he insisted she get out and she did not. He proceeded to take me to my location then decided to take the other pooler back to her original location. He was not following the gps correctly and made a lot of incorrect turns even after I was trying to tell him he was going the wrong way. He claimed he was following the gps. As soon as I rated the ride 1 star. You guys charged me over 13 dollars. I'm absolutely not having it. I was literally 6 blocks away from home and could've been home within 5 minutes but because of that driver and his actions, the ride was over 20 minutes. You guys need to refund me back my money or else I will take further action!

author: uftbelcp368
title: $20 coupon: T72ZP
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon "t72zp" to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: JaclynXoX
title: Called and refused a trip sat around the same spot the last 40 mins
content: The driver called and told me that he did not want to pick me up as he is 10 minutes away. He stated that he mainly works in NYC and therefore he does not want to pick me up and demanded that I cancel it the trip. Since uber has a cancellation fee for customers cancelling trips I did not agree on this as I feel like we shouldn't get penalised if the driver REFUSED to do the trip.. I tried calling back several times he ignored all of my phone calls. Conveniently, there is no direct way to speak to someone in customer service for uber . Go for LYFT, VIA and GETT. Bye uber .

author: Bored in Boston
title: New Uber app is horrid
content: New app is close to unusable. Location services on Google map don't work at all. Even when you type in your exact address, the app sends the driver to the wrong location. Had a trip canceled twice by drivers as they couldn't find me, they didn't even try to call, and I was billed for the canceled trips. Then when you try to get your money back, the so-called "help" area does not let you explain what happened. When watching the map while the drivers were supposedly on the way to me it looked like the car was spiraling all over where there were not even any roads. Also has privacy issue as your address is now provided to all other riders in your pool. I would give this negative stars if I could. It doesn't rate even one star.

author: Pissedoff77
title: Location services
content: Location services option needs to go back to switch on only when using app. There's no reason to "Always" require sharing my location. Lyft doesn't have this problem. Keep updating to clear the bad reviews out everyone's just going to keep reposting them. Not sure why apple even allows this.. without actual and proper updates reviews shouldn't be cleared.

author: Winfl
title: Quality gone down
content: Uber used to be great but the changes they have made recently had been a turn for the worst. The app is unnecessarily intrusive forcing users to always have their location tracked regardless of whether they are using the app or not and the drivers are no longer screened thoroughly, I have had many bad drivers now and have lost confidence in the company to provide the "higher quality service" they initially branded themselves as. They are no better than your average yellow cab now and it's such a shame. They also got rid of the option to type in what was wrong with my ride when I give a driver a bad rating. This company appears to only be out to make money for themselves, they no longer care about their customers or their drivers for that matter.

author: New update such a letdown
title: Horrible Glitch
content: On multiple occasions I've had a ride request not go through, but this last time made me livid. I tried to request a ride, but the attempt failed. Then I get a call 10 minutes later from a drive that says he's outside, when my app says I don't even have a trip started. Not only is this frustrating, but also scary since I couldn't even see the driver on an active trip, but he still had access to my info and address. Then I got charged a $5 cancellation fee because he was sitting there. I promptly removed my credit card, deleted the app, downloaded Lyft and made my way happily to dinner. Never again.

author: His PRQ
title: Ugh
content: I've used uber over 60 times and I always tip and be pleasant. I've never made my uber driver wait because I request when I am ready and outside. Apart from being pleasant, not slamming doors and tipping, drivers rate me very low, when I rate them 5 stars. Well guess what? I've been checking my ratings and even if I gave 5 stars from the email receipt I can always change my rating. I once asked a driver if he had change for a 20 dollar bill he said no, so I gave him the whole 20$ my star rating went down 5 points, as if he rated me 1 star. This does not look good for the rest of the drivers because then I will not tip at all, I mean you are rating me low, when I never canceled, I know I don't smell bad, I be careful with not slamming doors, I am always there before you are I always tip, but yet you rate me low whereas I rate a 5 star. Well no more 5 stars.

author: Help me choose a nickname
title: Useless unless you're willing to let Uber spy on you
content:
The app is mostly crippled unless you enable full-time location access (vs. just when using the app).  Give Uber's history of a total lack of concern for riders' privacy, that's a permission in not willing to give the app.

Hey Uber, if you're intention isn't to spy on your riders, how about adding the option to use Location services only while using the app? (I'm not holding my breath on that one.)

The app works, but it is over-simplified. I've ended up booking a trip when I was just trying to see how soon a driver could pick me up and what it would cost. Not a very intuitive UI. And it _forces_ you to leave a review for your last trip before you can do anything else with the app .. unless you want to uninstall and reinstall the app after every trip, as Uber support suggested to me <roll eyes>.

author: Sthrnrrr2
title: STOP Already ! - Do NOT use this app!
content: Worst update strategy ever, just to get rid of reviews. Truth is there should be a negative star rating for Uber. I warn you not to use or install this app. Uber was always my favorite service, and recommended to everyone. This is no longer the case. Completely unethical behavior and breach of privacy. Requiring location services that are always on and tracking you in order to use the app are inexcusable. I have contacted them numerous times and they do not care at all. I will no longer use or recommended Uber and will be telling everyone I know to use an alternative. Uber leadership should be ashamed of themselves for this disgusting, blatant invasion of privacy and crossing the line into full on creeper mode. Not cool. At all.

author: Gorberg
title: Uber is terrible, they delete the bad reviews once a week.
content: Do not get involved with this company. Check your review in about a week, only you will be able to see your review no one else. I find Uber's business practices to be sneaky and despicable. I'm not going to recommend this app from Uber. The Uber app pulls the resale value out of your car to Pay YOU. Uber needs to compensate and pay the drives real money, so they can fix and maintain there car's. Uber doesn't pay much to the drivers at all (Uber keeps about 60% of what the rider pay UBER). Once you consider your fuel cost, extremely high cost of ride-share car insurance, car maintenance and the terrible wear and tear on the car itself plus significant lose of value of your car at resale, especially because of the super high miles on your vehicle. The Uber app is a very bad deal for the drive. However the riders are getting a great deal on your dime and time.  Sorry for the bad new.

author: Cassy_D
title: Two problems noticed
content:
Update: App is not working at all for me now. I've tried to use it a few times and won't pull up any locations. Had to end up downloading Lyft to get me to and from places. I really relied on Uber and liked using uber but now I have to use Lyft.
*************************
Let me start with I am a avid user, 2-6 rides a day for almost a year and have had very few issues. I do not know what is going on with this version though, when I type in an address as either my pick up or drop off location it will sometimes prompt me to pick a pick up point close by. This has confused a couple of my drivers because instead of giving the exact address to pick me up it gives them a range and they drive back and forth sometimes even passing me. Another thing I've noticed with this recent update is though convenient for places you go to often, if I select one of my frequent locations on the bottom in the circles it tells the driver the address and not that they are looking for a store or restaurant and again the drivers pass me up or drive in circles until I either call or text them and tell them to pull into a parking lot. I really like uber and rely on it daily but lately it's been a bit of a headache. Hopefully with the next update these little things can get fixed.

author: Gggrrah
title: Good in theory.
content: Uber was a great idea, especially for places where public transportation isnt easily accessible (no taxis, few bus stops, no railroads etc). However, uber underpays their drivers (in my opinion) and is often unreliable. to share your location with a friend or family member, they must be registered and have the app. Additionally, ive heard about cases where someone who is not your uber driver comes to pick you up and claim to be your uber driver. Not sure how true that is, but i wouldnt be surprised considering the app uses your location LITERALLY 24/7. Uber is not a good company and seems to only care about the money. Please, do not trust this app and do not enter any coupons you get in spam emails or see online. Try Lyft instead.

author: Not worth it :(
title: Update ruined the app
content: There is no reason uber needs access to my location data when i am not using the app.  They used to have an option to enable location tracking only when using the app.  It's a sleazy move that doesn't have the users interest at heart. Uber has played fast and loose with business ethics in the past so i have no reason to believe this is anything different. My guess is they are only interested in selling user data to other companies.   I guess I'm a lyft customer now.

author: Binnytheball
title: U don't need my location when I'm not using uber
content:
The only options for location services is "Always" and "Never".  No, I'm not giving you my location when I'm not using the app. Guess who gives the option to only have location on "while using" the app?  Lyft. Lyft gets my business every time because of this.
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 开发者回复：Thank you for your feedback! We are making changes to address your concerns. Now you can have more control over when Uber collects location data by choosing a "While in Use" location setting. 

Location data helps Uber improve pickups, customer support, a

author: RecentUpdates
title: Unusable (lack of privacy)
content:
I will not be using this app anymore. Because I declined letting the app keep tracking my location even while I am not using the app, it is now next to useless. Good thing I still have Lyft installed, because with Uber there is not an option in the privacy tab in the phone's Settings app for setting the tracking of location "Only While Using", like there is for other apps (Including Lyft).
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 开发者回复：This doesn't sound right. We want to take a closer look into this for you. Please send a quick note to t.uber.com/contact so we can connect.

When you search the airport of your city, check the route carefully because possibly the destination is set to the middle of a runway and the route is several miles longer than it should be. As a result, you're paying $4~$6 extra for the distance you won't travel. I reported to Uber several month ago and never heard back.

And, do they think people are used to the "Always on" location tracking? No reason for me to allow them to track my location 5 minutes after drop off, and no reason to trust them only doing what the claimed to do.

Not that I'm still using this app. In fact, I have not used it ever since I found the overcharging trap. Not to mention the location tracking. I'm just keeping this app installed so that I can get back and leave a 1-star review whenever it is updated.
