Location data helps Uber improve pickups, customer support, a

author: Weather pain
title: Location always on!
content:
Location is always on! Make it so it's "while you are using the app only" or you'll get a one star rating forever from me! Stop stalking me!!!!

Update: Ok, I'm sick of this app updating all of the time just to clear bad reviews. And the size of this app is completely ridiculous! I would give you zero stars if I could! 

Apple needs to look into your app and see if you are actually updating/fixing anything because I don't see any changes after I update!

author: Towson
title: Über Moving in Reverse
content:
Used über since it first came out when it was only black cars. Loved it, sang its praises even though it's now a goliath. 

Now? Location tracking, battery draining and with a new update that feels OLD, and you cant even update the password/picture via the app. 

What the heck über? Who are you paying to sabotage yourself? Consider yourself deleted, only using Lyft now.

author: Vaneflocka
title: I mean, I still need a ride.
content: I use Uber about once or twice a week when I go out with my friends or boyfriend. It's fast, convenient, and cheap! The only reason why I knock off two stars is because the fact that my location always needs to be on, even when I'm not using the app. I don't like the fact that it uses up my battery, my data, and it's just plain creepy man. Why can't it have the option to track my location only while using the app? I always have to try to remember to turn it off once I'm done using Uber but a lot of the times I forget. Please change this setting.

author: Yury_A
title: Location services always on - 1 star
content: I wish I could give it zero stars. Uber wants to track me all the time? No way!

author: EJ Landwehr
title: Uber Is Officially Post-Truth
content: 1) I don't write reviews, but felt compelled. 2) My rider star rating on Uber is 4.87. 3) I was a VERY regular ORIGINAL user of Uber; I live in the SF Bay Area. I own a car and still used Uber 3-5 times a week. Occasionally 3-5 times a day. 4) Ever since they expected tips but don't allow the Lyft style simplicity of just tipping after the ride, the service has gone downhill. 5) Uber drivers are regularly anti-LGBT or behave in anti-LGBT ways & Uber does not consider this a violation of their "policies"…the gay community has always forgiven Uber this, but continuing to crap on us is not helping their image 6) The "location in use" icon NEVER disappears from your iPhone/iPad Status Bar now that Uber "always" needs your location 7) This drains your battery and IS a privacy issue. 8) tech savvy kids with lots of time on their hands might not consider having to turn location services for Uber on/off to use app an inconvenience but I do & my elderly parents do (they were regular users too…especially my dad) 9) not everyone is next to a power outlet or a portable charger 24/7 & some of us actually care about our privacy 10) Selecting a ride type & setting your pickup location/destination is now IMPOSSIBLE unless you are VERY tech savvy 11) Until these issues are resolved my family's business will go to Lyft, because Lyft gives two craps about their customers

author: Weather pain
title: Update after update and still spying
content: You update every week and still have the location set as always on. Stop updating just to clear bad reviews and fix the problem!

author: oECT164AHROqt
title: 20$ COUPON: asifr4016ui
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “asifr4016ui”to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: _justbill
title: Whatever you do, DON'T...
content:
I recently I requested a ride from the airport to a friend's house (LAX to Studio City). The driver immediately called me and asked where I was going I told him and he canceled the ride. The price then DOUBLED for the exact same ride when I requested a new driver.

Apparently they don't see the destination until they pick you up, this ensures you get the nearest driver that accepts. So whatever you do, DON'T TELL THE DRIVER WHERE YOU'RE GOING unless you want to get canceled on and pay more! From now on I'm gonna play dumb and say I'm just visiting and the address has been submitted through the app, see you soon.

author: Mass Hysteria !!!!!
title: It's alright
content:
For the basic feature of putting an address and arriving where you need to go it's a great app super convenient never much wait time... but for having grown so much over the years the quality of their app has dramatically reduced. I can no longer rate drivers or leave a tip and there is no option of going back and changing the review or seeing the review I gave my driver. This is very disappointing because some drivers deserve a flat out one star and I can't notify uber they got a bunch of weirdos driving people around thank you for your time
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 开发者回复：We appreciate the feedback. Let us more about the issue. Send a quick note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll follow up with you.

author: W367rghnjdks
title: Still trying to follow user location
content: After ons of 1 star reviews for tracking location all the time they still haven't updated it. Maybe instead of 1 star review next time I will just delete the app I guess.

author: Matthew21995
title: Tracking even when app is not opened
content: Dear uber, please stop tracking me even when I'm not using the app. Thank you.

author: Ummfa
title: Technical problems w/ new update
content: I used to love uber and have almost always had a positive experience with my rides/drivers. But ever since I got the update, the app can't seem to figure out where I am, even when I type in the exact address. (Last night, I needed a ride from my apartment, but the GPS showed my location as the BP gas station two blocks from my house... so that's where my driver went. It took about 15 minutes for us to get that sorted out bc it wouldn't let me cancel the ride so I was very late to my destination.) Also, when I was trying to get home, the app completely stopped working, and still isn't working right now. I've tried deleting and re-downloading, and turning my phone off/on...all my other apps are working fine, but Uber just gives me a blank, blue screen. I'd be happy to come back to uber in a few months when they get all the bugs worked out, but for now I'm gonna look for a different ride-sharing app.

author: Zuoan
title: Terrible
content:
Uber app tracks you location even if you are not using it. Combining this with the todays report that uber tried to track your identity even after you deleted its app in 2015, I can clear see that this is a really shady company.

Latest update still has all or nothing for location privacy setting. Really terrible.

author: Carlos_Zambrano
title: Location services always on.. no thanks
content: Location services always on.. no thanks

author: RecentUpdates
title: Unusable (lack of privacy)
content: I will not be using this app anymore. Because I declined letting the app keep tracking my location even while I am not using the app, it is now next to useless. Good thing I still have Lyft installed, because with Uber there isn't an option in the privacy tab in the phone's Settings app for setting the tracking of location "Only While Using", like there is for other apps (Including Lyft).

author: Gorberg
title: Learn from my mistake, Don't get involved with uber.
content: I find Uber's business practices to be sneaky and despicable. I'm not going to recommend this app from Uber. The Uber app pulls the resale value out of your car to Pay YOU. Uber needs to compensate and pay the drives real money, so they can fix and maintain there car's. Uber doesn't pay much to the drivers at all (Uber keeps about 60% of what the rider pay UBER). Once you consider your fuel cost, extremely high cost of ride-share car insurance, car maintenance and the terrible wear and tear on the car itself plus significant lose of value of your car at resale, especially because of the super high miles on your vehicle. The Uber app is a very bad deal for the drive. However the riders are getting a great deal on your dime and time. Sorry for the bad new.

author: Raider217
title: First time, Last time.
content: Yesterday I had a friend suggest I use an uber instead of walking 4 miles. I ordered the uber and went outside to wait. The driver was waiting at the wrong address, the wrong side of a large apartment complex (different street name and number) so after waiting, he cancelled the trip. He passed me as he was leaving and explained what happened. I then ordered another uber, and though he was right there, I had to wait another 20 minutes for a different car. In all it took almost as long as walking and I was charged 5 dollars for a cancelation. IF I EVER use uber again, it will be out of utter desperation.

author: Dalai007
title: Location Services Always On? + terrible GPS in Singapore
content:
I have a lot of issues with being forced (or "highly, annoyingly encouraged ") to keep location services always on. The fine print tries to assure me that it is really only for "5 additional minutes" but Uber needs to add the option of only while the app is open. 

Which leads to my second piece of feedback. GPS. There are multiple GPS problems in the "Smart City" of Singapore but somehow Uber compounds them. Three things to consider fixing Uber:

1. You app continuously allocates fares to drivers traveling in the opposition direction form the pick up location. This takes a 4 minute estimate and turns it into an 8-10 minute reality while the driver navigates one way diversions in order to turn around

2. The GPS is particularly slow to refresh in the new version. A driver who seems a ways away is suddenly waiting outside. See 1 for the compounding effect of not really knowing when a driver will turn up

3. My own home address can't seem to "stick" because the app comes up with its own version of where I want to be picked up. Ever since the change drivers are constantly going to the wrong address

One question for all: why?

author: Walid Bahri
title: A "downgrade"
content:
I rarely to never write reviews, but this update really pushed my buttons. As a heavy -really heavy- user of Uber app, the new update is horribly confusing and needs more clicks to get a car and plan the route comparing to before. GPS location cannot be identified properly; last time the app was 100% sure I was 7KMs away from my house. Had to close it completely to enable the right location. I couldn't search for the pickup location either, as I wanted to be picked up from a location that I'll walk to.. but no. No search. No accessible option. Horrible. Terrible update. Things should be simplified, not complicated! I still haven't tried the app while being drunk.. which is mostly why people Uber anyway. I'm sure I'll smash my phone!
Revert back to the old version or just properly make this one more user friendly.

author: MGhostSoft
title: Beware of overcharges and dishonest behavior!
content:
Sometimes if you search an airport in your city, the destination is set to the middle of a runway, and the calculated route is several miles longer than what it actually is. You pay $4-6 extra than what you should. I reported this to Uber over a year ago but never received any response.

And Uber thinks that people will get used to alway being tracked. No. I am not giving your permission and will not use your service, including UberEats.

And we still haven't forgotten that you used to reserve hundreds of Lyft cars then cancel, and repeat and repeat. What a mean company!

I haven't used Uber for over a year. But I'm keeping this app because you tend to update it frequently to hide negative reviews and I'll make sure to post one as soon as your app is updated.

author: cartercoltrane
title: Borderline fraudulent business practices
content:
I am a longtime uber rider. And I am very, very angry about the way they show the available ubers in the map view before you choose to call a ride. Oftentimes, especially for pools, the map will show many drivers within  a few minutes of my destination, and the eta will show 2-3 min. But then I call it and it sometimes takes 7-10 min. On top of that, they make you pay to cancel a ride. I have heard that many of the cars in the map view are fake, just to entice you into ordering a car which you think will arrive much sooner than it actually will.

To sum up: this company lures you in by falsely claiming there are fast rides in the area, the sticks you with a ride that's 10 min out, then makes you pay to cancel it if you can't wait that long. This is honestly borderline fraudulent behavior and I am surprised this company has not yet been caught doing it...

author: allycat888111
title: location services
content: there should be an option to only allow the application to use your location services while using the program not always or never

author: J.Y.
title: Go back to "While Using" Location Settings
content: Other apps like Lyft offer this option and you should too. It's bad enough that you are stumbling from one bad PR move to the next, could you please get your app privacy settings in order?

author: cbuts
title: I do not want Uber to always access my location
content: The service itself is great. The new version of the app is terrible. Please provide an option to only access location when the app is open.

author: Blancotx
title: BEWARE:  Driver canceled on me & uber charged ME!!
content: Horrible experience this week so I'm done. I booked a ride to an important biz mtg I had flown out for and the app says the driver is only 6 minutes away and I should arrive in plenty of time. After waiting 10 minutes I call the guy and he says he's "2 minutes away".  After another 5 minutes go by I call again fearing I'm going to be late for my mtg now.  He again says "2 minutes". I tell him that's what he said last time so he gets horsy with me and cancels ON ME.  Now I have to book a different driver which I did and he was great.  But then I get a charge for $5 for a cancellation fee.   I contact uber "support" and they tell me the charge was "appropriate" and they will NOT refund but will give me a future credit.  We go back and forth over email and uber refuses to give my money back.  I own a business and I know you don't treat customers like this unless you don't care if they leave. So...I'm out.  I'm principled and I refuse to support a company wth this kind of attitude.  I will use Lyft or Ride or anything else even if it costs more.   So, buyer beware...

author: Em Higg
title: Routing Issues
content:
However the pooling route is determined in the app makes any trip with uber at least an extra 15 minutes. I feel like they are getting worse and worse as I am often in a pool forced to turn around to go 10 blocks to grab someone else to turn back around to head in the actual and original destination. There is no way anyone would consider these pick ups "in route." 
Additionally, there have been multiple occasions that I had had a trip started without even being in the car. Then, after the driver ignored me, I was forced to cancel the trip, costing me $7, to simply order another uber. 
The customer service has been poor in responses, the pick ups are in now way along the route, and drivers are unreliable as of late. 

Sorely disappointed in the decline of the service.

author: Living in SF
title: Horrible Services. Adios
content:
I am really disappointed at their services lately. I am deleting the app. Time estimates are wrong every single time. If you cancel it they will charge you, matter of factly, they charge you right away( just look at your bank account). When you are trying to address an issue, they use automatic messages, that will give a credit for your next ride but not reimbursement as it's not "in accordance with their policy". You driver never arrived and cancelled your trip? They charge you $5, again without reimbursement. And I don't need their credit as I am not gonna use their services anymore. And that's after using it on a daily basis for  few years. I do not care if my concerns are heard, Uber, if you cannot fix anything. 
"We appreciate your thoughts on this, and understand you’re frustrated you did not receive a cancellation fee refund on this trip. Our team has reviewed this trip, and we can confirm that a full refund of the cancellation fee is not in accordance with our policy. 

Please know that your concerns have been heard. We understand that we likely will not see eye-to-eye on this issue. With that, the credit will remain on your account and we are closing out this discussion."

author: RecentUpdates
title: Unusable (lack of privacy).
content: I will not be using this app anymore. Because I declined letting the app keep tracking my location even while I am not using the app, it is now next to useless. Good thing I still have Lyft installed, because with Uber there is not even an option in the privacy tab on the phone's settings for tracking location "Only while using", like there is for other apps (Including Lyft).

author: Lance J.
title: Avoid update - serious issues with current version.
content:
Watch out - the "new" version of the Uber app has a serious issue where it pretty much wants you to give it rights to your exact location ALL the time - while you sleep, while you're at work, while you're driving your own car - literally ALWAYS. 

All-the-time GPS drains batteries, and I don't want to give Uber the right to sniff my every move every minute of the day. This is just stupid of Uber. 

I suggest you try some of excellent alternatives that don't make the same private data management error.  Most of the same exact drivers work for the alternatives too, but without the troubling personal privacy practices offered by Uber.  And most alternatives, I have learned, are less expensive.  We all win!

Original Review: 
Since the app and service are tightly coupled, my review is for both. 

Overall, very good. Generally better than a cab. I have had one problem driver - crazy guy - but likely no less crazy than some cab drivers I have had. 

App could be easier to use, but it is quite good.

author: 1drllama
title: ‼️Dangerous‼️
content: It is unclear how they conduct their background checks, but it is severely inadequate or altogether nonexistent. While driving in an Uber, a family member of mine was sexually assaulted by the driver. After filing a police report, we found out the man had a repeated history of armed aggravated assault as well as other crimes. After contacting the company, they provided a refund, but have ignored all other attempts of contact. They are also now paying for the driver's lawyer in court. Getting in an Uber is just as safe as getting in a total strangers car. Their priorities lay solely in profits, not safety.

author: snaketech
title: Will never use again
content: I have use uber in many different cities but will never use them again. I had one driver get in a wreck and he just takes off doesn't stop to see if the car was ok or people yells at guy then runs with me in the car and then wanted money from me. That was just one time for charged for a driver that never showed up and was not Close to me at all said I was a no-show and then they charge me the was a mile away per the app the time said 6 minutes away tried to get my money back but no luck had the use the bank to get it back   I'm done with you guys

author: Fruyxdfer$&$
title: User
content: Are use Uber primarily for my sister who is disabled and elderly. I never had any problems until the new application. Since we do not live together I have to disable the location services in order for them to pick her up at her home. This took hours for me to realize what the problem was. Then yesterday the driver canceled the trip because he could not locate the address. He actually went to the wrong location. As a result I was charged a cancellation fee and had to order a new trip. It took quite some time to navigate through the app to complain about the cancellation fee which of course they canceled. Why put your customers through this?

author: Icu87a
title: Cool
content: Cool app

author: Miranan17
title: Uber is THE WORST
content: Uber is evil. Horrible company, even worse customer service. I had a ride where I was sexually harassed and when I reported it, they took TEN HOURS to respond. They called me at 3 am and then sent me an email saying "sorry we missed you". Then, last week my driver drove over 30 minutes out of the way because she assumed I lived in one part of the city. When I asked where she was going, she said she assumed that's where I lived. I pointed out that the GPS even had my address. Uber charged me $20 for what was originally a $4 ride. When I contacted them, they responded that it's company policy to charge if a driver takes a longer route. Since then, I have sent EIGHT emails to them to try and get my money refunded for my drivers mistake. They have not responded. They are a completely trash company. I would NEVER recommend them to my friends or anyone else for that matter. Also, Lyft is better and has better customer service. Maybe Uber should ask them for help with their customer service since it's severely lacking.

author: DaisyBee!
title: Really!?
content: I've always supported uber as an alternative/ evolution of taxi services, but shady privacy invasion is a line in the sand. I started using uber because it felt safer than a taxi, don't ruin it by creeping on people- There is no honest or appropriate reason to track people's location when not using the app. In the few times I've used it since the update, I've had to kill the app & manually go into privacy settings & turn off location as soon as I get out of the car. Also somehow since the new update, the normal 2 minute wait for a ride has turned into 8-15. Come on, don't make this hard! I'm done now, I guess we'll see if lyft is less sketch!?

author: kinayat
title: Allow "While Using"
content: Loved the app, used it frequently both for business and personal use, always recommended the app to friends and colleagues. Then they changed their location services settings so they no longer allow "while using". Unfortunately, I feel that was a bad decision. These days consumers, like me, are very concerned about privacy, not just location, and the amount of information that is shared with the companies with whom we do business. I don't care if you ignore this review, along with the other customers, that posted the same concern. Since I have chosen to "never" allow sharing my location, you should care that my end user experience has deteriorated. You should also know that I will stop recommending UBER to colleagues and friends. I won't delete the app yet, in hopes that you change.  Once I lose patience, you will no longer be needed.

author: rj0001
title: Convenient
content: Don't know what all the negative reviews are for. But I went to Vegas 2 weeks ago and was told to use Uber not a taxi because of the prices of taxis. Was very convenient and price was about half of what a taxi was. And the most I had to wait for a ride to as about 3-4 minutes, most of the time they were right there. And I normally do not leave 5 star reviews.

author: Slicovico
title: Rates are going up try Lyft
content: Uber used to be cheap now they cost almost as much as taxies. Lyft is cheaper in my area at the moment. Uninstalling this app.

author: TAP OR SNAP
title: Never Again
content: My Wife and I used the app for the first time today. We ordered seven items at $44 and only received three items. One the items we specifically requested no cheese (lactose intolerant) low and behold they added it all over. We ordered 4 empanadas and received just one. Ordered Rice,Beans and Steak and it wasn't delivered. The Restaurant La Masa,who we immediately phoned,claimed they didn't have Steak. We are still waiting to be refunded. Never Again!!!!!

author: KathyArtist
title: Worst UI of all my apps
content: Nothing is easy or intuitive to figure out in this app. Here's an example: wanted to add a new credit card to replace old expired credit card. Added the new one but couldn't figure out how to delete the old one. It kept defaulting to old one when I tried to set up a ride. Couldn't get it to access new one. Got frustrated and just switched to Lyft. Still don't like it. Its basic flaws are still there.

author: Uiuc929
title: Major (disappointing) privacy change in new version!
content:
This is very disappointing. Uber took away the option to limit location tracking to "only when using the app." Now, the only two options are "always" and "never"...and the app doesn't work on "never."

Even though Uber currently includes a long disclaimer message about exactly when they're tracking location, the "always" setting takes control of our location privacy out of our hands and puts it squarely in Uber's hands. All they have to do now is change their privacy policy in the future to say they're going to track 24/7 and we'll have no control over it other than to stop using the app. 

I hope Uber takes note of this and restores the "only while using the app" option for location privacy.

author: Tammie J
title: Uber is overrated......don't waste your money
content: I tried using the Uber app yesterday and my driver came and picked me up. While en route, the app literally kicked me and my driver off the trip and ended it suddenly-neither one of us cancelled.....how could I? I was already in the car! I was still in the car when my driver called the Support help line, and even that didn't go through and the line hung up. Next thing I know I'm still being charged for the trip and I'm tired of sending 5 emails over and over again explaining something that was neither my fault nor my drivers fault but UBER, for setting up a very faulty application where even the Support doesn't even live up to the name.  Who made this app anyways? Don't quit your day job......

author: Anonymous User 23579
title: Lyft is better
content: Uber took away the option to track location only when using the app. Now the only options are either allow Uber to always track your location even when not using the app, or to never allow Uber to track your location in which case the app doesn't work properly. I also don't like how I can't tip drivers from within the app so that it gets charged to my credit card. Fortunately, Lyft allows tracking location only when using the app and allows tipping drivers using their app. So I use Lyft now instead.

author: uftbelcp368
title: $20 coupon: T72ZP
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon "t72zp" to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: SJGM9002
title: Worst App Ever
content: After reading countless bad reviews, citing potential overcharges, (realizing I was also overcharged), and unethically using your location even when you're not using the app, or when you're using the app but not trying to get a ride.. I decided to delete the app. Before doing so, I wanted to erase my payment information, but it wouldn't let me until I added a new payment method!!! Hoping to add a new, fake payment method, I clicked on the 'add payment' link, which took me to a blank page!!! There is absolutely no reason that Uber should have my credit card information without my consent. Now I have to go through changing my PayPal account. Do yourself a favor and AVOID UBER.

author: BBustin
title: Location at all times
content:
I do not like that Uber requires allowing access to location data even when the app is not running. The stated intent is to only collect location data up to 5 minutes after a trip. This would allow them to better suggest drop off locations. The problem is there is nothing on the user's side that enforces this. If Uber were to change that policy, there would be no way to know unless a user actively checks or Uber tells users. This is not acceptable. My privacy is more important to me than Uber's analytics. 

Please give us the option to only allow access to location data while the app is open. I have been forced to block all location access to the app making it much less convenient to use.

author: Monoskier_
title: Privacy Fail
content:
Nope. You still don't need my location once I end my ride. Fail

You want your stars back? Gives us back the option of "While Using"

author: Lance Butler
title: Fix location tracking. Always is not acceptable
content:
Uber please fix this immediately. It is not acceptable to continually track users. You only need to use our location when we use the app. I refused to use the service until this is fixed.

Now you want access to my calendar. No.

author: Mdinh013
title: Always tracking location
content:
The app needs an option to only use location when using the app. Not sure why uber can’t do this but Lyft can.
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 开发者回复：We appreciate the feedback. Let us know more about the issue. Send a quick note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll follow up with you.

author: Panchenks
title: Oversteps location privacy
content: The lack of "while using" location privacy option is unacceptable

author: Pissedoff77
title: Location services
content: Location services option needs to go back to switch on only when using app. There's no reason to "Always" require sharing my location. Lyft doesn't have this problem. Keep updating to clear the bad reviews out everyone's just going to keep reposting them. Not sure why apple even allows this.. without actual and proper updates reviews shouldn't be cleared.

author: JustinD9876539282
title: App now requires location ALWAYS
content: They changed the way they track your location to "Always". There is no longer a way to select "while using the app" in privacy >> location services. You can turn off your location but then you need to enter the starting address each time. Other than that, the app has been made even easier to use. Better layout.

author: alvint
title: bad for your battery and bad for your privacy
content:
UPDATE 2: As others have pointed out, Uber is likely pushing new updates just to clear out the bad reviews. They're hoping people will lose interest after a while and they can get away with their deceptive privacy practices unchecked.

UPDATE: It looks like Uber was forced to remove the obvious lie from their app description, but with this version of the app they still can monitor your location at all times--not just when you've used Uber recently. And what about all the people who allowed the app to monitor their location because they believed the lie? The latest "feature" described in this update shows Uber never intended to keep that promise even for a second. Shame on them.

Original review:

I'm an iOS developer and the  description about how they'll use your location information is simply not true. With this configuration not only can they monitor your location for up to 5 minutes after you use the app, but also for up to 5 minutes *practically any time they want*, whether you've used the app or not.

Additionally, apps that monitor your location all the time are one of the bigger causes of battery drain, even on newer devices.

To the developers:

Just be honest--you're yet another company who wants to snoop in on where people go and make a few extra bucks selling that information to the highest bidder. Many people will use the app anyway.

The really irritating thing is that you easily could have left the original option (to get location info only while the app is being used) so that tech savvy people could change it in Settings. Instead you chose to explicitly remove that option and try to force people to accept something that benefits you at the expense of their batteries. Deleted. If you want my business you'll have to bring the option back. Aside from Lyft, there are still plenty of cabs in D.C. and thanks to the competition the cabs are much better than they used to be.

author: tayloraussie23
title: DRIVERS DONT EVEN TRY TO PICKUP
content: This is the second weekend in a row that this has happened. I request an uber. I wait in the spot I request it and no one ever shows up or calls me. Instead I am charged by a driver who didn't even attempt to find me. At that point I am charged and then have to call another uber (of course the price goes up at that point!!!) and they have no problem finding me. I'm so frustrated I cannot even describe it. These Uber drivers take advantage of their job, some drivers are great but some just hope you won't report your experience. And Uber does NOT make it easy to report your driver simply not showing up. There is no option of that in the help section when requesting a refund. I could go on forever but I'll stop here. Don't use Uber.

author: Ferndog_E
title: Account was compromised after first use!
content: While on my trip to Seattle I needed a ride to my hotel. I thought why not give Uber a try. So I installed the app and 40 min later after my original driver canceled my pickup I finally was on my way. The new driver was very nice, we had a good convo, and his car was well maintained. All in all an ok experience. Fast-Forward a month and while at a football game I get a notification that a driver is on there way to pick me up, confused I open the app and see that a driver is on their way to pick me up in Detroit Michigan (mind you I'm in California). I try to cancel the trip but it doesn't work. I search they all the menus of the app trying to reset my password or remove my payment method and nothing! I submit a report to Uber of suspicious activity and I hear nothing for 24-hours. In the meantime this person has taken 2 trips on my dime! I finally hear from Uber and I'm thinking great they'll straighten this out... Nope I was wrong. They tell me they recognize the devise used as mine and the trip consistent with my history! What! I've never been to Detroit and the one trip I took was in Seattle! They listed two names on he account that weren't mine too. All they did was reset my password which I had already done (hint you have to click I forgot my password) to reset it. Anyway I'm still waiting for a response from Uber. But trust me I will never be using their service ever again!

author: BubbaJoeBobMac
title: Uber Arrogance
content: Always on location tracking is unacceptable. Bring back the option for "while using." There is no justification to exclude this opinion. Listen to your customers and change this immediately.

author: Brock_Obama
title: Solid app, responsive drivers
content: Company also taking steps in the right direction, well done...

author: Kaelinnnnn
title: Location service option needs updated
content: I love Uber but the app is why I'm giving it three stars. There are only two options for location services: never or always. I hate having my location services on always becaus that's how my battery gets drained. I would prefer if Uber implemented an option "while using" which is what Lyft does.

author: mike194654
title: From driver perspective absolutely terrible update
content:
Warning: READ TERMS OF SERVICE update. 

Edit: Due to Uber being run under terrible, unethical leadership which spies on you, breaks the law, breaks their own privacy policy and Apple's privacy policy, CEO Travis keeps digging himself into a hole. Deleted.

This new app can't get your location accurately even though it must know where you are at all times even when I'm not using the app. Worse yet, there's no longer a way to drop your pin at your desired pickup location!!!! Why?!?!? I picked up 10 people the other day 7 of them had grossly incorrect locations for pickup, I realize it's not the riders fault, it's this apps fault. Sometimes riders need to drop a pin not just where they ARE but where they're going to be. This new way doesn't allow them to do this.

EDIT: There is a way to do this but you have to set your destination then click on current location before requesting. I think a lot of people will skip this an will ultimately increase the time I have to wait for the rider or the time I have to drive around to find the rider. This should be easier.

author: Adelac24
title: It's impossible to delete Uber.
content: My account (that I have NEVER USED) was hacked. Thank god it was an old debit card # that doesn't exist, attached to it. I tried to get help through the chat and no response. I was able to change my password because it was still linked to my phone and email, so I did, and put in a request to delete my account. It's not an option on the app so I had to frickin google how to delete it (surprise: it's a request, not instant). Now I have to wait for them to delete it. I also read that in their terms and privacy agreements, Uber is allowed to keep your credit and personal information even after you've deleted and severed all ties with them. I. Hate. Uber.

author: Mallard06
title: Privacy nightmare
content: The crisis in leadership at Uber has manifested itself in this company's inability to listen to its employees, drivers and customers. Since Uber began forcing users to 'Always' allow location services, countless customers have complained.  In typical Uber fashion, expediency has overruled compassion and empathy and customer complaints have been ignored. Stop telling customers that you are interested in their feedback if you're just going to ignore it.

author: el chappo810
title: Good but needs improvement
content: I recently used Uber to go out, and, as a blind customer I must say, I am pretty pleased with the way Uber runs it's Corporation! However, I think Uber could use a bit more improvement. First change the location setting back to an optional setting. It drains my battery. Next give us an option to request a driver. Just a few suggestions to make this app better, I would hate for uber to go out of business because it is extremely useful to everyone, especially blind people like myself, keep moving forward

author: oc az us
title: Why over 270 MB update?
content:
Bloated app, probably filled with software that tracks your every movement and avoids lawful monitoring of their service. 

This latest update is 273 MB. Why?

Time to slim down that app!!

author: Zuoan
title: Terrible
content:
Uber app tracks you location even if you are not using it. Combining this with the todays report that uber tried to track your identity even after you deleted its app in 2015, I can clear see that this is a really shady company.

Latest update (may 8) still has all or nothing for location privacy setting. Really terrible.

author: Lanoitarus
title: Requiring location "always" is inexcusable
content: The app worked perfectly before with "when using the app only" location setting, removing that option is user hostile and actively makes the app worse since "never" is an inferior experience that makes Uber hard to use. Oh well, that's just more money for Lyft I guess.

author: imaunajs
title: Uber was great. Now it is worse than a taxi.
content: This app is getting worse, just like the uber service in general. I don't want to enter the destination before I order a car. I don't want uber spying on me. Uber: your service is terrible.

author: Anonymous User 23579
title: Lyft is better
content: Uber took away the option to track location only when using the app. Now the only options are either allow Uber to always track your location even when not using the app, or to never allow Uber to track your location in which case the app doesn't work properly. I also don't like how I can't tip drivers from within the app so that it gets charged to my credit card. Fortunately, Lyft allows tracking location only when using the app and allows tipping drivers using their app. So I use Lyft now instead.

author: Jgostl
title: Love it but....,
content: Why do they insist on dark blue letters on black background. Can't read the darned thing.

author: MrOBrian
title: Beware of reckless Uber drivers!
content:
I use Uber from time to time and usually don't pay attention to the road, but now I will! I walk to work and almost on a daily basis I see Uber drivers run red lights (one almost hit a pedestrian), not even slow down for stop signs, go the wrong way on a one way street, stop in the middle of an intersection for no reason, and fail to yield right away to anyone, but especially pedestrians. I've tried to report incidents to Uber support but just get canned responses back that have nothing to do with what I wrote them about.

Uber: PLEASE allow us to see the make, model and license plate number of cars on the map in the app, and allow people to report drivers for reckless behavior. You should also do something to prevent drivers from using the app while their car is in motion since that is illegal in many places, and for good reason, but your app seems to encourage distracted driving.

author: Darwin5
title: Surge pricing
content: I'm writing this review because I have a problem with the new way you are representing surge pricing. Basically I can't see how much more I'm paying. That matters to me. If the surge priced flat-fee fair that is posted is too much for me I'm just not going to use the app. But if I see how much more I am paying, like I could in the past, I'm more likely to consider taking the ride over another company. The lack of transparency in what you are charging me is also discomforting. You say "no more complicated math". Multiplying 1.5%-5% price increases isn't hard, and it's insulting that you think your customers aren't intelligent enough to figure it out. What this does look like is you trying to hide extra costs from your customers. Unless things change I'll probably be using lyft for a while, which is consistently half the cost of any uber ride right now.

author: Powerplayr
title: Terrible!
content: The updated app was so hyped by Uber (email campaign, ads, etc) that I did think it must have been the next great thing, not that I found anything wrong with the app as I was using it already. I don't use uber terribly frequently, but did 4 times in the past two days and each time I was never notified the driver had arrived. It is quite cold in Chicago right now so I was indoors and watched the app for eta always showing 1 minute away, then when I went outside noticed the drivers were sitting idle waiting on me. That made me feel bad for the drivers since they had to wait for no good reason. Then, I needed to update an address and literally could not figure it out in new app. So driver had to complete my trip at wrong address and wanted me to start a new trip. I couldn't even get picked up by the driver whose car I was sitting in! Ridiculous!! last straw...uber wants my location ALL THE TIME. For what?? I only need to share where I am when I need a ride!

author: wyodave
title: Privacy issues
content:
The Uber app is tracking my location when I'm not using the app. I have not used the app since 15 December yet Location services on my iPhone say the app has used my location in the last 24 hours. Not cool. I want the option back to only allow the app to use my location when I'm using the app. 

I have also found this version not very accuarate when indicaing my location. Never had any issues with pervious versions but this one shows my location significantly off from my real location and I have to be sure to check before requesting a ride otherwise the driver is looking in the wrong place.

author: ashleyrg95
title: Poor customer service and removed car description
content: Several times and uber has let me out and continued my ride w/o or even passed me up and decided to cancel the ride instead of turning around. When I can't act uber support I'm told 100% of the time that it is my fault. That I should be waiting outside when I am and have attempted to make several calls. I also hear tht though it is the drivers mistake it's still my fault. After going in circles I'm offered credit like no put that back on my card. ALSO when I look up driver description it doesn't tell me what the cars color is so I don't know what I'm looking out for. Not everyone is a car expert. Please bring this back

author: Jodiesel34678632
title: Stop updating
content: I like your service. However I am really tired of you updating your app every 5 minutes. One more update this month and I'm deleting it.

author: Anonymous User 23579
title: Lyft is better
content: Uber took away the option to track location only when using the app. Now the only options are either allow Uber to always track your location even when not using the app, or to never allow Uber to track your location in which case the app doesn't work properly. I also don't like how I can't tip drivers from within the app so that it gets charged to my credit card. Fortunately, Lyft allows tracking location only when using the app and allows tipping drivers using their app. So I use Lyft now instead.

author: Lance J.
title: Serious flaws soil Uber; lots of better providers.
content:
I used Uber quite a lot over the past several years...  but now Uber has run off the rails. Their privacy setting for n the app pretty much wants you give the app full access to your exact location ALL the time. No thanks to tracking me all the time. All-the-time GPS drains batteries too. This is just stupid Uber. 

But I am happy to report one AWESOME  thing about Uber's downgrade - Uber convinced me to try Lyft and Fasten. Both are excellent, less expensive alternatives to Uber, and without the personal privacy abuses offered by Uber.

Thanks Uber, for showing me that there are better fish in the sea. 

Original Review: 
Since the app and service are tightly coupled, my review is for both. 

Overall, very good. Generally better than a cab. I have had one problem driver - crazy guy - but likely no less crazy than some cab drivers I have had. 

App could be easier to use, but it is quite good.

author: RawrI'mATurtle
title: High Price, No Warning
content: So when demand is high Uber uses something called "Surge Pricing" to compensate for the high demand and low amount of drivers. In the past the app would stop to notify you to make sure you accept this increased rate before requesting your ride. Upon receiving your receipt you'd be notified of the up charge on your regular fare due to surge pricing. However, since about October 2016 they've stopped notifying riders of surge pricing and have removed the surge pricing notification on their receipts as well. Be warned, if you don't see it on the tiny price estimate before requesting your ride then you'll be charged extra for your fare without any indication as to why. And as I found out this afternoon, Uber doesn't care if you ever know or not and contacting customer support will only have you be rudely told that you were charged surge pricing and notified of it without any evidence to prove any notification was issued. Worst customer service I have ever dealt and the shadiest pricing system I have ever seen! I use ride sharing services 8-12 times a week and I have never been so disgusted by such a lack of quality in this service before. It's about time we all transition back to Lyft until Uber decides to finally let us know when they decide to suddenly charge more rather than inflating our prices out of the blue and without our knowledge!!!

author: Avenged6661
title: Patiently waiting until you go out of business
content: This company is so poorly run I can't understand why it's so popular. They treat their drivers like crap, their drivers treat their customers like crap, no one is held accountable for anything that happens to passengers. There is no way to ensure that your driver is a safe or educated driver. I can't count how many times individual drivers have made me carsick, ran red lights, and almost run pedestrians over with me in the car. There's not even a guarantee that your uber driver isn't driving you home drunk right now as you're reading this. It's disgusting, it shouldn't be allowed. On top of the generally horrible service quality, this app continues to get worse and harder to use each time it's updated. I now have to go out of my way to make sure that the default address chosen by the gps as a pickup point is actually where I am! What a joke! GPS is too inaccurate to put my driver at my CLEARLY NUMBERED front door when given an address, yet now Uber is charging fare for passengers who don't make it to the car in time? This company is complete and utter horse crap! Go out of business already!

author: fugly_mofo
title: Spy Tool, Not Cool - Bad Uberrrr
content:
Do You Really Want To Support Evil? Uber is pretty much evil incarnate these days, stalking people, harassing women out of work, even chewing out their own drivers. 

As far as the creepy stalking, Uber app made a change and now offers only the false dilemma of "ALWAYS" or "NEVER" using your location data. They do this for nefarious purposes, guaranteed.

You should use Uber with location services completely disabled!

It actually works better this way in fact, because you can just input the exact destination you want to be picked up at instead of having the app always try to guess where you are. 

Give it a try, disable Location Services for Uber under Settings > Privacy > Location Services > Uber - set to "NEVER"

If they give us the "While Using The App" option back I'll stop posting a one star review every time they update the app. Until then, F-Uuuuuber!

PS- why on top of everything else shady that they do, do they hate women as well? Befuddled.

author: Katarakit1669725
title: Horrible experience
content: I had been with uber for a while. Key word: had. Time and time again I got charged more than I was supposed to for no good reason. But, I took it in stride, tried to overlook the extra dollar or three. But this last time, I got charged a cleaning fee for no good reason! The state of the car was the same as when I got in when I left. I always check to make sure I didn't leave anything behind. I get out, thinking everything was great, except the dirty look the driver gave me when I got into the car with some leftover fries in a container in a bag. Little did I know that, later that night, I would get the biggest fee I had ever gotten. An 80 dollar cleaning fee! For what? A French fry odor? It wasn't even that strong since, again, the fries were wrapped up good. So, suffice it to say, that was the last straw. I use Lyft and the bus line now and never want to look back. Uber used to be great....what the heck happened?!

author: AshbleyJ
title: Terrible Customer Service
content: I have been riding with Uber for almost 5 years and while I loved the app when it first launched, it has devolved into a chore at best and a complete nightmare at worst. I have deleted the app and will now exclusively use other services such as Via and Lyft. My driver drove away without me being in the car last night. I attempted to contact the driver to no avail. The customer service response was canned and not helpful whatsoever. Clearly, rider loyalty and frequency has no bearing on Uber's policies and that shows an egregious disregard for rider well-being in general. This incident coupled with routinely gouged prices, technical problems (app shutting down unexpectedly etc), and poor drivers (from the suburbs who don't know city streets or how to drive in the city) make Uber more trouble than it is worth. Don't give your money to this company, I know I no longer will be.

author: Alwaysari
title: Great Company
content:
It is a reliable, user friendly, easy to navigate service. Very convenient for people who are in a hurry and don't have time to wait for the bus. I support uber as a company.

Edit: moving to 1 star because they charge you when your driver doesn't go to the correct pickup location. I called and my driver did not answer. I shouldn't have to walk around the entire mall to meet them. Also one of my drivers never showed up and it showed him stopped for 20 minutes. I filed a report because I believed he was in an accident or something went wrong and they refused to contact him to find out. I should also have the option to block a driver. Sometimes I have awful drivers and they keep accepting my ride requests and I have to keep cancelling and I can't request an uber.

author: Lfartola
title: What's going on with apple pay?
content: Service is ok, but control over the customers is excessive. I used to pay for my rides in both the US and Mexico using apple pay on my iphone (my account is US based). Now it doesn't work in Mexico anymore, forcing me to enter my credit card info because Uber purposely blocked it based on location. That's an unnecessary and excessive control over the customers. Apple Pay is just a credit card payment, and users based in a country where apple pay is already available should still be allowed to use it in any other country they travel to. It does not matter whether apple pay is supported in that other country or not, because even if it's not, apple pay will still be recognized by the local payment system as a valid credit card. I can prove that because I used it in Mexico just fine until Uber purposely blocked it based on location. Since then, I get an error "apple pay not available in this region" when I request a ride in Mexico and choose apple pay as payment. I don't like being controlled that way.

There used to be an option to only allow the app to see your location WHILE USING, but uber has disabled this in the hope that you will allow them to track you constantly.

author: uznhjeoa368
title: $20 coupon: UberJFMA29ue
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: SocialBandwidth
title: Creepy: Demands 24x7 access to GPS
content: They made it mandatory to grant the app  access to my location at all times. Even when the app is not running. Very intrusive! I hope they will review that decision. I will not use them until it is back to how it was before: that the user can set it to allow location info only while the app is in use.

content: Don't be confused by the hype that this update is user friendly with improved shortcuts.  The app requires extra steps to confirm your pick-up location.  This is especially important when requesting a car at SFO and need to specify terminal and door number.  The app does not let you easily see where the cars are located prior to making a request.  I was told a car would arrive in 15 minutes only after making a request.  I could not compare wait times between uber x, select, or black.  And finally, the app never notified me the car was arriving.  This is no longer a productivity tool for a business traveler.  I probably will have to find a better alternative

author: Meka Ogazi
title: Terrible customer service, user experience and price fluctuations
content: Customer service never really helps with any issues or complaints I have, signed me up for a driver account I never wanted and I can't edit my personal info without completely filling out the driver app which requires my social security number and ID even though I don't drive and they permanently keep this info on file, but I'm not a driver. Price for riding back and forth to places is crazy expensive now.

author: Yury_A
title: Location services always on - 1 star
content: I wish I could give it zero stars. Uber wants to track me all the time? No way!

author: mcinger
title: Really disappointed about their poor customer service
content:
The app was generally ok but the customer service is just terrible.
I took a ride last time. My Uber driver continued to drive for her previous customer for 40 minutes after she accepted my request which caused me  to miss out my appointment. If I declined the ride during the wait I would be charged of extra fee by Uber, so I had to wait in the snow for 40 minutes.
Altough my Uber driver felt sorry and didn't want to charge me, I was still charged by Uber. What's more, After I wrote to Uber three times regarding this, I finally get a reply today telling me that it is ok and I was fairly charged. But I don't think this is ok!

author: User Acceptance Tester
title: Seriously flawed app
content:
The app prompts riders to drop a pin rather than enter the EXACT address.  This leads to poor quality pick up location data. 
Riders then have to confirm the address over the  phone or text the proper address - the step that could have been skipped if proper address was entered in the first place. Had uber devised a convenient was to enter addresses, it would have led to faster pick-ups. 

The app vehicle location tracking function has unacceptable lag (by a couple of minutes), confusing the riders with the absurd ETA. The riders don's see where the car IS, they can only see where the car WAS.

The riders are not allowed to voluntarily submit their pictures for faster pick-ups.
However, the riders are forced to share their location 24/7.

Riders have to use third party apps like Cash app for cashless tipping - really inconvenient.

There is no mandatory security recording in the vehicle to assure the riders' safety.

Riders can't request only those drivers that volunteered for fingerprint check. 

The app looks poorly designed, busy with too many offers and promotions.

author: Gorberg
title: Uber is terrible, they delete the bad reviews once a week
content: Check your review in about a week, only you will be able to see your review no one else. I find Uber's business practices to be sneaky and despicable. I'm not going to recommend this app from Uber. The Uber app pulls the resale value out of your car to Pay YOU. Uber needs to compensate and pay the drives real money, so they can fix and maintain there car's. Uber doesn't pay much to the drivers at all (Uber keeps about 60% of what the rider pay UBER). Once you consider your fuel cost, extremely high cost of ride-share car insurance, car maintenance and the terrible wear and tear on the car itself plus significant lose of value of your car at resale, especially because of the super high miles on your vehicle. The Uber app is a very bad deal for the drive. However the riders are getting a great deal on your dime and time. Sorry for the bad new.

author: alvint
title: bad for your battery and bad for your privacy!
content:
UPDATE 2: As others have pointed out, Uber is likely pushing new updates just to clear out the bad reviews. They're hoping people will lose interest after a while and they can get away with their deceptive privacy practices unchecked.

UPDATE: It looks like Uber was forced to remove the obvious lie from their app description, but with this version of the app they still can monitor your location at all times--not just when you've used Uber recently. And what about all the people who allowed the app to monitor their location because they believed the lie? The latest "feature" described in this update shows Uber never intended to keep that promise even for a second. Shame on them.

Original review:

I'm an iOS developer and the  description about how they'll use your location information is simply not true. With this configuration not only can they monitor your location for up to 5 minutes after you use the app, but also for up to 5 minutes *practically any time they want*, whether you've used the app or not.

Additionally, apps that monitor your location all the time are one of the bigger causes of battery drain, even on newer devices.

To the developers:

Just be honest--you're yet another company who wants to snoop in on where people go and make a few extra bucks selling that information to the highest bidder. Many people will use the app anyway.

The really irritating thing is that you easily could have left the original option (to get location info only while the app is being used) so that tech savvy people could change it in Settings. Instead you chose to explicitly remove that option and try to force people to accept something that benefits you at the expense of their batteries. Deleted. If you want my business you'll have to bring the option back. Aside from Lyft, there are still plenty of cabs in D.C. and thanks to the competition the cabs are much better than they used to be.
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 开发者回复：This doesn't sound right. We want to take a closer look into this for you. Please send a note to t.uber.com/contact so we can follow up with you.

author: Monoskier_
title: Privacy Fail
content:
Nope. You still don't need my location once I end my ride. Fail.   You want your stars back? Gives us back the option of "While Using"

One reason I started using Uber because of the "no tipping". Since that was built into the rate, and now we have to tip, why haven't you reduced your rates to reflect the change?  Oh, that's right, your a shady company that has no respect for your employees or customers.
I'd rather walk than give you another dime. The only reason I keep the app around is to continue with the 1 star ratings.
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 开发者回复：Feedback such as this will only improve the app and experience with Uber. Let us know more by heading to t.uber.com/contact. We'll be sure to follow up with you from there.

author: Help me choose a nickname
title: Useless unless you're willing to let Uber spy on you
content:
The app is mostly crippled unless you enable full-time location access (vs. just when using the app).  Give Uber's history of a total lack of concern for riders' privacy, that's a permission in not willing to give the app.

Hey Uber, if you're intention _isn't_ to spy on your riders, how about adding the option to use Location services only while using the app? (I'm not holding my breath on that one.)

It's a simple fix. Most other apps have figured it out.  Are you just incompetent, or is our privacy worth that much as a marketable asset?

Lyft it is.

author: HDBoogie
title: Got from Point A to B with Good People
content: I have had great experiences with 99% of my rides. The .1% that wasn't great was due to the driver using Google Maps and it took us on a Journey instead of the quickest route. Uber made it right by sending me a refund for the appropriate fare. I turn off the location services when not using the app. It makes no sense to have it on all the time. That's intrusive. This app and the driver's have been a great relief from me having to drive myself.

author: Thizz_Nasty
title: I wish I could give no stars
content:
Terrible application, it has blocked me out of my acct, when I have a 4.4 rating saying email uber and they will respond quickly. I emailed twice with no response. I have no idea why I've been blocked out of my acct. Uber are raping us of our rights to privacy and is a unorthodox way of dealing with their customers. SHAME ON ALL OF YOU!! 

I hope you shut down, and all those allegations go through because uber, you do not take care at of your customers. With over a billion worldwide users its unethical the way you people conduct business. 0 stars

author: uznhjeoa368
title: $20 coupon: izzyb756ue
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: Anonymous User 23579
title: Lyft is better
content: Uber took away the option to track location only when using the app. Now the only options are either allow Uber to always track your location even when not using the app, or to never allow Uber to track your location in which case the app doesn't work properly. I also don't like how I can't tip drivers from within the app so that it gets charged to my credit card. Fortunately, Lyft allows tracking location only when using the app and allows tipping drivers using their app. So I use Lyft now instead.

author: BabyRosey
title: No longer using Uber
content: Multiple times I have had a ride cancelled and still be billed. Which is a hassle in itself. However, it won't allow me to rate those who cancelled and took my money. This app was at first interesting and fun. I have met some interesting drivers, but those who abuse it or don't follow through ruined it. The fact that multiple times I have had to call my bank and tell them what happened is ridiculous and the fact that there is drivers using it who will be so rude, unprofessional, and still have the audacity to call me and lie has finally made me give this app up.

author: Sarahjobs
title: Terrible customer service and wait times
content: Well this app may work fine sometimes, most of the time the waiting times are completely inaccurate which will make you late to work or wherever you are planning to go. The most annoying part of this is that should you be waiting 10 minutes for an Uber that said it was three minutes away and decide to cancel, you are now charged five dollars for the Apps inaccurate time estimate. If a driver is not where they should be within the time allotted I should not be charged a cancellation fee, it's ridiculous and like being charged for bad service. I will be deleting my app now and seeing if I have better luck with Lyft. Additionally ever since I told them I wanted to delete my account they have not gotten back to me. I've sent the request to delete my account twice now.

author: Whydotheydeleteitentirely
title: My uber driver robbed me!!!
content: Took an uber home after a hockey game and the driver literally drove 20 mins out of the way to get a longer route for more money. He didn't even follow the GPS directions, he just went his "own way" and that's unacceptable AND expensive. We had to sit helpless for a 40 MIN CAR RIDE that was originally only supposed to be 20 mins. He drove us around town with unlimited access to our credit card to charge himself for however long he wanted to drive for. That's ridiculous!!! We should be safe taking an uber but it's not safe at all!

author: 0saMaa
title: Bring the old app BACK!!
content: You're slowing the user to reach their desired destination by letting us choose the destination first, what I want the most is the uber driver to start driving to me, and then I could choose where to go while the driver is on his/her way. In addition, what if the location is not on your list of locations? I tried going to Starbucks with an uber by guiding her to my destination because your app didn't show me where that Starbucks is located. Please bring back the old version of the app.

author: The_Vig
title: Location Services Sham
content:
You guys need to stop with the attempts to capture the movement of customers when they are not using the app. As soon as you required it the first time I changed my app settings to never as I'm sure several others have done. 

There's no reason for any app to require location services to always be on. While using the app is the only acceptable option for location services.

author: Hsourai
title: No need for tipping option
content: No need for tipping option. Expensive enough already.

author: N23M
title: Such poor customer service that the app won't let you delete your account
content: I wish I had a better experience with Uber but when a driver cancels and I'm charged $5 that's bad. What's worse is that when I contacted Uber (not by phone of course) they were only willing to give me a credit on my account. That to me is unacceptable I should have received a refund not a credit.

author: LuisArley
title: Uber driver
content: Ive used uber for first time and it was because i really needed a ride from car rental place to my hotel. When i booked the uber i was in an empty lot and my phone battery was low like 5% battery life, i thought i would be helpful and txt the driver i was sitting tight and waiting under the street light. Uber app said driver was 19 min away it was alright with me but i texted driver once more let him know my phone's battery was very low and as soon as he read it he un booked me im not sure why i txted him again saying how much i needed the ride because my phone was about to die he never replied but right before my phone totally turned off on me i received a notification from uber letting me know they where charging me a $5 fee for the driver canceling on me ¿? I walked 5 miles to the hotel thanks to uber never using this app ever again i regret ever downloading it sorry great failure thanks uber

author: @Four0Seven
title: Deleted
content:
Previously, Uber had all 3 options for using location services. I had mine set to While Using the App, but since that's now gone, I'm not going to keep using it. I'll be using Lyft instead.

If you want to try Lyft for free, use my code: DAVID224995

author: DrowningSpades
title: Ride Pass Ripoff
content: Absolutely unbelievable how a company will market a so called "ride pass" that doesn't even work properly with no customer support whatsoever. My sister and I both purchased the uber ride pass for our area hoping to save money and believed the pass was worth $10, unfortunately the pass does not work anywhere. After promising to deliver on flat fares Uber just took our money like thieves, there is no map designed to show the range of the ride pass nor does any location near or far apply the flat fares. I'm never using this service again after I get my refund.

author: BubbaJoeBobMac
title: Uber Arrogance
content: Always on location tracking is unacceptable. There is no justification to exclude the option for customers to choose "while using." Despite many reviews and complaints by others they refuse to enable this option. Luckily it appears Apple is paying attention and it is rumored that the next release of iOS will remove the ability for developers to exclude the "while using" option. I applaud Apple for respecting user's privacy and stepping in when others like Uber refuse to  treat their customers with respect.

author: Chibluekitty
title: No scheduling rides? Always set to access location data?? Delays in loading info
content:
New app is a step backwards 

And I have no interest in an app having only the choices of never or always for accessing my location data. Privacy concerns galore. Why not only allow location access when in use (as it was before). 

Terrible overall update so far

author: Scrappyz
title: You don't need my location 24/7
content: I switched to Lyft after I found out that Uber requires your location, even when not using the App.  Until they change this I won't be using it anymore.

author: ny_gus
title: Drivers ask clients to leave the car then they don't like the destination
content:
I work in SAn Francisco and live in Sausalito. I had multiple drivers pick me up and refuse to complete the trip, because they 'don't want to drive there'

Are you  your training your drivers in the same program as United? Is it ok, for them to accept the ride and then ask client to leave, because they want shorter runs?

How is that different then taxis industry that you are trying to disrupt ... seriously

author: Rudeabaga
title: App Requires to Know Your Location Always
content: As the title says. It is very hard to trust an app that constantly wants to know your location. They claim they only track for 5 minutes after the trip has ended, but even then, they don't give users the option. It's either location services are on (so you can use the app) or it's off (and the app is useless). Please revert back to the original settings in which location services are "Only when the app is open"

author: Pissedoff77
title: Location services
content: Location services option needs to go back to switch on only when using app. There's no reason to "Always" require sharing my location. Lyft doesn't have this problem. Keep updating to clear the bad reviews out everyone's just going to keep reposting them. Not sure why apple even allows this.. without actual and proper updates reviews shouldn't be cleared.

My home address on Uber app send the driver to the opposite site of my street. author: Vukir

Manually turning the service on and off is just one of many issues with Uber as a company. Convenience and privacy are apparently second to data mining and app updates that do little every week with cryptic update notes. 

For all the hassle I may as well uninstall the app and grab it the few occasions I need it.

author: MGhostSoft
title: Watch out overcharges!!
content:
When you search the airport of your city, check the route carefully because possibly the destination is set to the middle of a runway and the route is several miles longer than it should be. As a result, you're paying $4~$6 extra for the distance you won't travel. I reported to Uber several month ago and never heard back.

And, do they think people are used to the "Always on" location tracking? No reason for me to allow them to track my location 5 minutes after drop off, and no reason to trust them only doing what the claimed to do.

And, people like me still haven't forgotten that Uber requested hundreds of Lyft cars then cancelled them and did so again and again. What a mean company.

Not that I'm still using this app. In fact, I have not used it ever since I found the overcharging trap. Not to mention the location tracking. I'm just keeping this app installed so that I can get back and leave a 1-star review whenever it is updated.

author: crichton007

author: Neocryptz
title: Insurance fraud
content: Uber only requires full coverage. But your a commercial passenger. so if you get in an accident and the insurance company investigates after an accident then the driver could lose out and you the customer could be stuck with medical bills and loss of work or wages and possibly lose use of a limb in certain cases. Is a cheap ride worth it? I think not.  You get what you pay for. Cabs are required to carry insurance worth over 1 Million Dollars in case of an accident. Uber won't pay your medical and if the other driver caused the accident it will still be investigated by the insurance companies. They are not friends or family riding in your Uber cars it is complete strangers.
