author: uftbelcp368
title: $20 coupon: T72ZP
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon "t72zp" to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: vipoor
title: No reason to always track my location! 😡
content: The app and service was great until they started trying to be big brother and always track my location - there is NO legitimate need for this, no technical or feature need. If you want to have that data for your other service like Eats and other crap, track it in those apps, but don't violate my privacy and disguise it as necessary to make service better. And the fact that you prevent access certain areas of the app unless location is enabled is terrible - your PMs that approved this should be fired...finally switching to Lyft after years as Uber exclusive customer.

author: pgk2008
title: Invasive GPS tracking policy even after many user complaints
content:
Location tracking is all or nothing with Uber. Normal apps offer "track only when using", but Uber demands "Always track". If the past year has taught us anything, it's "don't trust Uber to do the right thing". 

It looks like they're not in a hurry to listen to customers' complaints, since we're at least thirteen updates in since I started paying attention to the GPS issue. It also seems like they abuse the app update system. Weekly 170MB updates with no change log. That's half a gig per month, thanks guys..

Partial workaround for tracking: disable GPS for the Uber app, and only turn it back on if you absolutely need to use the app. And then turn it back off when you get to the destination. 

In the meantime I've been using the friendly Uber competitor, and so far it's worked like a charm. Thanks Uber, for encouraging me to check out other apps!

author: KODE918
title: Horrible Customer service
content:
I'd rather deal with the cable/satellite company (no need to mention names, everyone knows who I'm talking about). 

Recently we took a Lyft from Denver to Boulder for an event, we were quoted $42 in the app and not surprisingly we were charged $42. 

We then chose to use uber for the ride home because we were quoted $32 in the app opposed to $42 with Lyft again. The driver picked us up, verified the address we entered was correct AND in Denver then proceeded to drive us to our destination. Nothing was said about additional fees and we thought nothing of it until the charge hit our bank accounts and we had been unknowingly charged an additional $160!!!! I tried working with their Customer service for an equally fair resolution but soon concluded that I was clearly wasting my time and theirs. 

So, thank you Lyft for being an honest and fair company and uber.... well I have nothing nice to say and will leave it at that!!

author: imabigfailure
title: Location required everywhere? No thanks.
content:
Unbelievable. Uber's app now requires you to give all location data at all times, regardless of if you're using the app. Disgrace. I've disabled location until they kill this new privacy-violating 'feature' and started using Lyft instead.

Update: Uber's latest app DOES NOT FUNCTION without full access to location services at all times! I've been extremely happy with Lyft's prices and drivers lately though, and Juno is an even better option if it's available in your area.

author: Theguythatlikeslatinobooty
title: Horrible customer service
content: All I've been wanting to do for the past week has been to start being able to use uber and even sign up as a driver if possible to earn some cash on the side. Not only was I not able to get my uber, but I also haven't been able to even get into my account, because they had leaked my information and I had found out that some person in Russia had been using my account that I had signed up a while back for. Then, when I tried to contact uber saying "this is not me" they kept putting me through circles and not letting me access my account

author: D'artagnan!!
title: Uber, I don't need you if you need my location always
content: Dear Uber, this is a breakup. I've always loved you and stayed loyal for years, but now you made my app unusable without location always tracking. I know that collecting my location 5 minutes after dropoff will help improve your algorithms and app efficiency. But I don't believe that you are only using it only for that (thanks to your ToS) nor do I believe that you are impenetrable to being hacked. I just don't trust you with my data, innocuous though it may be. Give me the option to keep location tracking on while using the app only and I'll come back. Next time, do a better job messaging about how and why you use my data. You are not a necessary as you think. I hope the business impact of this decision will make you change your made.

there should be an option to only allow the application to use your location services while using the program not always or never

title: Can't order uber
content: I disallowed uber's weirdly aggressive and unnecessary location access request and now there is no way at all for me to order an uber. No place to put my pick up location or destination. The app is not functional.

author: panoctopi
title: Shame on Uber
content:
Eliminating the option to only keep location services on while the app is being used is shameful. Forcing users to 
 give Uber acess to location services all the time or never is a regrettable choice. 

I have, of course, turned off location services, and because of this inconvenience I have, in more than one occasion, decided to not use Uber when faced with this new app behavior.

author: Gdkajdlsbxo
title: Horrible experience
content:
I used to take Uber a lot since I have moved to metro area, now i use lyft. The reason? Where do I start? 1. Horrible GPS/navigation. 2. Horrible customer service! It happened to me couple of times- I requested uber for a longer destination and usually there is a lot of traffic. And since there is a fee of cancellation, 2 of my drivers, instead of cancelling my ride, they kept driving around my area instead of picking me up! A driver names Arash of Toyota Camry didn't pick up my calls and made me wait 25 minutes. After that I had no choice but to cancel it myself!

Filled out the email, emailed it back per the email's instructions, and received the EXACT SAME EMAIL BACK. Once again asking for the Name? Fare? Pick up and drop off location? Etc. author: Stustureviewstustu
title: New update: 1 star (long time app lover usually 5 stars)
content:
Long time user and have always loved the app (2-10 rides a week since launch). I'd rate the app 5 stars before the new interface, 3 stars with the new interface, and 1 star with the latest update. The latest update for me has these issues:
- payment: cannot switch between earning points and paying with reward while on trip (have contacted uber support with no resolution. This used to be possible). It is only possible if done in the payment settings before each trip, but the labeling within the trip payment doesn't change
- location services: app requires always on location services. To me this is unnecessary and there should be a while using the app option, especially since pickup locations are never accurate for me anyway (I manually specify)
- pickup: location is not accurate. The old way the app worked was simpler with suggested pickup locations. Now I type in the destination, then have to tap on the map and update the pickup. 
- new interface: personal preference is the new interface is way to busy. The simpler version was way easier to use
- pickup times: often incorrect, will say just a couple minutes then take 10 or 15, especially at airports

author: WsSTj6WmNNiIM
title: 20$ COUPON: asifr4016ui
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “asifr4016ui”to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

Glynn in Kansas City is above and beyond wonderful! The only improvement I could suggest is allowing users to request previous drivers. I'm excited to meet another Uber driver, but if I had the option to use Glynn again I definitely would.

author: howDT
title: Driver perspective
content:
Sorry, folks. No one can input an address or adjust their location for where they're *going to be,* so longtime users who know how to trick the app to get the driver to the best spot aren't able to do so. This is frustrating for me too because the app will take me to the wrong side of the building which is usually a one-way in this town, which adds 3+ minutes to pickup times because I have to drive a significant distance to get back to the right spot. My driver rating has taken a plunge because of the garbage this app has turned into.

The only conversation I've had in rides is how terrible the update is, how frustrating it was for us to find each other, and how Lyft is so much better and easier. Also we're not stupid - you want to use our locations "for up to 5 minutes after a ride" so you can collect the data of where we're going and sell it to the highest bidder. No thanks. Moreover, all attempts to call drivers through the system were unsuccessful (as soon as I click call, the call attempts and then fails). This happened with a third driver as well—fortunately was able to connect through the chat interface of the app—and yet, had it not been for this he would have never reached me. Instead of the estimated 5 minutes for him to arrive it took over 15 since he (like the 2 previous drivers) continued taking inexplicable detours that differed from the projected path I was seeing on my phone. 
Eventually it was only by moving between the map interface on the app and the chat with the driver, and sending him directions as he drove that I was able to get him to follow the very simple route which my phone clearly indicated he was meant to take. Did I mention it was impossible to connect via cell phone with him too! All in all, it was 45 minutes later (than my first attempted ride) before I was able to leave.

author: AlexSP
title: Always ask for a destination to request a ride?
content:
We used to be able to just ask for an uber, no matter where we were headed. Now we always have to type an address or destination before requesting a ride. I know it is a more efficient way to match drivers and riders, and believe me this may work well in the US, but outside it can be a nightmare... and it always makes the process of just getting a ride slow and complicated. For a simple address in Colombia it showed me 5 different options, and the first one was nowhere near where I needed to go (actually a pretty bad neighborhood but fortunately I am familiar with the city!). 
Additionally, the most annoying thing is that you may see 3 or 4 drivers in your area, but the app matches you to someone who is headed to your destination area, so this increases wait times for a ride considerably (a 2 min wait can become a 7 min wait). 
Taxis are very cheap in Colombia but Uber used to offer a better service in terms of getting a ride faster... if wait times become equal then you begin to lose a comparative advantage and riders!!

We reported this to support and they kept sending me standard responses of how a drive is calculated.... no wonder uber is going downhill.

author: User Acceptance Tester
title: Flawed app
content:
Inefficient pick up

Rider's app is allowed to send and driver's app is allowed to receive such a poor quality pick-up data (wrong addresses due to pin dropping, wrong side of the street, wrong pick-ups in alleyways, block ranges instead of street numbers, etc.), that the rider has to confirm the address over the phone for the driver to manually enter it into Waze or Google maps.
Novice drivers drive to pins instead of confirmed addresses, which leads to "one star" experience for riders. 

The riders are still not allowed to submit their photos for easier pick-ups, so they sometimes have to call and tell the driver who to look for.

Substandard ETA estimates by Uber navigation have riders rushing out of the door or waiting outside.

Safety: Riders can't request the trip only from those drivers who submitted their fingerprints for taxicab-style background check.

Safety issues during the trip

There is no appropriate driver's vetting and mandatory security video monitoring  during the ride to assure the rider's safety. 

Inconvenient, inefficient tipping
Lack of in-app option forces riders to use third party apps (Square Cash, Venmo or Paypal) for tipping, which is tedious for both riders and drivers.

Other problems

The riders are forced to share their location with Uber 24/7.

content:
First you mandated users input their destination before doing anything else, claiming this is "faster," which it blatantly is not (versus inputting a destination while your driver is already on their way to pick you up).

The very first thing I want to see when I open the app is how long it will take a driver to arrive, and you put a wall in front of that.

Now you're strong arming users into sharing their location 24/7. That's not cool; you can definitely request it, but we should have the choice to only share location while using the app. I'm sure this helps your algorithms, but you're being selfish. 

It's like you don't even run changes by a focus group before rolling them out. Two great new reasons to use Lyft instead.

author: uznhieoa368
title: $20 coupon: 87DA3
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride!!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the promotions tab on the app and enter the coupon there. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing!!! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button!!! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic!!! I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away.

You made me irritated enough that I am reviewing the Uber app.  Too bad that it's because the app is headed in the wrong direction.  I will NOT use the Uber service at all until you return the option of only sharing my location when I use the app.

author: eduardasalmi
title: From the BEST to WORST!
content: I absolutely loved uber and used to live by it... ever since this new upgrade I have not used it once! I've tried and given up on three different occasions... it is not user friendly at ALL!!! They claim this update was "smarter" and "faster, easier to use" and it's the complete opposite. I've never had to mess with it for so long, and after countless of frustrating attempts in correcting my current location giving up all together, and finally taking the subway because it was the faster/easier alternative! The new app won't let you move your pin as soon as you open the app like it did in the previous version, now you have to share your location and then you can "move" the pin... at this point you're already 5min in.. no one has time for this. And the app previously had THE best uber pool rates... now, I could take a cab and it would be cheaper (and in NYC that is saying a lot!). Not to mention uberpool pick up time can be as long as a 20min wait compared to the usual 4-5min max wait. This is so disappointing to see such a useful app sink into oblivion. I might as well delete it at this point.

It will get a high review again when location services can be set to "When Using App."  There is no need for Uber to always know my location and who can trust them nowadays anyway??? Lyft in a great alternative and I don't have to worry about my privacy.

I would prefer to use Lyft which has a more reasonable privacy policy regarding my location. I hope this concern is addressed in future updates.

author: MGhostSoft
title: Watch out overcharges!!
content:
When you search the airport of your city, check the route carefully because possibly the destination is set to the middle of a runway and the route is several miles longer than it should be. As a result, you're paying $4~$6 extra for the distance you won't travel. I reported to Uber several month ago and never heard back.

And, do they think people are used to the "Always on" location tracking? No reason for me to allow them to track my location 5 minutes after drop off, and no reason to trust them only doing what the claimed to do.

And, people like me still haven't forgotten that Uber requested hundreds of Lyft cars then cancelled them and did so again and again. What a mean company.

Not that I'm still using this app. In fact, I have not used it ever since I found the overcharging trap. Not to mention the location tracking. I'm just keeping this app installed so that I can get back and leave a 1-star review whenever it is updated.

author: Diegito23
title: Advices
content:
Advices for the Uber App:

-Uber needs to create a chat where drivers and customers can text before the pickup, since not all the locations are on the uber search bar, and not everyone has minutes to call.

-Uber needs to let their customers share location. For example, if I'm a 13 year old kid without an uber account on my phone and my mom needs someone to pick me up. I should have the chance to share my location through "SMS" or through "WhatsApp" so can my mom could open it on uber just in case she doesn't know the exact location.

-Uber should not charge almost 2 dollars for cancelling 5 minutes after requesting, that's not right. If I don't like the uber that is picking me up, because for some reason the car is broken, the guy seems annoyed, the guy is a creeper..etc. Guys you should take that out for good.

-Uber isn't supposed to be like  other taxi's. Is meant to have a superior quality, in other words, the driver must have qualities that could enrich Uber's image. Uber should make a long quiz for those who want the job, and ask for their ID in case they are banned. If there are at least 3 customers complaining for a specific driver, that driver should be fired. 3 Strikes, you out.

-Uber should correct a bug that makes the driver seem he/she is 15min away, mean while actually he/she is 5min away.

author: KirillR
title: Awful
content: Don't use this, quality is low, prices are high. Use Lyft app, much better😉

author: Daniel Corbisello
title: Ride notification
content: I am an Uber driver who has been driving since July of 16. I carry a 4.92 rating. However I would like to profusely complain about the ride notification while you are taking another passenger to a location. Here is the problem. When you were having a conversation with a passenger or watching the road in traffic, it is almost impossible to pay attention to the little banner that comes up at the top of the window notifying you that you have another ride. It would be so much easier for the drivers if the same notification came up like it did for the original ride with the big circle blinking that way we would never miss a ride. Yesterday I missed two rides and for the life of me I have no idea when I got them, please change this immediately so we do not miss any rides and our customers get the quickest pick up. I love driving for Uber and the customers are fantastic.

author: SAYKENNY
title: Terrible
content: This app now is terrible it's gotten worse three-time you can't even type your own address it tries to guess where your app drops the pan and the driver has no idea where to go because it's not accurate in anyway and second of all why do they want to continue gathering locational information even after the trip ends this is totally lame why would they do such a thing they say that, to help with the service but I'm sure they have other intentions with this it is not necessary to gather information after the trip ends this app is very difficult and not friendly to use at all, it was much better in the past when you're able to type in a physical address right now there is no way you can type in a physical address so I had to guess where you are and hope to God the driver couldn't find you so it's not any faster at all if the driver has to look around for you to find you because there's no address are the system tries to make up an address this takes longer so widely as you think this takes quicker right it's not quicker it actually takes longer.

author: Gorberg
title: Don't get involved with Uber..
content:
Uber is terrible, they delete the bad reviews once a week.

Check your review in about a week, only you will be able to see your review no one else. I find Uber's business practices to be sneaky and despicable. I'm not going to recommend this app from Uber. The Uber app pulls the resale value out of your car to Pay YOU. Uber needs to compensate and pay the drives real money, so they can fix and maintain there car's. Uber doesn't pay much to the drivers at all (Uber keeps about 60% of what the rider pay UBER). Once you consider your fuel cost, extremely high cost of ride-share car insurance, car maintenance and the terrible wear and tear on the car itself plus significant lose of value of your car at resale, especially because of the super high miles on your vehicle. The Uber app is a very bad deal for the drive. However the riders are getting a great deal on your dime and time. Sorry for the bad new.

author: Meli Rose
title: Love/Hate uber
content: I love using uber when it's an emergency but one time I had forgotten my phone in an uber driver. I called my phone with someone else's cell and he said to call him back within 5 min, I then waited the 5 min and called him back. He wouldn't answer my call, he then turned off my phone. I was trying to get In contact with him by the uber app but I simply couldn't. The night went on and I tracked my phone down and I was able to locate it but he was moving around his city. The day goes on and nothing, the next day he finally calls me from my phone and says he had forgotten about it but I was no longer in Vegas. I was 200 miles away in Los Angeles, and he said he would meet my bf somewhere or drop it off but he kept saying "he's too busy." He did give back my phone after 2 days.

author: lymanc
title: A company with no respect to privacy
content: This is my first 1 star review for a company. The new ALWAYS ON location policy made me a lyft user. A company needs to respect user's privacy. What makes me sad is that they don't even offer an option to opt out.

author: BlackSnowOwl
title: Terrible App!!
content: As a first time user of Uber's app I had a great deal of anticipation as so many people I know use the service. What a let down! This app is terrible!!! Have to give my permission to track my location always to even do a fare check? Track my location for 5 minutes after drop off? NO WAY! What a pile of BS that it is to improve service! And how to do a fare check or anything else? Help button is useless as none of the options it names are even present. And where are the much talked about maps showing cars available and etc? Uber must think it is optimal to dumb down their app to the point of uselessness. Their present and future competitors will thank them! Worst app I have ever experienced by far.

author: SupporterofWomen
title: SupporterOfWomen
content: Deleting this app and will be telling all my friends to do the same.

author: Gorberg
title: Uber, pay the drivers a livable wage.
content: Uber pays the divers less than half of what they charge us.

author: Art_70
title: Too slick to be useful
content:
I hate apps that are so overly slick/simplistic and "dumbed down" that they actually become ineffective and hard to use.

In particular, there is no way to provide any info/special instructions to the driver. I scheduled a ride for my mother-in-law in advance, but there was no way to provide her phone number (she doesn't know how to use a smart phone). Thus, the driver was unable to contact her and was kept waiting needlessly (as was she--they couldn't connect). And at 6:15 AM I was asleep. This is not tax analysis, Uber. I'm a s/w developer. This ought to be simple to add. But it means adding some functionality that may be too much for your slickness obsession.

If you schedule in advance, you can't choose the kind of ride you want either (I chose economy, but couldn't decline a shared ride)

This is the second time I've scheduled a ride for someone else. The other time I had no way of telling driver the rider was on north side (it was a large campus).

I tried contacting Uber support, but the folks reading emails are moderately brain dead and seem to be unable to comprehend the complaint/feature request.

author: foobar1
title: Tracks location in background
content: Sticking to lyft. And uber also raised their prices

author: pdfang29
title: User friendly & many useful product features
content: Friendly, instinctive UI, plenty of useful product features

author: Grandpa Banana
title: Yuck.
content: I am deleting your app. Your right wing politics are disgusting.  I hope you rot in jail with the test of your billionaire cronies.  Go to hell.

author: KenErdmann
title: Uber is lifesaver for me, but could be better.
content:
I am a disabled 50 something male and I've had numerous surgeries causing me to take narcotic painkillers. Being cautious, on days when I had to drive to doctor's appointments I would not take my painkillers, which would leave me in horrible pain when I got home. Having Uber available to get me safely to my many doctors' appointments has been a lifesaver for me.

The Good about the app: I find it easy and intuitive to order my rides as I need them. 

The Improvements Needed: 1) The "schedule a ride" feature is not easy to figure out how to do. 
2) Must have TIPPING capability on the app, PLEASE!! Most people don't carry cash anymore.  3) Recently I've had issues with my driver finding where to pick me up and some have asked me to provide them directions to my destination because they said the Uber mapping they use is not reliable. This just seems insane to me that the Uber drivers do not have the BEST mapping service considering the importance this has on their, and Uber's, business.

author: LizV.
title: Car color
content: Hello I think that the service is awesome I had use in my country and USA as well. But I want to suggest that you put the color of the car in the description. It would be easier to identify the car that is coming to pick up us specially in a crowd area.

author: Luke1322
title: Payment bugs
content: Despite what many of the negative review were's say here, I actually really love Uber's service. However there are two problems I have experienced with the app recently which make it incredibly frustrating to use. One is that it always chooses Apple Pay as my default method of payment even though I never want to use Apple Pay. The second is that every time I tried to split a ride with someone else I get an error stating that Apple Pay cannot be used to share a ride, and gives me no option to choose an alternative payment method. Normally I would not use a review to resolve this kind of issue, but Uber's help desk has been so unhelpful I feel I have no other recourse. Please fix these issues ASAP.

author: Gorberg
title: Learn from my mistake, Don't get involved with uber...
content:
Do not get involved with this company. I find Uber's business practices to be sneaky and despicable. I'm not going to recommend this app from Uber. The Uber app pulls the resale value out of your car to Pay YOU. Uber needs to compensate and pay the drives real money, so they can fix and maintain there car's. Uber doesn't pay much to the drivers at all (Uber keeps about 60% of what the rider pay UBER). Once you consider your fuel cost, extremely high cost of ride-share car insurance, car maintenance and the terrible wear and tear on the car itself plus significant lose of value of your car at resale, especially because of the super high miles on your vehicle. The Uber app is a very bad deal for the drive. However the riders are getting a great deal on your dime and time.  Sorry for the bad new.

Here's a timeline of Uber's troubles so far this year.

- Jan. 28: After President Donald Trump releases his first executive order on immigration, New York taxi drivers protest by refusing to pick up passengers at Kennedy Airport for an hour. Some protesters say Uber tries to capitalize on the protest by picking up passengers anyway, prompting a Twitter protest urging people to delete Uber's app from their smartphones.

- Feb. 2: Uber CEO Travis Kalanick quits President Trump's council of business leaders amid mounting pressure from employees and customers over the immigration order.

- Feb. 19: A former Uber engineer, Susan Fowler, discloses sexual harassment and sexism claims in a blog post about her year at Uber. Fowler says her boss propositioned her and higher-ups ignored her complaints. Kalanick calls Fowler's accusations "abhorrent" and hires former U.S. Attorney General Eric Holder to investigate.

- Feb. 23: Waymo, a self-driving car company spun off from Google, sues Uber. Waymo alleges that Anthony Levandowski - a former top manager for Google's self-driving car project - stole pivotal technology from Google before leaving to run Uber's self-driving car division.

- Feb. 28: A video emerges of Kalanick arguing with an Uber driver. It includes yelling and profanity and ends with a combative Kalanick dismissing the agitated driver's claims that sharp reductions in fares forced him into bankruptcy. In an email to employees, Kalanick admits he needs leadership help. "I must fundamentally change as a leader and grow up," he says.

- March 3: The New York Times reveals that Uber used a phony version of its app to thwart authorities in cities where it was operating illegally. Uber's so-called Greyball software identified regulators who were posing as riders and blocked access to them. The U.S. Justice Department is investigating Uber's use of the Greyball software.

- March 19: Uber's president, Jeff Jones, resigns less than a year after joining the company. He tells the tech blog Recode that his approach to leadership is at odds with what he experienced at Uber.

- April 18: Sherif Marakby, a global vice president who leads Uber's self-driving car program, leaves the company.

- April 27: Levandowski announces he is stepping aside while Uber defends itself against the allegations from Waymo.

- May 11: A federal judge in San Francisco rejects Uber's request for arbitration and refers Waymo's case to the U.S. Attorney's office for a possible criminal investigation. Days later the judge bans Uber from using technology taken from Waymo, but doesn't order Uber to halt its self-driving vehicle program, as Waymo requested. The case is set for trial in October.

- May 26: Kalanick's mother dies in a boating accident. His father is seriously injured.

- May 30: Uber fires Levandowski.

- May 31: Uber's finance chief Gautam Gupta says he plans to leave the company in July.

- June 6: Uber fires 20 people after a law firm, Perkins Coie, investigates complaints of harassment, bullying and retaliation. That investigation, which was separate from Holder's, checked into 215 complaints; 57 are still under investigation.

- June 11: Uber's board meets with Holder and adopts a series of recommendations based on his report.

- June 12: Emil Michael, Uber's senior vice president for business and a close ally of Kalanick, leaves the company.

- June 13: Kalanick tells Uber employees that he's taking a leave for an unspecified period, but will be available for "the most strategic decisions." Uber's board releases Holder's recommendations, which include removing some of Kalanick's responsibilities and replacing Uber's chairman and founder, Garrett Camp, with an independent chairman. Holder also recommends many cultural and policy changes, from establishing an effective complaint process to recruiting more diverse applicants to prohibiting alcohol and drug use during core work hours.

author: ckoubs
title: Upgrades degrade service
content: Really miss some of the features lost with recent upgrades. In particular, the ability to add multiple stops in advance. The ability to pinpoint your location or just enter an address is also very challenging and unintuitive. The feature for splitting fares is not as obvious as it used to be. Very strongly dislike the new privacy options, since it means constant toggling on/off if you don't want Uber to be allowed to track your location all the time. Recent upgrades have decreased features rather than improved them.

author: Thiggens
title: Customer Service???
content:
I scheduled a ride to the airport ten days before I needed the ride. Ten minutes before the driver was due to pick me up I got a notice saying that there would be a surge charge of 2.2 times the normal fare.
I did not have enough time to get another ride before my flight.
After my ride I wrote to Uber, tried calling them, and sending an email--but no response at all. I can understand a surge rate, but not 2.2 times the regular rate. I'm switching to the competition to see if they have better customer support and service.

author: Sspicy 1301756461
title: Uber works better for me than lyft
content: Uber works great for me, probably is because I live in West LA and I can always get a ride within 5-10 minutes. Drivers are nice and the prices are affordable for pool. I think you should add the option to tip the drivers because I don't always have cash.

author: alkalinewish
title: Constant location track & bad surges
content:
While I love the concepts that Uber was founded on to combat the sketchy and crooked taxi industry, Uber has become a monster of its own.

Not only are the surge rates often falsely applied and absurdity high, but their app has become increasingly untrustworthy over the years, as they refuse to allow users to control location tracking privacy settings.

Uber is constantly collecting/utilizing users location and mobile device data. Whether it's for their own marketing or other use, it is wrong to not allow and users the ability to limit access.  The Uber app should have a privacy/location settings option to only allow location/data usage while the app is open.

author: Open eyes
title: Add option for tipping!
content: Please add an option for in app tipping!!

author: thaqueenliz
title: Use Lyft Instead!
content:
Great when you're late for work because suddenly uber doesn't want to accept the payment you've been using for a month now :)

Actually re downloaded this to get a ride to pick up my new car and it wouldn't accept ANY payment method, credit card, debit card, prepaid card, or paypal, and i have money! Not to mention the CEO is trash and doesn't care about his drivers, and lets never forget the NYC fiasco. Done with this app.

author: ttrq01
title: Uber, plz resolve your internal HR issues!
content:
If not, I like many will be moving on to another ride sharing App.

It's disgusting to read about how women employees are being treated in your company. And your CEO still has not acknowledged that he has a big problem within the company's culture.

author: John Rickman
title: Review
content: Please give us proper update details.

author: uftbelcp368
title: $20 coupon: 99qtk
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: Lanemus
title: Really bad update.
content:
So first the obvious: why do you need to know my location at all times? This is a complete invasion of privacy and I can't think of a reason why it's necessary. 
Second: the app doesn't work as well as it used to. My waiting time for a pickup used to be 2-5 minutes and now it's 10-15. This is without the connection problems and cancelled trips. 
Uber is taking a turn for the worst and the reviews are showing it.

author: ChrisCrowley
title: Location
content: Please bring back the choice to only use my location when using the app. It's not just the privacy issue, it also affects my device's battery life.

author: RedWhiteAndBoo
title: Uber Support
content:
Be mindful when requesting a ride that Uber has a system in place that encourages drivers to cancel a ride while they are en route to pick you up if the demand (surge price) has increased since you requested. 

This will effectively double the time you have to wait to be picked up along with the price you will pay for a ride. 

Uber support is no help in these matters.

author: Osmosisx
title: Suggestions
content:
1.  Get your mapping and routing estimates straightened out.  The map is terribly buggy - on the passenger app it shows me at the right location.  On the driver app it shows me two blocks away.  This sends the driver down the wrong block which costs us both 10 mins in NYC.  Similarly, the app shows me the wrong driver route repeatedly.

2.  Allow me to use two phone numbers on same account.  I have a work phone and a personal phone. Both are me. Ridiculous I can't call from one of the apps.  Especially when the other phone has a dead battery.

author: Amy Bright
title: Frequent user
content: Ever since the latest update of your app, it changes the addresses you put in. It makes it inconvenient for drivers, and riders. Please fix it!

author: No_name_given
title: No way
content: Switched to Lyft. Uber uses your location always (lyft: only when using). Uber is the company busted for fingerprinting phones, blogging about hook up trips and geofencing to target individuals.

author: a student and reviewer
title: Why are coupons with 5 stars being posted as reviews.
content: Bad privacy policy. No longer using uber as lyft is better.

author: Encoun2er
title: From my hero to zero
content:
You have no idea how much the regular fair is anymore in relation to the "upfront pricing" they have hidden for what they used to call "surge". 
Years later and still no tip for drivers leaving me to fiddle for cash. 
Quality of drivers and vehicles have gone way down! 

Uber as whole product has become trash! Customer service is a joke and ya'll know it. 
Bye Uber, it's been real.

author: Ian_Wayne
title: Was great now is just intolerable
content: uber was a great choice when i need to go anywhere without needing to trouble driving/parking. But recently i got suspended without any reason nor explanation along with my 4.8 passenger rate disappeared. What's more irritating is that uber has been manditarily constantly monitoring us through GPS and it is among the few apps that required continuous GPS input. I wonder what they use this big data for?! Guess what? Lyft is still a viable option! And uber being unable to develop it's unmmaned car tech while Lyft has just announced coop. with Waymo. Switching to Lyft now seems more promising:)

author: PanaikranUS
title: Remove the "Always" option
content:
I knew it what was the cause of battery life draining. It was Uber is the cause of battery life to go down why you had to remove that option and bring back the While using app instead. 3 stars gone because of this ting , the other government ting and do shame thing to women uber staff That is Terrible man terrible...

Two star given because of better than taxi in Thailand but I heard government gonna take down Uber in Thailand soon or not because it is illegal in Thailand

author: Annoymous1212
title: Uber
content: Overall it's a good app which has its flaws , like the price shouldn't change due to an increase in fares where prices are like sky rocketing high it's not fair to college students on a budget also it should allow you to request more then just one uber at a time an limit the number of passengers per uber pool due to timing an last but not least the pin drop location needs to be more accurate to avoid confusion an drivers not being at an exact location .

author: 3wisemonkeyz
title: 270mb for a ridesharing app?!
content: Wow, you guys really take us and the space on our phones for a ride!

author: Justthatkid
title: Do Not Use This App!
content: This company treats their drives like slaves and the way they handle their mishaps is unacceptable. Super irresponsible and needs to address their problems in a mature way. This company seems like its run by a 15 year old rich white boy that only wants money and does not care how he gets it.

author: Tnksn
title: Someone is going to get hurt with this.
content:
Mediocre app.
Cheap, but the party won't last when the subsidies end. 
Unethical company, with a combative culture and a worse CEO that is putting the public in harm's way. Not worth supporting them.

author: chipswithdip
title: Questionable business practices
content:
Deleted the app after the last update and being asked to open up a lot of my private data that has absolutely no relevance to ride share...which is the entire idea of the app. 
Uber has been making shady moves and will urge friends to avoid the app. My experience with Lyft has been much more enjoyable.

author: Eighttwelve44
title: Tracking always on
content: Uber now unnecessarily demands location tracking be on at all times. Back to Lyft for me

author: Andy Martini
title: App is great...Help options are lousy
content:
I love the app and will change my rating to 5 stars when uber adds an email help option. 
 
My problem is every time I have an issue the app and website tell you where on the app to solve it BUT if the app is the problem you're out of luck!

Case in point...I keep having issues where the app won't let me give a rating to my driver. The app shows me where to do this...but it's not working and uber has NO way for me to let them know...except here...so hopefully they will read the rating and FIX THE ISSUE!
And please add a contact us through SOME OTHER method that isn't Twitter. I don't have the app and won't be getting it. 
Just having Twitter as the option to notify them about problems with the app is unacceptable and indicates they don't know their different user segments.

author: Privacy_Means_Something
title: Do not upgrade - Uber, change your privacy settings!
content:
Don't upgrade your app.  Uber now forces you to give them access to your location at all times, even when not using the app, to even get a ride or access your account. This is an unacceptable breach of privacy, and I've now deleted Uber and will switch to Lyft until this policy is changed. 

Don't track me, Uber. I don't trust you with my location unless I'm using the app. This was a horrible change.

author: Sephizzle
title: Horrible
content: Please never use uber. The drivers are creepy, the customer service is ridiculously poor. They get mad at everyone for riding drunk like hello if you're driving at 2 AM what did you think was going to happen? I have friends that are banned for riding drunk that didn't puke in the car or act rude they were just drunk. Uber loses a lot of business for banning everyone and that combined with the drivers and customer service will definitely be losing them some business. I'm never using uber again.

author: hairdresserinSM
title: Customer service is awful
content:
I know uber is pretty big now and their customer service turned into pretty poor.
They hire unprofessional drivers and don't care what happen to passengers.
I had a horrible experience with uber last week, the driver took wrong freeway and ended up wasting 40 more minutes than original estimate time, moreover, the driver kept telling me the excuse that he is new to this city and not used to driving around here...
When I claimed this issue to uber, they just emailed me back and force with same template messages and I gave it up because I felt like dealing with only the computer...
Now I use Lyft. Their customer service is still way better.

author: please-enter-a-nickname
title: Deleted it
content: I deleted this app due to excessive and mandatory location tracking of riders.

author: Disappointed Ralph
title: Worked great before this "fancy update"
content: Used app sparingly before big update - worked great. Location only when using , quickly found rides and worked as advertised. Then Began using almost daily month or two ago. Now with newest "upgrade" the app is slow , needs my location 24/7 , ride prices have gone up and sometimes it won't work at all. Don't aim to make the app all shiny and pretty - keep it simple and uncluttered and stop needing gps 24/7

author: Shoelivecrew
title: Nosey App!!!
content: Just uninstalled.  Wants to track your location even when you are not using the app!!!  Who are you selling this info to?!?!?  Switching to Lyft.

author: Findbugs420
title: Old Design
content: Bring back the old design and old icon.

author: I like ducks.
title: Needs help
content: App should display the color of the car, not just make/model and license plate.

author: Dylansunshine
title: Great for a good while, but updates have problems
content:
Uber was truly great for a long while, but recently (after May 2017) some problems began to occur in updates. For roughly two weeks the app cannot get any Uber driver even if there is a driver around. I tested on a one car and nothing pops up on the driver's app screen, while my wife's phone, who hasn't updated Uber yet, worked great.

I'm not sure if the Uber management is constantly pushing their software engineers to make new updates every now and then, but as the saying goes, if it ain't. Role, don't fix it.

author: Jwhevt
title: Completely invades your privacy
content: This new update allows uber to constantly track its customers 24/7 not only five minutes after as it says this completely invades your privacy and can be a very dangerous thing. Uber is just spiraling down from not bad to unusable this is completely ridiculous and should not be allowed whatsoever

author: Whyamihere
title: Adios
content:
You took away the option of sharing location only while using the app. Guess what's easier than having to go into my settings every time to re-enable location and disable location?? ...using Lyft from now on. Put location sharing back to the user's choice.
ADDITIONALLY, I consider this company to be a bunch of scumbags for releasing a new update every few days to wipe out the negative reviews. There are no real updates to the app. If there were it would be from listening to the rage of their users and giving back the option of location while only using the app. And I'll continue to give 1 star until they do.

Update: Uber recently sent an email "noticing" that I disabled location for the App. Well no crap, that's what happens when you don't care about user privacy. I'm sure they had to send out a lot of those emails to others. My location will remain disabled until they bring back the option for only when using the app, and my business continues to go to Lyft.

author: Tamia P
title: Seriously?
content: I use Uber because it's convenient. It's used to be because it's prices were better than lyfts and I didn't have to worry about a ridiculous authorization hold. Uber has gotten ridiculous over the last couple of months; they don't let you know when surge pricing begins or ends, some prices are more expensive than normal, and the directions are terrible. I'm not sure what's happening as this app gets more popular, but it's not making it any better.

author: 9A75K9 ❗️❗️❗️
title: Give me back my money!!!
content: I used Uber to get to school everyday, and it's usually 8-9$. Today, they charged me 15$, but they driver called me and said they can't get there, so I have to cancel and call another one. After I cancel, it charged me twice as much. I paid 33$ for a short ride today. Another issue is in my bank, it shows that Uber charged both the ride and the one that I canceled. Please fix it and give me back my money!!!!

author: LAfilmExaminer
title: Gps and rating
content:
As for riders The GPS do not update our locations and if I call for a car in the middle of the mall by time I'm by the valet for pick up the car is on the other side. Often even at home it send them to wrong directions.
As for drivers all of them complain that since we can't tip the drivers we should at least be imposed to rate them, it was mandatory before the new app make it slipped an skip so they said they only get rate 10% of the time meanwhile uber impose them to have a high rating. It's not fair for drivers even though uber have reputations to only care about itself.

author: Juliand05
title: Seguridad y legalidad.
content: La aplicación se ha dedicado solo a ganar dinero pero no sé ha preocupado por legalizar el servicio y peor aún a puesto en peligro a sus afiliados, ya que con el pago en efectivo sea a perdido seguridad en los que se registran, tiene que trabajar más en el bien común, no sólo en el propio!

author: iPhanBoy
title: Stop your shady business practices
content: You're a multi billion dollar company. Act like a bunch of grown ups and stop your shady business practices.

author: Kirbyx2000
title: Bad company
content: Can not tip in app for good service

author: Greg_Rz
title: Uber wants to ALWAYS track my location
content: One star for forcing users to allow Uber always access your location. Even when not using the app. Given the number of abuse with data handling by Uber employees I'm not comfortable allowing them always know where I am...

author: Emilemac
title: Terrible app despicable company
content: Save yourself the anguish and don't download this app. It's like opening Pandora's box. Avoid like a plague.

author: Maymaymay:)
title: Lyft is better
content:
Cheap for a reason. Cheap service. Cheap people. I feel sorry for the drivers who have to work for Uber because they deserve better.

Get Lyft.

author: Physics Undergrad
title: Privacy Problems
content: This app wants to know my local location even when I'm not using the app. This is an unwarranted invasion of my privacy.

author: DrewBenTaylor
title: Always On Location Tracking
content: I have used this service since it launched in DC (5+ years) and generally like it alot/use it often. However the newest update removed the option to only allow the app to track your location when the app is in use... Leaving the only options as always or never. The never option is useless for obvious reasons. I'd rather use Lyft than let Uber track my location at all times.

author: Cpel83
title: App works great, customer service is bad
content: I have used Uber several times for transportation. The last time I used it, I didn't trust the driver and when I reached out to customer service I received a half-hearted response. They showed little regard for wanting to ensure that their customers have great experiences. Getting in a car with complete strangers requires trust in a company and their ability to provide a certain level of confidence. The customer service that I experienced took away both of those. The app works great but the people behind it don't.

author: pgk2008
title: Invasive GPS tracking policy even after many user complaints
content:
Location tracking is all or nothing with Uber. Normal apps offer "track only when using", but Uber demands "Always track". If the past year has taught us anything, it's "don't trust Uber to do the right thing". 

It looks like they're not in a hurry to listen to customers' complaints, since we're at least ten updates in since I started paying attention to the GPS issue. It also seems like they abuse the app update system. Weekly 170MB updates with no change log. That's half a gig per month, thanks guys..

Partial workaround for tracking: disable GPS for the Uber app, and only turn it back on if you absolutely need to use the app. And then turn it back off when you get to the destination. 

In the meantime I've been using the friendly Uber competitor, and so far it's worked like a charm. Thanks Uber, for encouraging me to check out other apps!

author: NUMBAH182
title: They are Criminals!
content: This company is horrendous. They will steal your money and try to give you Uber credits to keep using their company and make more money. Woke up one morning to take a test for my class. I realized that the trains were closed so I called an Uber. Halfway there, the driver tells me she needs to stop and get coffee because she is "tired". I disagree because that would make make me late for my test. She ignores me and stops at a 7-Eleven.I become upset and tell this unacceptable. She tells she won't take me any further. I report her to Uber. They began sending me message telling me  they will take note of this matter. I ask if I can get a refund which they then refuse telling me they discussed this matter with a team and not give me a refund. But they will give me Uber credits. When I tried to ask them, why they won't give me a refund they ignored me. Do not use this app. I REPEAT, DO NOT USE THIS APP!

author: Jay2DaJay
title: Waiting Time
content: I will never ride another Uber as long as I live. First off, I waited almost 30 minutes for the FIRST Uber to "arrive". As it said in the GPS, they have "arrived". I called the guy literally 6 times to find out his location and they never answered. So I decided to cancel that trip and of course I got charged $2 to cancel. I then ordered another Uber in hopes of getting picked up quickly, of course that was a mistake. It said the Uber driver was "4" minutes away.. I spent 15 minutes waiting for them. I decided to just cancel and then I was charged the $5 cancellation fee.. waiting almost 45 minutes for an Uber driver is insane. Never again, I just deleted the app and I'm glad. Suffice to say I WILL be disputing those charges on my account. Useless company.

author: M.005
title: Unreliable
content: Have used uber in the past without issue. Within the last couple months I haven't even been able to get a ride.  First time with the updates it wouldn't accept my location but suggested a pickup halfway down a busy street at some random spot at night and wouldn't let me change it.  Today the first driver I accepted never started moving so after a few minutes I cancelled and put in another request.  Driver made it to the entrance of the parking lot twice but never entered, then canceled and drove away.  There's no way to contact anyone for support or feedback.  I also noticed you have to allow location access all the time for the app. Deleting app.

author: Neym
title: Ficou caro e menos transparente
content:
As tarifas dinâmicas fazem o uso do UBER MUITO MENOS vantajoso do que um taxi comum 😞

As novas atualizações camuflam os preços dinâmicos, deixando o app menos transparente.

Uma viagem no pico da manhã para meu trabalho, costumava dar 32 a 35 reais, hoje da 44.

Um taxi com 30% da easy ou 99 ainda custa de 30 a 35.

Viva a concorrência!

author: Juan Guapo
title: 💩Dubious location services changes.
content:
The latest update is the last straw: I've now deleted it from my iPhone and will use only their competitors instead. I tried to keep UberX a back up, but I don't like them having location services set to "Always," as opposed to only when I'm using the app. 

So long, Uber.

--Earlier Review--
The first time I tried Uber, the driver accepted our fare, then dropped the fare without warning. I finally had to check the app after a few minutes and noticed the dropped fare, and had to set up a new request for another driver to come along. The second driver was just fine but the fact that the first driver just arbitrarily dropped our fare without warning did not give me a positive feeling about the service. Waiting is one thing but waiting for nobody is another.

The app itself isn't very intuitive, doesn't include any descriptions of the various driving requests (i.e., UberX vs. UberXL, etc.). Competitor products are a bit more simple to use, not nearly as confusing when choosing a ride. I think Uber tries to shove as much as possible into as few a screens as possible, and it makes the app confusing and cluttered. Here in Los Angeles, Uber's pickup times are just not that competitive but are at times a little cheaper than its competitor.

As an anecdote, I've used their competitor product (rhymes with Sift) in more than a few places across the US, including Los Angeles, Dallas, Denver, and Ft. Lauderdale; each time has been an A+ experience with no hassle. The Uber experience above happened a few weeks ago but I've kept the app along side the "sift" app just in case I can get a faster pickup time but after a few weeks, that hasn't been the case so I'm finally deleting it.

author: osj2
title: Crooks
content: Bad company. Terrible reputation. Proven to track customers. Bye

author: PaulyBny
title: I'm Done
content: Uber over the past month have been making the same mistakes. The tracker shows the drivers are in the wrong location, then they charge us because we missed the ride. The drivers never hesitate to cancel a Uber ride. Drivers have been taking the longest route which I think have resulted in an increase in prices. Uber Pool tries to pack as many people in their car as possible from time to time. With Uber Pool I've been picked up with someone in a car, I watched them get dropped off, seen someone else get picked up and dropped off before I was even at my destination. Too many wrong with Uber in the past month alone. I'm finished with Uber and I see Lyft has better reviews. I believe I won't waste any money with them.

author: alexandra20170713
title: Like the service --app is terrible
content:
Login process is buggy--repeats same prompt in loop multiple times. Turned screen dark -- not black just very dark -- and froze my whole phone from first call for ride to start of trip.

Uber engineers can surely do better.

Agree with some others that requiring location services to be on always seems outrageous.

author: Yomomma174829
title: Worst App Ever
content: Don't normally write reviews but I feel I must to save people from having their money stolen. A problem that is consistent and happening to a lot of people I know. Being charged twice, three times, and then having to wait weeks for money back after taking out almost $40 out of my account. Insanity, theft, don't use Uber.

author: S Morgen
title: Worst customer service
content: When I reported that someone took my ride, the customer service told me they saw the map the driver complete the trip so they couldn't do anything about it. That's mean someone took my trip and I paid it. This thing happened twice, now won't give them a try. Attitude that they have are absolutely terrible.

author: as03...
title: Disgusting company
content: I am so horrified by the things this company has done. I will not be driving with a company that promotes a culture of sexual violence and racism.

author: BrantK
title: Terrible update
content:
Uber needs your location all the time now??? That's a serious battery killer. Why? It's so easy to fire up Xcode and change what location permissions users have. Stop being lazy. Seriously I could do it for you.

When I type in my address manually it won't load. Good job at losing customers. Everyone use Lyft from now on. It doesn't need to track you 24/7 and it's prices are better!

author: Javieregarciaa
title: Very confusing for most.
content:
This is my first time writing a review for any app. I drive for uber. I'm very disappointed with this new update. Not only am I disappointed but a majority of passengers I take have problems either dragging the pin to set a pick up location, finding the right car option, locating the future ride option and some even had problems finding the request button . I drive a black car. Finding the option to choose a black car can be confusing.
I can understand how this new app is better for the people who like to explore and play around with it , (it is improved but it is a bit confusing ).most of the passengers I take don't care much for complicated but rather like the simplicity use of the app to order a car and get home . I feel that people who have trouble using this app move onto other apps like Lyft or end up using yellow cabs .

author: Shaggy4029
title: Address from contact
content: I used to be able to use my contact addresses whenever I call a Uber but now I can't, that's seems like you guys are going backwards. I'm using an iPhone 7 on iOS 10.3.2

author: Jingwc
title: ABSOLUTELY USELESS
content: This app doesn't not work at all. I wanted to change my mobile number and it kept says fail to update account info. And when selecting payment, there's always error.... Couldn't login to PayPal or Alipay. And a says there's error with my credit card. It used to work so well now it's extremely frustrating....

author: 1yellowtang
title: Driver No show- I was charged
content: I wish I could rate Uber zero stars. My first experience with Uber was so bad I won't be back soon. I waited and waited at Heathrow for uber drivers to pick me up. I could see some of them just sitting still after they had accepted me as a rider. I was cancelled three times and the third driver who failed to show flagged me as a now show. I was standing precisely at the meeting point and watched as other Uber passengers met their rides. Uber says they credited my Uber account for the cancel and it will apply to my next ride. It should have gone back on my credit card. The fourth driver turned up to get me. I dunno, it seemed like maybe the Heathrow area drivers were running a scam of some sort. Thanks Uber for wasting my time and increasing my stress after a redeye. Uber is not worth the hassle.

author: Sirappsalot22
title: Stop being able to track my location when not using app.
content: One star until this feature is removed. Privacy is my biggest concern.

author: Angry Uber Customer
title: GPS abysmal; Poor Feedback options
content:
Since whoever designed this app decided not to include any option for feedback on problems with the software, rather than just blaming the driver for taking a poor route, I am leaving this one star review in public, in the App Store.

The GPS is terrible. The ability to predict how long it will be till you get picked up is terrible. The estimates are highly unrealistic. And it changes the route and estimated time drastically in the space of minutes.

Uber's in-app GPS in Boston is abysmal. For the third time, it has taken a simple, 1/2 mile trip and turned it into a 30 minute odyssey involving highways in rush hour traffic, unnecessary detours across city lines, and no way to alert the company of their screw-up without somehow blaming the driver.  According to the driver, his pay will get dinged if he deviates from their insane directions, so he generally just follows them. Since I don't want him to go unpaid for 30 minutes of work, I am stuck with the bill and a seriously negative impression of Uber as a tech company and as an employer.

Fix this, Uber.

author: RamEric
title: Location Settings Ruined
content:
And now they send out emails asking us to switch on location services. Get your act together Uber and add a "while using the app" option.

---------/

The app now requires you to have "never" or "always" set for it to access your location. I don't allow any app to have always permissions so it is now set to never. But with never set the app went from letting me enter in an address to basically opening up blank.

author: Ordnung
title: Filth
content:
A couple of months back, UBER driver was directed by his app to bring me to a cemetery. Fine, whatever, I was assuming these things happen. I wrote to UBER about this without any kind of response. Fine again, folks are busy.

Now I can't use any kind of payments, whatsoever, to get a ride from Uber? Cool, you lost me as a customer.

I hope you (the app) stop existing as a whole. Your engineers/managers have a history of being misogynistic and incompetent. Screw you guys

author: Skellt
title: Always tracks location
content: This app demands to track your location even when the app isn't running. That's just unacceptable on iOS where the system supports the option to only track location while the app is running. Use Lyft instead.

title: No way
content: Switched to Lyft. Uber uses your location always (lyft: only when using). Uber is the company busted for fingerprinting phones, blogging about hook up trips and geofencing to target individuals.

author: MGhostSoft
title: Watch out overcharges!!
content:
When you search the airport of your city, check the route carefully because possibly the destination is set to the middle of a runway and the route is several miles longer than it should be. As a result, you're paying $4~$6 extra for the distance you won't travel. I reported to Uber several month ago and never heard back.

And, do they think people are used to the "Always on" location tracking? No reason for me to allow them to track my location 5 minutes after drop off, and no reason to trust them only doing what the claimed to do.

And, people like me still haven't forgotten that Uber requested hundreds of Lyft cars then cancelled them and did so again and again. What a mean company.

Not that I'm still using this app. In fact, I have not used it ever since I found the overcharging trap. Not to mention the location tracking. I'm just keeping this app installed so that I can get back and leave a 1-star review whenever it is updated.

author: Business guy25
title: Spies & lies
content: Always on location access for a company that lies cheats it's way out of regulators and lies to investors.

author: (Ghosthunter)
title: Scan card for payment issue
content: Uber has missed out on numerous trips by us with the inability for the scan card part of the payment we are unable to get to work. Very frustrating. Uber has always been my first choice and now I'm having to resort back to regular taxi service.

author: Aaaaaaa000000
title: Forces drivers and customers to go to "pool" pickup points for non-pool rides. Zero star!
content:
I used to be able to drop the pick-up pin where I was actually standing. Made sense, right? Not anymore. Uber now just moves the pin to the nearest "pool" location even if you didn't order "pool" and it makes no sense for the driver and the customer. It is impossible to drop the pin where you are. Why??? 

We were watching our car pass us by, having to loop around several blocks to go to a "pool" pick-up point half a block up a one-way street. Six extra minutes for the driver and for two of us = 18 minutes wasted just to promote "pool"??? Seriously??? 

And no, it's not a glitch. It's been like this for months now. If it were a glitch, it would have been corrected by now. I must assume it's intentional. 

BAD UBER!

author: DavidReviewer756
title: NO to always on location services!
content: Uber stop updating the app with no changes to flush all the negative reviews. You removed the option to allow us to grant you location services for in-app only. I will NOT give you my location all the time. You don't need it! This is a massive privacy violation. Give us our options back!

author: Goombah818
title: From kind of hero to big ZERO
content:
Long story short
Been a frequent user of Uber...
Rates been a little cheaper than Lyft. 
gUber offered me the ride pass for $10 one time and flat fares of $3.99. To good to be true?...It always is!
Used it twice, day after activation my account was disabled and could not access anything. IT DOESN'T TAKE A MONKEY TO SEE CORPORATE GREED TAKE OVER....IMMEDIATELY!

Contacted gUBER support.4 emails later I get 4 different people from 4 different ethnicities barely comprehending my complaint. All by email. What happened to using the phone, as if digital ink doesn't cost money too!

Said screw it going back to Lyft. I had contacted Lyft customer support regarding any upcoming features such as gUbers "Ride Pass" and they declined any immediate promotion but replied in a quick and professional manner. Ill pay the extra couple bucks with Lyft then get robbed by gUber anymore. I would rather swim down Las Vegas Boulevard on a Friday night than to ever use gUber again!

I'm definitely not using this app until they stop stealing my information and properly address this problem!

author: Tony_AZ

Poor service that has gotten ruder and ruder.

Poor ethics.

Not a consumer friendly company.

Why do you need my location when not using the app???

PRIVACY CONCERN!!  And app quality getting worse not better.  Go with the other guys.

author: MegPool
title: Unimpressive Company
content: I do not appreciate needing my location being tracked in order to open the app. Also, I had a app. malfunction and was charged for cancelling a ride. I tried for hours to clarify my issue with 'customer service' until they eventually sent a message saying the conversation was over and discontinued responding to my concerns, ultimately, from my point of view, robbing me of five dollars. The amount of money is irrelevant, it is the audacity to be so absolutely rude and dismissive that is the most appalling. This company has seemingly no respect for their customers, they don't, as far as I know, have an easily accessible customer service number to call regardless of how of a popular of a company it is, and I have no intention of using their services in the future. It may be convenient but convenience is ultimately just another way how souls are lost. Don't bother with the app or the company.

The driver said he was new and didn't really understand how it worked. I think he scammed me. I am removing the app from my phone.

author: *DUDE*

author: jcatan
title: Time for me to move on
content: I love the Uber service. It has served me well many times. I guess I should say the drivers have served me well. But, driver pay is low, I can't tip in the app (that is just insensitive), and the drivers are constantly berated by childish, incompetent management. The company lies to drivers, lies to muninciple governnents, flaunts local laws that Uber believes inhibits it's move forward and then tearfully apologizes as if tears of remorse after a tantrum will deceive their customers. author: Lance J.
title: Flaws ruin Uber, lots of better providers.
content:
I used Uber quite a lot over the past several years...  but now they've run totally off the rails. Their privacy posture is truly nutsoid, limiting my choices of how they use GPS. Full time GPS drains batteries too. Uber doesn't seem to care.

But I am happy to report one AWESOME  thing about Uber's downgrade - Uber convinced me to try Lyft and Fasten. Both are excellent, less expensive alternatives to Uber, and without the personal privacy abuses offered by Uber.

Thanks Uber, for showing me that there are better fish in the sea. 

Original Review: 
Since the app and service are tightly coupled, my review is for both. 

Overall, very good. Generally better than a cab. I have had one problem driver - crazy guy - but likely no less crazy than some cab drivers I have had. 

App could be easier to use, but it is quite good.

author: uznhjeoa368
title: $20 coupon: 99qtk
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: Harshine
title: App needs to know the pickup location first
content: App needs to know the pickup location first. Long time before Uber was my favorite but not anymore. The pickup location always is wrong and the driver getting to you from the map doesn't update. One time the driver was right in front of me but the app still showed 7 minutes away. This kind of wrong updates made me wait for the driver several times with wrong pick up location and when I cancel waiting for the driver I was charged cancellation fee of $5

author: Beachgirlilm

I used that to see where Uber was available in areas where we travel and also to see how far in advance I need to request my Uber. very frustrating and will start checking out other share ride services.

author: Malay Singh
title: Too many apps update
