author: Mikelag33
title: Overcharges!
content: Repeatedly overcharged me. Customer service is non-existent.

author: L81796
title: Trash App No clue how the service is...
content:
Absolute garbage app.  The Las Vegas airport has a designated pick up spot that our driver refused to find.  He then canceled our ride after we waited 20 minutes.  At this point, surge pricing tripled the cost of the ride and we ended up taking a taxi.
Our second attempt to use the app left us wandering around looking for an address because the app couldn't figure out where we were and considering all the trouble we had the first time we said forget it and downloaded the Lyft app.  Literally in less than 3 minutes had the Lyft app set up, promo code in, pick up location automatically loaded with special instructions and we had less than a 4 minute wait until our driver arrived.  The GPS on the uber app is trash.  Really disappointing.  Oh and the first driver who refused to pick us up at the airport tried to charge us a cancellation fee.  Although, Uber did refund it.

author: enigmatogo
title: Awful service!
content: In terms of service quality, it is second cab.

author: MGhostSoft
title: Watch out overcharges!!
content:
When you search the airport of your city, check the route carefully because possibly the destination is set to the middle of a runway and the route is several miles longer than it should be. As a result, you're paying $4~$6 extra for the distance you won't travel. I reported to Uber several month ago and never heard back.

And, do they think people are used to the "Always on" location tracking? No reason for me to allow them to track my location 5 minutes after drop off, and no reason to trust them only doing what the claimed to do.

And, people like me still haven't forgotten that Uber requested hundreds of Lyft cars then cancelled them and did so again and again. What a mean company.

Not that I'm still using this app. In fact, I have not used it ever since I found the overcharging trap. Not to mention the location tracking. I'm just keeping this app installed so that I can get back and leave a 1-star review whenever it is updated.

author: Pissedoff77
title: Location services
content: Location services option needs to go back to switch on only when using app. There's no reason to "Always" require sharing my location. Lyft doesn't have this problem. Keep updating to clear the bad reviews out everyone's just going to keep reposting them.

author: Phylantrop
title: Uber does not deserve your business!!!
content: Horrible, arrogant, parasitic company!

author: thehaszinator
title: new version is so bad
content: the new version that ios auto updated with is terrible. the user interface is now awful and it is a struggle to drop a gps pin instead of using an address. that was the best feature! addresses are unreliable. just let me drop a pin from the start again.

author: Close
title: Bad location settings
content: I deleted the app as soon as I saw that the settings for location services had no option for "While using app". Until that changes I won't be using the app or the service.

author: Lippydippyd
title: 162mb?
content: Why so big?  Seriously this is a Transit app, not Wikipedia. How about trying to optimize it a little?

author: Binnytheball
title: U don't need my location when I'm not using uber
content: The only options for location services is "Always" and "Never".  No, I'm not giving you my location when I'm not using the app. Guess who gives the option to only have location on "while using" the app?  Lyft. Lyft gets my business every time because of this.

author: Acura Integurl
title: Horrible Service!
content: I have been charged numerous times for trips and things that I have never taken. There is no phone number to contact customer support and the customer support service takes way too long to respond via email. I would choose Lyft before choosing this company.

author: Omar Biyari
title: Bad customer service
content:
They really have a bad customer service. 
I don't like that they use my location data always. And when you turn it off they don't let you use the app features as a punishment. What kind of a company does that. 
Use an app called Lyft. Its way better in everything, even prices.

author: Rasmus Mann
title: Uber Doesn't Care
content: With the antics of the CEO shouting at driver (he has a private driver now), allegations of misogyny at the HQ, and their lack of humanity (with undercutting LAX taxis on the day of the immigration march), I switched to Lyft and couldn't be happier to not to support this company.

author: Videos urban
title: For your free ride...
content: DO NOT use the promo codes given by other reviewers, it's a scam to give THEM free rides.  Get a code from a friend instead.

author: NotSoUser
title: Gets worse every other time
content: So its happened more than once that Ive requested a driver, get notified of having one and then five minutes later get notified they dropped me and its searching for yet another driver. Then sometimes the driver wont even show up for thirty minutes when it tells you Five. So then you cancel. And then you get charged. For literally nothing of your own fault. Im still trying to dispute two trips like that. Reputations going down, and the app is getting worse. Luckily most of the drivers are good people.

author: dnchristie
title: Updated app has serious regressions
content: I've been using Uber for several years. However the latest update of the app has serious problems. First it doesn't let you drop a pin (or at least I can no longer figure out how). This means it uses a coarse wifi location to choose a pickup point for me half a block away from where I actually am, and it dropped me in a bus stop where drivers can't stop (they get automatic tickets from bus cameras). Also I couldn't figure out how to see a picture of the car, so I had to spot by license plate alone. The experience is in the little things - why mess with a good app?

author: Don't mess with Ryan
title: Horrible customer service, buggy app, avoid
content:
I have been a frequent Uber user for a while now and have had nothing but trouble with the app. Anytime you have to contact customer service they give you the runaround, demand that you provide details even though they have access to that information. 

Please give lyft a try if you encounter the same problems. Uber is on their way down and doesn't treat their customers OR their drivers right at all!

author: alexafffff
title: Company does not own up to their mistakes
content: Uber does not own up to their mistakes!

author: DVMonster
title: TERRIBLE
content: After repeated updates the app still only works 1 out of 10 times. It's so frustrating I end up getting a yellow cab or using a different app. Terrible.

author: brighterorange
title: Location tracking
content: This app demands to have your location *all the time*, even when not using the app. The service is convenient, but I do not trust these creepy guys to track and log my location at all times.

author: nope.pdf
title: No respect for users
content: The creepy app tracks all the time you even after your trip had completed. It is a pain to enable/disable tracking before/after each use. I have been using Lyft exclusively.

author: Ladyyu
title: it'a hard to set the pick up place
content: It's really confusing. Hard to set where I want to be picked up now.

author: WykedSid
title: Crappy service
content: I would not recommend using this app unless you're okay with incompetent drivers and their crappy navigation. It seems that the navigation app they use can't decide which route to take and leaves the drivers going in circles (not their fault, of course). Aside from that, the worst offender has to be the fact that most of the drivers have crappy communication and this wasn't the case before when the company first started. This company has changed for the worse when it comes to solving issues and sadly the customer ends up paying for it. Sure, they conveniently offer super cheap fares, however you pay for what you get.

author: AKady
title: Super sketchy now use lyft
content: So many scandals!! Google it if you don't believe.

author: jo-A-mo
title: By far, worst update choice I made!
content: Do NOT, I repeat do not update app. This new current version is BS. It masks everywhere accept in your little circle. In basic terms, no longer able to doodle and look at other cities to see how many drivers are online let alone your current city. Uber has failed to amaze me with the developers behind this new version. I had to go out of my way, on a guarentee night to trace my way back to the old version. Sorry, you lost me with this one. As a Driver for Uber, I personally think we should know where other drivers are located at, why go somewhere where everyone is at and leave a 15 mintute drive to go get someone out of the blue, only because you didn't see where the others drivers are not located at in the city region. Just like having no tip option, this app version is not recommended yet alone to have as an install on your phone. Looks like a updated version of what Lyft should be.

author: Ohwow17
title: Get better drivers!
content: The app is good but drivers never pick me up from my location and when I try to contact them they never answer I always get charged a cancellation fee even when I don't cancel the trip might use lyft from now on

author: Extreamly displeased
title: Don't use uber
content: Today I requested an uber to get to the woman's march. The app said I would be paying between $14-$25 but I was charged $90. I had to send three separate emails before actually getting a response from a person that basically said they would only charge me $66 but that the app would have said that I had to pay surge pricing. The app never mentioned anything about surge pricing and if it had I never would have ridden with uber. This is my second upsetting uber experience (the first being a driver dropping me off three blocks away from my apartment). As someone without a car and is relatively new to the city it is also frustrating to have drivers getting frustrated when you don't know how to exactly get to your destination. I will not be using uber any longer and I would recommend that you should not use uber again.

author: Laura M Cano
title: Pool/ ETA
content:
I'm a daily Uber/Lyft user. It's my commute . 
The way pools are arranged are highly stupid. Most of the time we're picking other poolers who are completely off the route and more than a handful of times we've driven past my drop off location to drop off another passenger and driven back down to my drop off location lol I can't believe how often that happens. Their pooling operations is completely stupid . 

Also the pick up eta is horribly off, 1 minute in Uber means 3. So if your pick up time says 5 minutes then that means 15. 
Uber is a fraud, though it is cheap, there's a reason behind it. I feel bad for Uber drivers because these rates aren't fair to them and the app service fails on both our end and theirs as well. Shut this app down already.

author: Vaane321
title: Terrible
content: I used to love the app. A few days ago I was saying that something I loved about uber was that the showed you and made clear that the price was higher when it was. Now you took that away and I dont trust you as much. Also in my city the map doesn't correspond with the address. As a solution I suggested the app should let you send a note to the driver automatically with the uber request, but nothing. I hate the update

author: liber8
title: From OK to bad to horrible, invades privacy, ignores user requests
content: Uber continues its downward spiral and has lost my trust. The perpetual location tracking in the recent versions is unacceptable. Making matters worse, they have *removed* the option to use iOS's native privacy controls to allow location tracking only while using the app. Lyft respects users' privacy, unlike Uber. Also, I'm no longer able to rate drivers, since after turning off location tracking there's a nag screen every time one opens or returns to the app, and that nag screen blocks the page where typically one would rate the driver right after a trip (dismissing the nag screen also dismissed the rating screen, which is a major design flaw). Uber has officially gone from hit-and-miss to terrible. And, on top of that, now Uber wants access to your contacts as well as your location. Pass.

author: Tripp Cocktail
title: New version is a car crash in design
content: Total pain to designate your pickup location, you constantly need to close it and restart or else it will set your pickup to random place. So incredibly frustrating !!!

author: Tony_AZ
title: Unacceptable and very pervy!
content:
Location tracking alert!   Do not trust these guys with your location data.  Apple should remove Uber from the app store.

NOT  a consumer friendly company.

NOT an ethical company!

author: Adollin1234
title: Location
content: I don't understand why i can't use location service only while using the app. It's such a simple request.

author: Monoskier_

Nope. You still don't need my location once I end my ride. Fail

You want your stars back? Gives us back the option of "While Using"

author: MaddieJin1964
title: Lying about no rides
content: When I try to request a ride, the app would say request failed. Then 15 minutes later when I'm already on a bus, tell me my driver is arriving. Charges me $5 for canceling. Absurd and infuriating.

author: flip out
title: New App is embarrassing for Uber
content: Thanks for the horrible update Uber. I work at one of the largest buildings in a major city but you are too lazy to come pick me up where I work? You want to make me walk to a train station to get a car? I'll be using Lyft now, thx.

author: doxzero
title: What are these updates about
content: Provide some proper descriptions please. Even if you're just improving performance and ridding bugs, at least say something other than the same copy/past message. You may as well not saying anything. Try to be professionals, please.

author: OMNchld
title: Terrible at time
content: The times are constantly inaccurate. If the app says the wait for a driver is 5 minutes, and you set up your pick up, it tells you the real time to wait, which is always 15 minutes longer. This is beyond frustrating and inconvenient. If this doesn't get fixed soon, I'm sticking with Lyft.

author: Don'tDoThat
title: Payment method invalid. No, it's not.
content: Tried my cc, tried PayPal, neither worked. We should be able to rate zero stars.

author: HelloMellowYello
title: The company is in it for the money not the service
content: Uber does not pay enough for employees, but hoards a lot of money from employees. The company is making money from sitting  and just taking a huge chunk of money from other peoples efforts. Amazon and ebay do the same things but at, they take single digit percentages of other people's sale and encourage customer satisfaction and growth of small bussiness.

author: Asymmeter
title: Drivers cancel, company abuse
content:
I've been an Uber user since the early days, and today I deleted the app.

I've repeatedly been abandoned by drivers who refused to go to my destination and been endangered by drivers who seemingly had never been behind the wheel before and ignored laws and safety practices. 

Finally, my tolerance for the disgusting business practices and behavior of the CEO has reached it's limit.

Bad service. Bad company. Goodbye Uber.

author: Vddhbdfcfv
title: For obvious reasons
content: No option to turn off location and now there is tipping. The one thing they had that was better than Lyft

author: VS831
title: Awful support and app navigation!
content: All I was trying to do was get a hold of a customer service representative via email or via the app and could not find a way to reach out to anyone, just  directed to FAQs. This is disgusting that if I have a specific question outside of the predetermined options I can't even reach anyone at a $1 billion+ b2c company.

author: Jimmyshmimmy
title: Horrible customer service
content: The support team never answers you when you have a concern about something.

author: Weather pain
title: Location always on!
content:
Location is always on! Make it so it's "while you are using the app only" or you'll get a one star rating forever from me! Stop stalking me!!!!

And stop updating just to clear bad reviews. I would give you zero stars for that if I could!

author: ScottOreily
title: App not working at all
content: For some reason the app completely stopped working. Thanks a lot Uber, I'm done with you.

author: CottSclark
title: Uber needs to change
content: I had a lot of disdain for the cab companies that wouldn't show up in my neighborhood, and I appreciated Uber when it finally became possible to get a car to come to my house. I happily used Uber from the start and recommended it to friends. However, the company's culture needs serious change. It has a serious problem with sexual harassment. Drivers really don't get paid fairly. The CEO, Travis Kalanick needs to grow up. And I do not trust Uber cares about the privacy of any of its customers. I can no longer support a company that has such weak moral compass.

author: MrWeeble
title: Was great until...
content: I signed up with Uber at San Diego comic con and used them for about half a dozen rides. No problems with the app and had good drivers. So far so good, I thought.  Then came BlizzCon. I was in desperate need of a ride, so I opened the app and it oddly was requesting my login information. I tried but was unable to login, so I figured I had forgotten my password.  I reset my password and logged in again. That's when I received an "account disabled" message for no reason that I can possibly understand.  "No big deal", I thought "I'll just contact customer service".  Well, it turns out they don't have any.  Instead you submit a form and they will "contact you" instead. I waited as long as I could, and nothing. I eventually found a ride after literally begging people. 13 hours had gone by, and still no one had contacted me.  So, I submitted several additional requests for them to contact me. Still nothing, so deleted the app and came here to write about my experience. Now Lyft has me as a new customer.

author: Hoemguy
title: Terrible Company
content: If I could give this company a rating of zero I would. I have used the Uber 4 times. The first 1st experiences was great. Second experience was ok but the cat was dirty. Dyeing my third experience the guy was arrested in front of eyes because he will not legal to pick up at the airport. We decided to try it think it was a fluke then today we had our driver cancel and we were charged a $5 cancel fee. Pulse I did not realize they canceled because it was sent to my e-mail and I did not check my e-mail again until I was supposed to be picked up. Stay far away from this company. Nothing but frustration!!

author: Vctomy
title: Not good business
content: Privacy is now violated and location services is ON permanently. Prices keep hiking and uber calls it "Dynamic Fares" to get other drivers to work? Why would the customer have to pay for that? Reliability is important. Now when requesting an uber, it is hit or miss with both drivers and the app. If the driver decides to take an alternate route or does not contact you to cancel your ride, the customer is forced to cancel and is charged $5 for waiting. Finally if the driver cancels and you try to get another driver, because of the demand at that particular moment, you are now forced to pay double the fare. Because this practice continues to get worse, it forces me to be skeptical about the service I would receive on any given day.

author: uftbelcp368
title: $20 coupon: harshp6993ue
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: Johnstreedvv
title: Meh
content: Great idea, bad company. The lack of ethics and morals weigh heavier than their service's convenience.

author: Rick3vino
title: Bad location services
content: This is a really bad update. Before, when typing in an address I never had a problem with a driver finding me. Now it's very iffy. Today, despite an address, driver was waiting half a block away. Navigation through the app is clunky too. This is not an improvement.

author: FUFB!!!!!!!!
title: Getting worse and worse
content:
The latest update is terrible. Uber has really gone to the dark side - I checked what the new update was about before downloading, and it said NOTHING about "always" location sharing. The reason given was "fix issues where app didn't work for some users". 
The privacy invasion and battery/data drain in roaming is absurd and unnecessary. The app doesn't load otherwise. The app won't allow to enter pick up address, only pin drop option, which is a real pain because half the time Uber claims I'm block from where I actually am. It's ok when I'm home, but when traveling, I often can't tell that the blue dot is actually nowhere near my actual location. Pick up times are also so frustrating - app shows cars down the street, but then I'm matched with someone 8-10 minutes away. 
I use Lyft as much as I can now vs Uber unless I'm abroad where Lyft is not present. Uber used to have great customer service and a *good* company. That is no longer true. It remind me of how Groupon lost its way. 
Uber, please cancel the absurd "always" location feature and start listening to your customers!

author: AlexP916
title: Uber is Evil.
content: If you thought Google is evil, Uber is worst. They should be ashamed of themselves with the way they operate.

author: Fix Location Services!!
title: Fix Location Services!!
content: Terrible new requirement! The latest update now requires Always or Never for Location Services?? Why Uber? And why Uber did you use tricky language in your update to state you only need it while using the app? Clearly that's not how users see the choice of Location Services: Always or Never. Until this is made right I'm afraid my setting is on NEVER.

author: Patrimq
title: Trouble with drivers not showing up and charging
content:
I have had trouble with drivers not showing up, canceling them, then getting charged $6 anyways.  I hate that there are no humans to talk to.
Don't like the location services .
I'm switching to lyft

author: D NDadlan
title: Terrible new interface - not user friendly
content: The new updated look is terrible and not as user friendly. I just taught my nanny how to use Uber and then they updated the interface the next week and she cannot figure it out! I can barely figure it out. It also frequently freezes and crashes and takes VERY long to request a car.

author: Domainer23
title: One star until you stop requiring location services...
content: ...to be on all the time versus just when using the app. Seriously, who does that anymore?

author: Dberg_
title: This company is garbage - delete their app ASAP
content: Uber recently fired 20 employees for sexual harassment. The CEO has been caught on video going off on drunken tirades verbally abusing his own employees. He's admitted publicly he only started the company so he could travel around SF like a "baller". The company is also getting sued for deliberately stealing google's intellectual property for self driving cars. Uber is a joke. Don't waste any more of your money on this company.

author: rdschouw
title: It's ok until something better comes along
content:
Update: now Uber forces that they can always track our location even when we are not using the app. I'm ok with the idea but not that it's forced. Uber is so arrogant.

Drivers are showing up consistently later than promised in the app. Typically twice as long as shown before requesting and then again twice as long than stated on the pin. And now they want you to wait outside (2m max) because you know drivers time is valuable. My time is valuable too thank you very much. Not impressed.

author: hags12
title: Horrible corporate practices
content: Poor leadership and corporate practices led me to delete the app

author: Pany Chi
title: No more
content: I used to really like uber. Today will be the last day I use uber. It's not because of the service, it's because they're all about benefits for themselves now. More expensive, a lot of time wasted on waiting because the app is bad at matching driver with rider. Switching to Lyft.

author: SRTboy169
title: Didn't think it could get worse
content: I didn't think the app could get worse after the last redesign, but you outdid yourselves! Also requiring location data always? No thanks.

author: Cavucs
title: Overcharges and terrible support!
content:
Uber evolved into a cash trap over the years.

Very often, the app miscalculates routes, so that you pay for a distance you won't travel. Also, if the driver misses a turn, the app will charge you more for the extra miles traveled. 

Recently, Uber began charging cancellation fees even when the driver cancels the ride. You should complain to receive credit on a future ride. If you forget to write, your mistake. 

Uber tracks our location even when we're not using the app and its customer service team uses a passive-aggressive tone carefully adjusted to make people feel bad about contacting support.

I deleted the app as soon as a competitor arrived in my city.

author: Gadwall
title: I'd like the app if the company wasn't so sleazy
content: My biggest gripe is having to turn my location services on and off when I use Uber because they're so shady I don't trust them enough to track my location 24/7. Then I read they pulled some sleaze on phone fingerprinting and tracking even when this app is uninstalled. Finally I read today they were in bed with an email management company to track one of Uber's competitor's customer receipts. I could go into further details in other published activities but my thumbs are getting tired.

author: saealee
title: Denied
content:
My card was denied when there in fact was money on there  I downloaded LYFT and I typed in same card with LYFT and it went through smh. Goodbye uber
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 开发者回复：Thanks for letting us know. We're always looking to improve the app. Let us know more about the issues, head over to t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.

author: NFB19582729
title: Taxis will make a dramatic comeback
content:
When I registered a fare dispute because I was charged more than the app originally showed, I got the following response: 

"We've received feedback that your recent trip's request and pickup location were a significant distance apart. After review, it appears that your request location was within a surged pricing zone, while the dropped pin for pickup was not. 

Please note that manipulation of this system violates Uber policy. It also places additional stress on drivers. Repeated violations of this policy can result in suspension of your account."

It's absolutely true the request and pickup distance were a significant distance apart - nearly 20 feet. My bad!! I'm sorry it posed such a challenge to the driver. But the real problem was watching him try to drive. As though he had never been in Manhattan. We got out five blocks early to put him out of his misery and now I'll do the same for the whole Uber company by giving Lyft a try.

author: spikeanoid
title: Constant updates just to hide bad reviews
content: Privacy policy is a joke, and the drivers can be downright dangerous.

author: rlowrider
title: Uber harassment
content:
I have no time for a company that sexually harasses it's female employees. Your CEOs advocacy for President Trump is also infuriating, just reinforcing how selfish and misogynistic the Uber environment is. 

Goodbye uber, hello lyft.

author: cntueni
title: Scam Artists
content: Constantly overcharging and not refunding the money. I had driver get lost on the way to the airport and not tell me. Her phone was dead so the GPS on uber didn't track her extra 40 miles off track. I ended up paying $100 for my ride and missed my flight. They gave me $5 credit for more uber rides not even a refund. $5 lol. What a joke. Absolute scam.

author: Wanttotryit
title: AppBloat
content:
Service is fine. 
App is bloated beyond all reason...

author: Dariannn123
title: TERRIBLE SERVICE
content: FIRST OFF, I loved uber when they had flat rates. I was a loyal uber user, I must've spent over 3,000$ all together with uber. There has been a couple of bad experience and one the uber driver had went on his own trip to a little gas station to get some snacks and I demanded a refund and contacted support. However they refused to refund me the money and continued to try and argue with me so I told them I was going to go use Lyft and they decided to block me from using uber after I told them to delete my account.

author: Heyyoucanfinish2356
title: Put Tip option on app let customers decide
content: ---UBER doesn't disclose pricing anymore. Can't tell surge, per mile price. Hiding costs.  Illegal. You are the only game in town that has the most business. Lyft is there but not close. Your LA Rates can be liveable and you make more money. People have no real choice they will use Uber even at normal rates. Hhhhh

author: TruReviewToo
title: AAARGH!!!!  Update takes away
content: I blame myself.  And Uber.  Updated app and now it wants all or nothing Location Services so it can track and spy on my everyday movements.  I had previously set for "While Using" which is perfectly convenient and practical. Now I know I/we do not matter to Uber.  And per poor app design, it blew away my settings.  When will developers grow up and, based on version check, pull existing data/settings for a seamless update.  Why start over.  I can understand les incompetents at the search directory which rhymes with wahoo!, but are you all incompetent?

author: LoLo Fa Sho
title: Best customer service!
content: I've had two incidents where I was overcharged by the driver and customer service refunded me within an hour of my email. Can't get much better than that! Because of this I am loyal to uber as my main transportation app.

author: grogalski69
title: Quit asking for always on location tracking
content: I'm sick of apps which want to track my location at all times. It's not necessary for the functionality of this app, used to work fine without it!!!

author: Jessica Hisis
title: Shouldn't always use location
content: There really isn't a valid reason to always track users.

author: whiskeyrivers
title: Travis Kalanick/Uber Are MONSTERS
content: If you haven't already, go listen to episode number 271 of the podcast called The Dollop. It goes into great detail what a horrible human Travis Kalanick is, and what a monstrous organization Uber is. Vile. Horrendous. The list is virtually endless of the shady, illegal, DANGEROUS business activities they have engaged in. I will never ever ever ever ever ever ever use Uber again. I feel terrible for ever having used it in the first place. To all drivers for Uber that have been screwed over, to all victims of assault at the hands of Uber drivers that were never properly background checked, to all of those people injured by Uber drivers with atrocious driving records and Uber driverless cars, and anyone else who has fallen victim to this predatory company, I am truly sorry from the bottom of my heart for ever spending a dime to fund these subhuman soulless pig people.

author: SisterDawn7
title: App was great until recently
content: This app used to be wonderful until they overhaul.  I keep hoping they'll fix what they've broken, but each update sees it getting worse and worse.  The way they say they'll use your location is very misleading.  Also used to be that when you entered a business name as pick-up or destination, the driver could see this, and knew what they were looking for. Now according to multiple drivers, business names are not displayed even when entered by the rider, only the address is.  I'm really starting to wonder if Uber even reads these app reviews, given the horrible ratings it now has.

author: Burnsss212
title: Terrible service
content: Uber started out as my favorite app when it first came out now I'm starting to notice a lot of bull.. today I was at the mall attempting to get a Uber , first time I tried the cost was 9.69 as I was in the middle of ordering, my phone lost wifi connection so it didn't go thru but once it connected again the price refreshed to 14.72 .. I disconnected wifi and reconnected and th price went back to 9.60 , I clicked request  ride as soon as I seen the price but my phone had died as it was searching for a driver.. once I get home later I charge my phone and check Uber , apparently Uber still sent a driver after my phone died and decided to charge me a cancellation fee ... I'm completely over this app now , switching to lyft..

author: Chm8700
title: The worst customer service ever
content: In New Years night My friends and I decided to take an Uber. I requested the service 3 times and all the drivers cancelled on me. They didn't charge me the first two cancellations, but they charged me $5.00 for the third cancellation. The driver said that we were not in the right place, but we were. There was an Uber driver right on front of us, but he said he was not our driver. We never got a phone call from the diver or text. I tried to get a refund for the unfair situation, but instead I got a credit. I explained the situation and informed Customer service that I didn't want a credit because in first place I shouldn't have been charged. They came back saying that it was my fault for not being on time to get the Uber. I have lost five dollars but I won't ever will use Uber in my life.

author: Stop8:)
title: Love Uber cheap airport ride using their rule.
content: We always get cheap rides to airport by doing Uber pool.  Because they can only charge cancellation fee after cancelling a ride for over 5minutes, just try get Uber pool and keep cancelling ride when you see there is a passenger on the Uber car, make sure you cancel before 5 mins. And believe me you will always get a cheap ride to the airport.  It also works from the airport, no cancellation fee when cancelling under 5mins upon requesting a ride.  You can do this too on regular ride but on regular ride sometimes you still get a 2nd passenger, but on airport we never get 2nd passenger because most rider just do UberX.  Don't worry it is their policy so your not breaking any rules until they change it.  Love Uber they take care of passengers than drivers, well the money paying them and making them rich is from passengers so why not right. Go Uber

author: AbsolutelyTrash103947283
title: Unsafe and sketchy privacy policy
content:
Edit: especially after the latest news about how Uber handles internal sexual harassment claims, I stand by my own feelings even more. I will soon be deleting my account! 

As a young female who often has to travel alone, I feel unsafe a lot of the time when using Uber and I refuse to use the app by myself unless more  features are added. An SOS button (potentially one that you would have to press and hold for a certain amount of time to eliminate false alarms) that alerts police and/or an emergency contact is ideal. The new feature that tracks your location even when the app is not in use is just sketchy and also feels very unsafe. The newest feature that will take you to a person by linking your contacts may appear convenient but also sounds super sketchy. I will no longer use Uber unless necessary safety changes are made. Additionally the Uber company has gotten into many fights with different cities regarding their practices. Overall Uber is just kind of sketchy and unsafe

author: Charlie Burnett
title: Lyft just got a new customer
content:
Uber made it pretty much impossible to find the button to share rides. By the time I found it the ride was over. Ended up paying the full amount. 

App almost always puts the pin in the wrong location, and constantly drops incoming drivers only to find that getting a new driver costs a few dollars more. 

As a customer, privacy is hugely important to me, and now that my location is always being tracked I don't feel comfortable having this app installed on my phone. It also drains the battery faster than if it were not constantly on. It's a lose, lose. Lose the tracking and you'll get your customer back.

After I have made other plans, of course. 
No way to rate the app or complain about it in the help setting. Very frustrating and would send me straight to Lyft if that was an option in my city. Get it together, Uber!

author: Sasquatchbihhh

content: Lately all my drivers have been about 14-20 minutes away from me and they all take even longer to arrive. If I haven't cancelled by then, the ones that come "on time" don't know where they are going and drive slow. I'm a college student and I've been late so many times. It took my most recent driver 5 minutes to leave my neighborhood and all he had to do was make a left...

author: MikesUpdate
title: App program
content: Around typical peak times, drivers cancel current bookings so that they can take advantage of the peak time fares. This negatively impacts the rider and the rider must then re-book a new Uber at the higher rate. When a driver cancels a booking the app should automatically reassign a new driver under the same fare rate as the original booking. This is an improvements that if not updated in the app program then I will find another service to use. As a current Uber user, I often considering using other book and ride services as Uber is no longer the only option. Also. if a rider cancels a booking after 5 minutes, the rider is charged a cancelation fee which goes to the driver for lost time. If a driver cancels after 5 minutes the rider only receives a notification that the driver has canceled. This penalty structure is unfair. In Qatar, drivers cancel too often. Riders who have lost time due to cancelations by drivers should have a credit to their account which should discount their next trip. This would discourage cancellations from both riders and drivers where not necessary. Uber, you need to be better, not just good enough.

author: Jacob Petersen
title: Crashes on iPad Pro 10.5, no way to email customer service
content:
This app is actually pretty great, I'm giving it one star because THIS is the only way to address app issues with Uber. 

App crashes upon opening. Deleted it and reinstalled did nothing! 

Also, since Uber now insists on collecting your location 24/7 and with no option to use while using app only option, I've been using Lyft as my main app. Fix this uber, it's getting creepy and people want their privacy!

author: Bostonian 84
title: Great concept but horrible execution
content: The idea of car sharing is great and I have been a rider for about two years. However Uber has no standards whatsoever for recruiting drivers. It is common to have drivers who have no knowledge of the area they are working in and just blindly follow the navigation app.  Many even pick me up in the back alley, where there aren't even service doors.  Several times drivers don't show up but they charge you for the ride and then you have to deal with the intricacies of the Uber organization to get a refund for what otherwise be fraud. Dealing with Uber is a big hassle 1 out of 4 times. Looking for alternatives...

author: HewelHauser
title: No issues here
content: Works great here on the left coast.  All the negative reviews make me wonder if there are regional problems -or- a heavy effort by the taxi drivers to smear their competition. If that's the case, good luck with that.

author: Tokidokilove
title: Download Lyft!
content: #DELETE Uber. Get the Lyft app it's so easy to use they don't invade privacy they ask permission for everything they want to access and you get the real price your going to pay. There's no surcharge or any of that and if there's a problem you email them and they get back to you right away. The drivers and cars are always super clean.

author: Lakersfan87
title: No privacy or service
content:
1. The privacy issue is problematic for those that care about this issue. It only allows for the app to see your location always or never, not allowing for "allow location while app in use." If you dont have location tracking, you can't review your driver!

2. By in large there seems to be a consensus that Uber doesn't treat it's drivers well and therefore the drivers take out their Uber-related stresses on the customer. Needless to say this is a HUGE factor against Uber because Uber is not a service but rather a technology and they utilize consenting drivers to do the work for them and exploiting them for their vehicles. I've been scolded by drivers for merely ASKING if I could eat in the car, "this isn't Uber's car, this is my car" which is followed by how poorly Uber is to them. This behavior has caused me to not even ask drivers anything. I hesitate to even ask the driver to turn down the volume. One would argue they shouldn't drive but not many drivers would be left and many do this to support a family.

author: IgaviD
title: Impaired judgement
content: As I didn't feel safe while traveling to airport with a driver whom just smoked a blunt before I was picked up. That would be zero stars

author: Johnathan Lohr
title: Disappointed and disgusted
content: The notion of paying Uber drivers in order to be given a decent passenger rating is disgusting. You can be the friendliest passenger but if you're unable to shell out a $10 cash tip you're basically a one star rider. The drivers seem to take passenger ratings very seriously too so if you have a low rating you likely won't get a ride the next time you need one. Uber claims that this system is meant to "strengthen the community" but as a longtime passenger it only leaves a very bad aftertaste. To grade paying customers with a point system based on such abstract factors is thoroughly insulting.

author: Theasiandudeguy
title: Too many minors,  no-show riders, parents dont have carseats
content:
Enforce your terms of service! Not only is this agains your own terms if service, it illegal for rideshare and taxi drivers to transport unaccompanied minors. Drivers should not have those cancellations count against them. Drivers should also not be penalized for cancelling a ride after waiting the required wait time. Drivers are not paid for waiting prior to pickup so thwre is no incentive to wait any longer than 2min. for Uberpool and 5 for UberX

Then there are the parents that request a ride with their children, but don't have proper restraints. The other day I had a lady tried having me give her a ride while carrying her newborn infant. title: Monitors location 100% of time??? HORRIBLE!!
content: I completely understand the desire to have data around user behavior. Often this data helps improve the application for the users (and of course makes the company more money) however I draw the line at collecting location data on users UNRELATED to the use of the service 100% of the time. This is absurd! 1) it drains your battery 2) it's invasive to privacy 3) endless security concerns - just because you think you're invincible doesn't mean you are. What happens when you're(Uber) hacked and all this private data on people is taken? It literally puts lives at risk. I've been a Uber user for years, but I won't be again until this is resolved.

author: ZekeresSJ
title: location "always on" is creepy
content: This review is to complain about the app's new location settings. You used to be able to only send location data "while using app", now you have to choose between "always" or "never" sharing your location. This means Uber can deduce when you appear to be using transit instead of calling an Uber, which restaurants you frequent, which riders you hang out with, where, when, and for how long. This is literally giving a company with no oversight permission to stalk you. They were fined 20k last year for using location data outside of "legitimate business purposes."  This is insane. Uber please bring back the "while using app" option.

author: smithc555
title: They will rip you off!
content: I've been using Uber for around 3 years now. I know how surge pricing works. I've been notified before that my price is going to be 1.5x, 2x, 3x, etc more. Last night I requested a ride. Normal pricing would have been around $12. I was NOT warned about surge pricing that night. Once I was home I pulled up my invoice, and much to my dismay it was $46! The receipt shows no surge pricing. Just a base charge of $46. I've been emailing with costumer service all day and they have been extremely unhelpful. They just keep copy/pasting a description of what surge pricing is and telling me to check my receipt which indicates the surge pricing. The problem is that my receipt does NOT indicate surge pricing, and I was NOT notified of surge pricing in the app. Thieves! Poor business practices. Poor customer service.

Please put the feature back where the app only has access to your location while it is in use on your phone... that would make my review go from a 3 to 5-star. I've read many reviews with a similar complaints, please LISTEN TO YOUR COSTUMERS.

author: Spare me...
title: What are you thinking Uber?
content: The new app is terrible.  Uber gps is unreliable at best and now it takes 3 extra steps to adjust your location to accurately reflect the address you are actually requesting pick up from.  You send drivers to the alley behind where I live despite the fact that I have my home address reflected in my profile.  When I pull up the app to request a pick up, you automatically determine where your gps reflects that I am but it is not accurate in most cases.  On Friday I requested pickup and the app showed me 3 blocks away on a different street and not where where I was actually located.  Please fix this mess. I have been an Uber customer since the very beginning in CA and since moving to Chicago my experiences have spiraled downward due to bad gps performance. I average $200+ per month in rides by the way.  Lyft is looking more attractive daily.

author: Rosemaryx34

author: RecentUpdates
title: Unusable (lack of privacy)
content: I will not be using this app anymore. Because I declined letting the app keep tracking my location even while I am not using the app, it is now next to useless. Good thing I still have Lyft installed, because with Uber there is not even an option in the privacy tab in the phone's settings menu for tracking location "Only while using" like there is for other apps (Including Lyft).

author: Jjjjjjjjjkjjakakak
title: App development team should be fired
content:
This is unequivocally the worst major app update in the history of the Uber app. I'm struggling to recall an app update I hate worse than this one, from any company. Wow. Where do I even begin?

It's completely absurd that I'm no longer able to compare wait times between Uber's different services, such as UberPool, UberX and Select. It was very useful in the past that I was able to see where all the nearby drivers are, before ordering a ride. Sometimes I would move my pin to a side street, based on the locations of the closest driver.

I can no longer see a photo of the driver's car. Why they took this out is beyond me. Do you want me to be able to find the right car or not?

Also, with this version Uber is hiding the fares even more than they have with their previous app updates. Now there's no way to know if it's surging or not, or to check what the base fare is when I travel to different cities. This is extremely suspect, if anything Uber should be offering MORE transparency in their pricing, not less. I'm not entirely sure it's legal for them to conceal the rate we are paying per mile and per minute when we order a ride. For all I know, I'm paying $3.00 a mile while the drivers are being paid $0.85. SHADY!

Please fire your app development team and start over from scratch. This regression is a bad look for your company. It's very amateur.

author: moonnnstar

author: Prinssetoni
title: Location services always or never

To make matters worse the most recent update only allows you to set location to always on or never... the prior versions allowed you to set location while using the app. There's also a problem where a few (1/4) drivers are supposed to show up in one type of car only to show up in a more ratty/older set of wheels. Last point, improve uberpool rider detection, it doesn't make any sense to have to get off the highway, make a huge 15 minute detour to pickup someone else: improve the algorithm. Overall, this version of the app is a big downgrade, takes many steps just to set pickup location (the forced auto detect is often wrong).

I wished I switched to Lyft sooner as its my go to app from now on!

That car is the same distance as the 1st with several red lights between us. That car starts to drive even further away off course. I cancel call another car, that car cancels on me. It takes 30 minutes to go 10 minutes away and that's without using Uber pool. Uber pool yesterday shows me a 9 minute wait for the car which turned into a 45 minute wait. I've sent feedback countless times and every time I get a message saying they've resolved my issue as if they spoke to me and gained agreement that it had been resolved. And, do they think people are used to the "Always on" location tracking? No reason for me to allow them to track my location 5 minutes after drop off, and no reason to trust them only doing what the claimed to do.

And, people like me still haven't forgotten that Uber requested hundreds of Lyft cars then cancelled them and did so again and again. What a mean company.

Not that I'm still using this app. In fact, I have not used it ever since I found the overcharging trap. Not to mention the location tracking. I'm just keeping this app installed so that I can get back and leave a 1-star review whenever it is updated.

author: pgk2008
title: Invasive GPS tracking policy even after many user complaints
content:
Location tracking is all or nothing with Uber. Normal apps offer "track only when using", but Uber demands "Always track". If the past year has taught us anything, it's "don't trust Uber to do the right thing". 

It looks like they're not in a hurry to listen to customers' complaints, since we're at least eight updates in since I started paying attention to the GPS issue. It also seems like they abuse the app update system. Weekly 170MB updates with no change log. That's half a gig per month, thanks guys..

Partial workaround for tracking: disable GPS for the Uber app, and only turn it back on if you absolutely need to use the app. And then turn it back off when you get to the destination. 

In the meantime I've been using the friendly Uber competitor, and so far it's worked like a charm. Thanks Uber, for encouraging me to check out other apps!

author: Ertuck
title: Useful service, but...
content:
Love the service overall.  However,

1. Provide the "when using app" option for location services.  That setting should allow for the 5 minutes post ride tracking Uber wants to do in 90% of cases.
2. Make it easier to change which credit is being charged and easier to see confirmation of which card has been selected.  Thought I had changed to my work card, but charges were posted to my personal card, complicating expense reporting.
3. Provide access to other app features, even if location services are off.  It's currently difficult/impossible to access things like receipts, cards, history, etc. if you don't have location services on.  You get stopped at the first screen.  I don't need a ride, I just need to print a receipt.  Uber doesn't need to know where my printer is!
4. Gift cards were a great idea, but it seems the fare for a trip is still charged to the users credit/debit card, then some time later,  the gift card is charged and the credit/debit card charges are reversed.  I gave gift cards to my college student son, to keep transport expenses separate, but the charging/credit back process caused overdrafts when his debit card was charged.

author: Ashesmommy

Please add on a gratuity option as not carrying cash is the whole reason I use uber in the first place.

author: DSJ.
title: Oh, Uber! What have you done?
content:
I'm getting close to doing the #deleteUber thing. First, my recent Lyft/Uber driver said that Lyft treats drivers better (and allows for tipping; word has it that if you don't tip an Uber driver, your star rating may suffer, but there's no way to tip with the app).

Next came Uber's "Terrible, Horrible, Very Bad Week" per USA Today two weeks ago:
1) a former engineer sued Uber for sexual harrassment and discrimination, 
2) investors berated the company for fostering a toxic work culture
3) sued by Waymo for stealing driverless car technology (denied by Uber)
4) VP of Engineering dismissed for not making it known that he was the subject of a sexual harassment suit at his former employer, Google
5) a video surfaced of CEO Travis Kalanik berating a driver (leading to an apology to the company)
6) the week's not over yet! Authorities report that Uber's been using their secret "Greyball" program to evade law enforcement.

OK, unless Lyft's not around, is there ANY reason to use Uber?? Sheesh!

content: I have used uber for well over a year now, today I experienced the worst customer service when making a complaint about a $2 cancellation fee and explaining why I was making the complaint with valid reasoning and screenshots. Customer service replied ignoring my explanation and simply overlooking the trip on the data the app provided and stated that the issue was marked resolved as I was charged appropriately. My complaint wasn't over $2 by the way, it was over the fact that the driver kept taking wrong turns and I had to cancel because from being 1 minute out he was 10 minutes out and the next ride I got was $10 more expensive than the current ride I had to get. Very disappointed in the customer service. Lyft has 10x better customer service and actually listens to the complaint. Just go with lyft.

author: Britretra
title: awful update losing customers and drivers

You can't even look at the map anymore to see if there are cars in the area. You MUST enter a location AND a destination. Which isn't fair because I've had drivers cancel rides once they know where you're going, which means unreliability. I've also had drivers complain about the new navigation. It prompted them to arrive a half a street away from where I was. These updates are the reason I will no longer use uber. When I've never had an issue before. I guess I'll have to use lyft.

author: Endeavor1907
title: User Privacy Squashed!
content: By now mandating users give the app access to user location "ALWAYS" (rather than "When app is in use") Uber is committing a serious violation of our privacy rights. Unfortunately, despite the hue and cry over this, they are bulldozing through the negative feedback. Will it take users to uninstall their app for the company to listen? I consider the lack of control, despite their claims otherwise, a privacy breach deserving the strongest reaction. I hope users pile on the pressure and force a U turn. 24/7 location access is a non starter as far as I'm concerned Uber. Please return the app permission for location to "when app is in use" only. Also, allow users to use the app without giving the location, as it were possible earlier.

author: skm1973
title: Location services must always be on!
content: I very much dislike that in order to use this app, you are immediately prompted to allow location services, and you can only choose between "always" and "never". I do not feel comfortable having Uber ALWAYS track my movement, so I turn it on when I need to use the app and then I have to go back and turn it off afterwards. This is a nuisance and an invasion of privacy to expect all users to allow you to follow their movement at all times. Why can't you have a setting for "only while using app"? Using Lyft until you change this feature.

author: Lance J.
title: Serious flaws ruin Uber; lots of better providers.
content:
I used Uber quite a lot over the past several years...  but now they've run totally off the rails. Their privacy posture is truly nutsoid, limiting my choices of how they use GPS. No thanks to tracking me all the time. All-the-time GPS drains batteries too. Uber doesn't seem to care.

But I am happy to report one AWESOME  thing about Uber's downgrade - Uber convinced me to try Lyft and Fasten. Both are excellent, less expensive alternatives to Uber, and without the personal privacy abuses offered by Uber.

Thanks Uber, for showing me that there are better fish in the sea. 

Original Review: 
Since the app and service are tightly coupled, my review is for both. 

Overall, very good. Generally better than a cab. I have had one problem driver - crazy guy - but likely no less crazy than some cab drivers I have had. 

App could be easier to use, but it is quite good.

author: Edwin1845
title: Bad

Uber: Re enable the option to only share when using the app.

author: DaveTrx
title: Uber app does not complete last step
content: When I use the UBER app to request a car, it does not complete the last step. I get down to verifying my driver and it crashes.  I then do not know if my driver was contacted or who it will be.   I was surprised to then receive a call from a UBER driver saying that he was waiting for me.  Likewise, on the second trip, it did the same thing.  I logged out of my IPad and into my phone UBER app and the driver showed up after I logged in.  This could really be bad if someone who was not my driver said he was and I got into the wrong or bad car.

author: southpawz505
title: ETA is a lie and navigation is horrible
content:
This app and is loaded with problems. The 3 that bother me the most are:

The ETAs for your arrival that are offered by the app are completely dishonest. I consistently get in and watch my arrival time increase by 10 minutes, everyday. Not 2 minutes, 10. If you're going to be that wrong that often, quote a higher ETA to begin with. I'll watch the driver switch to google maps or waze and the ETA is always more accurate there.

Second, the navigation is ungodly bad. I live in NYC. I love watching the little uber cars float across the map when it's confused. Or half the uber route just disappear. Or watch it send the driver in circles back and forth trying to pick me up. Or the app not knowing any of the NYC street rules (bus lanes, no right turns during the day, etc...). I find it hard to believe that there isn't some uber employee in NYC who hasn't used the app and noticed these problems.

And last, the app lies to you about how close drivers are. I will request an uber, it'll go to the preliminary screen showing there are 4 drivers nearby and it'll take 5 minutes to get to you...then as soon as I hit confirm and request...the driver will be there in 12 minutes and is on the other side of the city!

I know we've seen recently Uber has been in the news for generally just being a terrible company. I imagine they'll keep that up and not fix any of these issues until users just start to leave the app en masse. But that won't happen because they maintain the bare minimum amount of service to keep you using it. It's sort of analogous to a lousy Manhattan landlord. So I'm not even sure why I'm writing this review.

author: TishTishh08
title: Uber quality has decreased.
content: Being a college student with no car, Uber is a valuable transportation resource. Lately, their drivers have been very unprofessional. They accept my ride but drive the opposite direction and then ignore all my calls. I've complained to uber and their response is basically "you haven't been charged so it's okay", but it isn't always about the charge. It is very inconsiderate of my time to have to cancel, or be canceled on, and request another ride. They need to step their game up and do better training for their drivers.

author: Pablopilot

I'm not going to recommend this app from Uber. The Uber app pulls the resale value out of your car to Pay YOU. Uber needs to compensate and pay the drives real money, so they can fix and maintain there car's. Uber doesn't pay much to the drivers at all (Uber keeps about 60% of what the rider pay UBER). Once you consider your fuel cost, extremely high cost of ride-share car insurance, car maintenance and the terrible wear and tear on the car itself plus significant lose of value of your car at resale, especially because of the super high miles on your vehicle. The Uber app is a very bad deal for the drive. However the riders are getting a great deal on your dime and time.  Sorry for the bad new.

author: WashyFun
title: ALWAYS USING LOCATION! Truly Disappointing from Uber
content:
ETA: Warning: the app is ALWAYS using location, not just "5 minutes after" using as Uber says. iOS informed me 2 days after my last app usage, when the app was deliberately closed, that Uber had been using my location in the background, asking me if I want to turn it off. I could not dislike this awful requirement from Uber more or think less about them right now. It works poorly if you don't have location on; trying to remember to remove access for new scummy version of Uber in between uses. The difficulty to do basic tasks especially when not allowing location, has not improved...

Original review for this version below...

I've used Uber regularly for years. I could not be more disappointed with the direction they are taking.

There are two major issues with this app. First, they took a good interface and made it extremely difficult to use. It is clunky, has major issues, and is difficult to do simple things.

But most importantly, their change to require users to grant them location access ALWAYS and removing the "when using the app" option is infuriating. This is a paid service. Google makes their money off my data. Uber gets plenty of data about me, but I also directly pay them every time I ride! There is no reason to force your users to choose between never or always, and make the app extremely difficult to use if I choose never. Access to location when I'm not using the app is battery-draining and privacy-violating. 

Also why is there such a double-standard for driver versus passenger ratings?

Look at your app reviews, and listen to your users. I'm switching to Lyft in any city I can until Uber stops taking its customers for granted.

Lyft has no problem with only using your location while you use the app. Guess who I'll be riding with...

author: musicjunkie701
title: Quit tracking me. Otherwise good.
content:
I was laying in bed one night, and I unlocked my my iPhone, and got a notification that Iber had been tracking my location and whether I wanted to stop it. I had taken an Uber that morning so I guess it had tacked me all day. 

Uber is a great app and the concept is great, but this recent change where I always need to share my location is ridiculous. 

Now I say the app can never track my location. Just a bit too creepy to think it might be tracking me. So if I want to use it I need to find a nearby address and type that in as my location. This is a pain. So I've found myself using the Gett app more. 

Gett's cab drivers want nothing more than to make Uber disappear. Continuing to creep its users out is a quick way for Uber to give Gett more of its business and make their cabbies stronger, who will stomp Uber out in city councils around the world. 

So, Uber, just stop tracking me please. I want you to win but you're making it hard.

author: bro12345621

content: Awful company, awful service, awful culture. It's amazing how much better Lyft is. I wouldn't use Uber if it was the end of the world.

author: BrooksTalley
title: Totally broken unless you give up 24/7 location data
content:
Check recent news to see how Uber abuses its users' trust: Uber employees are reported to have tracked celebrities and ex-boyfriends / ex-girlfriends using location data from the app.

Now Uber has made it impossible to use the service unless you consent to always-on, 24/7 location tracking.

Older versions of the app allowed users to choose "while using the app" for location privacy; the current version forces users to choose between "always" and "never".

If you choose "always", Uber will be able to track you 24/7, even if it has been weeks since you used the app. There is no legitimate reason they could want this.

If you choose "never", the app is non-functional. There is no way to enter a pickup address. You cannot use the service at all.

I am deleting the app and recommend against anyone installing it. There are plenty of competing services that are less abusive to their users.

author: Soltaker93

author: Diegito23
title: Advices
content:
Advices for the Uber App:

-Uber needs to create a chat where drivers and customers can text before the pickup, since not all the locations are on the uber search bar, and not everyone has minutes to call.

-Uber needs to let their customers share location. For example, if I'm a 13 year old kid without an uber account on my phone and my mom needs someone to pick me up. I should have the chance to share my location through "SMS" or through "WhatsApp" so can my mom could open it on uber just in case she doesn't know the exact location.

-Uber should not charge almost 2 dollars for cancelling 5 minutes after requesting, that's not right. If I don't like the uber that is picking me up, because for some reason the car is broken, the guy seems annoyed, the guy is a creeper..etc. Guys you should take that out for good.

-Uber isn't supposed to be like  other taxi's. Is meant to have a superior quality, in other words, the driver must have qualities that could enrich Uber's image. Uber should make a long quiz for those who want the job, and ask for their ID in case they are banned. If there are at least 3 customers complaining for a specific driver, that driver should be fired. 3 Strikes, you out.

-Uber should correct a bug that makes the driver seem he/she is 15min away, mean while actually he/she is 5min away.

author: MDSkiBum
title: New app is broken
content:
After two Uber trips with the new app, I can safely say that Uber has managed to fail at one of the most basic parts of their platform-connecting drivers and riders.

On two trips tonight (different phones used to book each trip), the app incorrectly reported the position of the driver's vehicle. On the first trip, the driver position never changed and we had no idea when the driver would arrive. The estimated wait time jumped up and down, and we had to text the driver to find out if they were even still coming. On the return trip, the driver was waiting across the street when the app indicated they were coming from the other direction so we were looking that way and didn't see them arrive, so they almost gave up and left. After a few minutes of not seeing the driver get closer on the app, we finally looked around and saw them.

Uber can no longer be trusted as a reliable platform. Major fail! Go back to the new old app that worked.

author: sh0rtyr3d1
title: Very dissatisfied for several reasons
content:
Let me start off by saying I take several trips in a week, at least 8-12 separate ones, and travel at least 9 miles each way. This has earned me a "VIP" status, minus the VIP treatments. I guess if VIP treatment means having to screen shot the application and every single time I request a ride and about to get in the car, or take pics and videos of where and when I get in and out of a car then yea ... VIP. I get charged extra amounts and the excuse from Uber "customer service" personnel who respond to your claims is usually that your pick up and drop off location weren't the same as when the ride was requested. First of all, that isn't my business where Uber gps places me. If I leave my home to go to work and both addresses are "saved", it is not my fault if the gps picks up another address, or if the driver started or ended the trip before I get picked up or dropped off. It's happened on more than a few occasions. 
My review isn't going to be all negative, there are some positive however Uber has got to work a lot harder for them. 
Where do I start? 
Let's get a rating system for Uber transactions and trip reviews, not necessarily rating the drivers who also sort of have their hands tied when it comes to certain things. There are reasons customers may have something to say without impacting a driver's rating. 
Updates must be made on the routes especially does on Uber pool rides which have often brought me to the same dead end street although I have informed Uber on several occasions. 
Uberpool experience with the earlierst and latest drop off time has gotten tremendously better. This helps a customer decide whether or not a pool is a good idea especially when pressed wifh time. 
Uber has been charging me a different price other than the upfront fare which is being shown to me and confirmed prior to the trip starting. I have had to write countless emails to Uber for these transactions to be reversed. Just as any other vendor, they take your money right away then tells us to wait 4-5 business days to get it back. Why even bother with an upfront pricing? 
The drivers, stop hiring so many especially without testing their driving. Safety should come first and unfortunately, some of the drivers leave me with an uneasy feeling through the ride and makes me jump out of the car once I get to my destination.

author: ufasfhkj368
title: $20 coupon: arezooa
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “arezooa" to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

This choice has been removed, so I must now consider whether I should use another service instead, and pay a little more for rides.

author: MGhostSoft
title: Watch out overcharges!!
content:
When you search the airport of your city, check the route carefully because possibly the destination is set to the middle of a runway and the route is several miles longer than it should be. As a result, you're paying $4~$6 extra for the distance you won't travel. I reported to Uber several month ago and never heard back.

And, do they think people are used to the "Always on" location tracking? No reason for me to allow them to track my location 5 minutes after drop off, and no reason to trust them only doing what the claimed to do.

And, people like me still haven't forgotten that Uber requested hundreds of Lyft cars then cancelled them and did so again and again. What a mean company.

Not that I'm still using this app. In fact, I have not used it ever since I found the overcharging trap. Not to mention the location tracking. I'm just keeping this app installed so that I can get back and leave a 1-star review whenever it is updated.

author: Gorberg
title: Learn from my mistake, Don't get involved with uber...
content:
Do not get involved with this company. Check your review in about a week, it will be deleted. I find Uber's business practices to be sneaky and despicable. I'm not going to recommend this app from Uber. The Uber app pulls the resale value out of your car to Pay YOU. Uber needs to compensate and pay the drives real money, so they can fix and maintain there car's. Uber doesn't pay much to the drivers at all (Uber keeps about 60% of what the rider pay UBER). Once you consider your fuel cost, extremely high cost of ride-share car insurance, car maintenance and the terrible wear and tear on the car itself plus significant lose of value of your car at resale, especially because of the super high miles on your vehicle. The Uber app is a very bad deal for the drive. However the riders are getting a great deal on your dime and time.  Sorry for the bad new.

Here's a timeline of Uber's troubles so far this year.

- Jan. 28: After President Donald Trump releases his first executive order on immigration, New York taxi drivers protest by refusing to pick up passengers at Kennedy Airport for an hour. Some protesters say Uber tries to capitalize on the protest by picking up passengers anyway, prompting a Twitter protest urging people to delete Uber's app from their smartphones.

- Feb. 2: Uber CEO Travis Kalanick quits President Trump's council of business leaders amid mounting pressure from employees and customers over the immigration order.

- Feb. 19: A former Uber engineer, Susan Fowler, discloses sexual harassment and sexism claims in a blog post about her year at Uber. Fowler says her boss propositioned her and higher-ups ignored her complaints. Kalanick calls Fowler's accusations "abhorrent" and hires former U.S. Attorney General Eric Holder to investigate.

- Feb. 23: Waymo, a self-driving car company spun off from Google, sues Uber. Waymo alleges that Anthony Levandowski - a former top manager for Google's self-driving car project - stole pivotal technology from Google before leaving to run Uber's self-driving car division.

- Feb. 28: A video emerges of Kalanick arguing with an Uber driver. It includes yelling and profanity and ends with a combative Kalanick dismissing the agitated driver's claims that sharp reductions in fares forced him into bankruptcy. In an email to employees, Kalanick admits he needs leadership help. "I must fundamentally change as a leader and grow up," he says.

- March 3: The New York Times reveals that Uber used a phony version of its app to thwart authorities in cities where it was operating illegally. Uber's so-called Greyball software identified regulators who were posing as riders and blocked access to them. The U.S. Justice Department is investigating Uber's use of the Greyball software.

- March 19: Uber's president, Jeff Jones, resigns less than a year after joining the company. He tells the tech blog Recode that his approach to leadership is at odds with what he experienced at Uber.

- April 18: Sherif Marakby, a global vice president who leads Uber's self-driving car program, leaves the company.

- April 27: Levandowski announces he is stepping aside while Uber defends itself against the allegations from Waymo.

- May 11: A federal judge in San Francisco rejects Uber's request for arbitration and refers Waymo's case to the U.S. Attorney's office for a possible criminal investigation. Days later the judge bans Uber from using technology taken from Waymo, but doesn't order Uber to halt its self-driving vehicle program, as Waymo requested. The case is set for trial in October.

- May 26: Kalanick's mother dies in a boating accident. His father is seriously injured.

- May 30: Uber fires Levandowski.

- May 31: Uber's finance chief Gautam Gupta says he plans to leave the company in July.

- June 6: Uber fires 20 people after a law firm, Perkins Coie, investigates complaints of harassment, bullying and retaliation. That investigation, which was separate from Holder's, checked into 215 complaints; 57 are still under investigation.

- June 11: Uber's board meets with Holder and adopts a series of recommendations based on his report.

- June 12: Emil Michael, Uber's senior vice president for business and a close ally of Kalanick, leaves the company.

- June 13: Kalanick tells Uber employees that he's taking a leave for an unspecified period, but will be available for "the most strategic decisions." Uber's board releases Holder's recommendations, which include removing some of Kalanick's responsibilities and replacing Uber's chairman and founder, Garrett Camp, with an independent chairman. Holder also recommends many cultural and policy changes, from establishing an effective complaint process to recruiting more diverse applicants to prohibiting alcohol and drug use during core work hours.

Uber’s blatant lack of respect for user privacy is a deal breaker, regardless of whether I can just close the app after my ride to deny further access to my location. I’ve loved the service, but I value my privacy more. There’s competition out there for Uber’s riders (and drivers).

I will keep reminding people his.

I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!
