author: BchBumm
title: Suggestion/Enhancement
content:
Updated Review

Still an awesome service but like most companies there's no place to add suggestions or enhancements (at least I don't see any on the app or web site), so I'll add mine here.  

When sending the driver information PLEASE include the color of the car.  Yes we need the license number but the color of the car will help us identify the drive from a distance a lot sooner.  

----------------------------------------------

The concept and service is AWESOME.  

The app can use a little bit more tweaking.  

I'm VERY computer literate but the time I've use UBER or have tried to show new members how to use it I always find it difficult to find where to enter the destination address.  Plus changing the car type should be a wheel to select from not that slide bar.  Try not to get too fancy there is no need for it since UBER aid a simple concept.  

Other then that I can't wait to use the service again.

title: Surcharging without our acknowledgement
content:
Never using Uber again. I've been a loyal customer with Uber for years - when they first launched. Now, they've changed their surcharging and have started to include the surcharge into our trip estimate with no notification or breakdown of the surcharge in the receipt like they used to. 

So basically, they can charge us whatever they want and we have no idea when we're being surcharged because there is no acknowledgement of the surcharge on our part. 

Best part? Their terms of agreement say they can charge us "regardless of our awareness." I'm over this sneaky and greedy corporate crap. This is how you lose loyalty, Uber. Bye forever.

author: IvanArt

author: Brendan81
title: Consistently disappointing
content:
The App's estimation of arrival times is usually 1/3 of the actual pickup time.  

The drivers are focused on GPS signals rather than a given address which leads to endless headaches.  The drivers are also given access to your personal cell phone rather than providing in-app text and voice services.  

When drivers cancel at last min, users should be credited for what typically amounts to a 15min delay, which would otherwise be considered poor service.  Meanwhile if you have to cancel because the driver is incompetent and can't find a well-known address, you have to go through a maze of hoops to get a refund.  

Additionally, there is no simple way to improve basic functions of a ride, such as picking up on the correct side of the street.  You either have to play frogger, or face the drivers wrath in getting a poor rating for making them u-turn.  

I don't care about all the uproar regarding executive stupidity that is happening these days, but the app and service quality is disappointing.

author: SCJoker25
title: What the hell!!!
content: This latest update is absolute horse s***.  Why do you need to know my location even when I'm not using your app.  I will not be using your service from here on until this changes.  If you can give a legitimate reason for this invasion of your customers privacy I might consider using but I doubt you can.  As far as I can tell this decision does absolutely nothing to provide a better customer experience.  Good luck getting me back as a customer and I will be sure to tell everyone I know and work with about this latest update.

author: Scottgilbert1

What really did it for me though was the fact that I requested an uber to go to the airport (in Chicago) and even though I typed Midway and that's what it said on the request, my driver got directions for O'Hare.. thank God I knew immediately he was going the wrong way, this is such a huge mistake I can't even imagine not knowing the city and missing my flight just because Uber's GPS is not working. author: ucsklrzx368

content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get £15 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing!

The app is easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

author: EVERY1isTAKENsoIMUSINGTHIS
title: BAD UPGRADE
content:
Terrible upgrades. They now force you to use your current location for pick up rather than being able to put in a different pickup from where you currently are. There's a way of getting around it but it's difficult to figure out. 

They now mislead you and tell you your uber is "4 minutes away" before you request one, and then once you do, it will say 10 minutes away. Why mislead riders?

If you loose an item, there's no easy way to get it back. My uber driver purposely drove 40 minutes away so that I would pay him a ridiculous amount of money to bring my keys back. 

They also changed it so it doesn't automatically allow you to rate drivers each time you open the app. It's pretty much impossible to figure out how to rate a past driver. 

Stop making upgrades just for the sake of making them. Upgrades don't automatically equate to a better ap. Also, there's no way the "nicknames" I've tried to write this review are all taken. I've had to type this same review up 4 times because they tell me my nickname is taken and then automatically X out of the review. Don't want any bad reviews maybe?

Please stop with the upgrades. They make it way more difficult to use.

author: KyleMichelson
title: Scary experience and terrible support
content:
I've been using Uber for about 2 years and spent thousands of dollars on it over that span. It seemed to do the job. That is, until recently I ordered a ride for my girlfriend and the driver took her outside my apartment and then rather than let her out, decided to detour and go elsewhere for a 20 minute ride despite her asking repeatedly to be let out. Finally, the driver relented and took her back to my address but never told her where she was being taken. If this causes concern for you, it should - this could happen to anyone, not just her.

I wrote multiple support tickets and each time Uber said they apologized that I had a fare issue and hopefully next time would be better. But this wasn't a fare issue, it was a safety issue - they didn't vet the driver thoroughly enough and once informed they made no attempt to rectify it - the driver is still an approved driver and you could match with them the same way my girlfriend did. I called the emergency safety line since that was the only way to get through and was told they'd give me $5 back for the ride, but again, they said this was a fare issue and not a safety issue. 

If any of you have been following Uber in the news this should give you serious pause. Not only is the leadership of the company dodgy when it comes to how they treat women, but that goes down to the way they select their drivers. If you're going to try Uber I suggest being very careful. This ride could easily have become far worse had my girlfriend not gotten out.

author: Zak_702

So if don't know your streets your SOL.. but if fix that would give 5 star as Uber Drivers are ALWAYS nice as curtesy and always in a good mood. Where most even carry water to just give you. So never had problems besides the Map deal...

In my case the driver is always redirected to the other side of my road or even to addresses that don't exist. It is extremely angering to try and put the correct address, just to see it change back and say it's recommended. So please Uber, put the option "While Using" back, and let us put our addresses correctly when your app doesn't know or mistakes the addresses.

author: Cmariakis
title: Very disappointed
content:
I asked for a uber last night , a guy that was a refugee from Iraq picks me up, (I'm in the Air Force) and he starts taking detours to get back to my base , he gets lost and goes the wrong way , goes to the wrong gate and then we have to turn around because he didn't know he couldn't drive on base after I tried telling him a 100 times , to top that he can't understand any English , and so he drops me off 3 miles away to the other gate and the charge went from $5 because it was my first ride to $25. author: Gorberg
title: Uber is terrible, they delete the bad reviews once a week.
content: Do not get involved with this company. Check your review in about a week, only you will be able to see your review no one else. I find Uber's business practices to be sneaky and despicable. I'm not going to recommend this app from Uber. The Uber app pulls the resale value out of your car to Pay YOU. Uber needs to compensate and pay the drives real money, so they can fix and maintain there car's. Uber doesn't pay much to the drivers at all (Uber keeps about 60% of what the rider pay UBER). Once you consider your fuel cost, extremely high cost of ride-share car insurance, car maintenance and the terrible wear and tear on the car itself plus significant lose of value of your car at resale, especially because of the super high miles on your vehicle. The Uber app is a very bad deal for the drive. However the riders are getting a great deal on your dime and time.  Sorry for the bad new.

author: zH5ljidwuzbPt
title: 20$ COUPON: asifr4016ui
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “asifr4016ui”to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: BstonCoder
title: Good service, but has major app issues
content:
The Uber service is still the same as it has always been. I'm a long time user and very grateful to have Uber available in my city. 

However, the app has some issues that need to be worked out:

1. Location services options are Always and Never. This causes both privacy concerns and practical concerns (battery life).  For now, I have this set to Never and I just enter my pickup address. 

2. The new pickup location pin is confusing. I'm unsure whether the actual pickup location is where I am or at one of the "convenient" pickup locations. 

3. When I enter an actual pickup address, I would expect that the driver should go to that address. Instead, Uber seems to give the driver directions to a point nearby. 

Aside from that, I realize many people are unhappy with how the price is now displayed. Instead of informing us of the surge multiplier, we are simply told the cost of the ride. This is really just a psychological issue. Personally, I like the new way better. It seems more like when I purchase anything else. I'm told what the price of the good is and then I can decide whether I want to pay that amount or not get the product. I understand why some people preferred the surge pricing, but I don't think it makes the service any worse.

author: Colin Rhoads
title: Zero customer service
content: Outside of the obvious ethical dilemma everyone should have using his app, their customer service is an absolute automated waste of time. I couldn't for the life of me get a real person to reply to any of my emails, just an automated reply for weeks. Top that with their poor pricing all other options out there are better at this point.

author: Pootercat
title: All Unhappy Uber riders
content: To all the unhappy Uber riders, mainly speaking about this apparently, one or two, drivers that are bad at customer service and are just jerks.  I am not sure where you are but I am guessing most of you are in San Francisco.  This one or two people that are rude are not the only ones out there.  There are a few people like me out there and I love driving for Uber.  I don't know about that cancel fee.  I would check to make sure he isn't just making sure to say no-show after only a minute or so.  If they are, you need to call and report this one or two drivers.  I don't cancel riders.  I have accidentally missed one or two but then make sure to take it when it shows again.  I haven't done S.F. yet but it sounds like this one person was probably a taxi driver before.  I keep my car clean, offer people mints or gum, if wanted.  I have good conversations with those that want to talk and just listen to music with those that would rather not talk.  I almost automatically give all my riders 5 stars.  Please don't stop using Uber because of one or two idiots that don't know how to be courteous.  I am and know others who are always polite, respectful and care to make sure everyone gets home safely.  It might be the S.F. thing.  Not sure.

content: I rated five stars just a few days ago because I respected the company for standing up for common sense and rationality but they have acquiesced to the totalitarian left. Shameful. Have some self respect and stand up for your beliefs... or just bow to the pressure of crazy, illogical, leftists who try to silence all dissent; perfectly exemplified at UC Berkley. Beware of the leftist thought police. (See CNN for a list of things you are allowed to believe.)

author: uwztrwqi368
title: $20 coupon: bryanc1372ue
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the promotions tab on the app and enter the coupon there. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing!!!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: Tim's iTunes Page

title: Some concerns
content:
So now the app ALWAYS has access to a user's location? Why not have the option to allow location tracking while using the app only? Let users decide. 

I've loved taking Ubers for years, but the app is starting to feel bloated. The new feed thing seems just like an advertising opportunity, instead of adding useful features. They should utilize 3D Touch and rich notifications, like some other apps.

content:
A few days ago I needed a ride to a business meeting. A driver took my request and when he missed a turn, he called to say he wasn't picking me up, that I should cancel the request. author: Anthony Wrenn reptiles
title: Can't even book a trip
content:
First let me start off by saying I have worked in tech-support field for quite a few years.  This app. is definitely not user-friendly. I've heard great things about it so I figured I'd give it a try. I've now spent over two hours trying to just get a trip. First it won't accept my credit card for a method to schedule a trip (even though it saves it as a method of payment). Then when I tried to input my PayPal account it tells me that it's not accepting that method, "method of payment invalid". I am even currently logged into that PayPal account in another window so the info and account are good! Then when trying to get help or contact somebody there is very limited choices on how to contact anyone. It seem only to refer you back to articles for pre-existing problems. It took me more than 15 minutes to find out how to reach them (can't use the app.) after using a desktop computer. Then it seems the only way to contact Uber, is through email. Which you first have to confirm through some verification method and if you don't respond in 24 hours that gets canceled out. After all that, now I have to wait to try to get help and my flight is in six hours and I still haven't went to sleep yet!
I can't remove my credit card method of payment without adding another method of payment which of course it's not allowing me to add my PayPal. If I did not know that this was a known company I'd swear this was a scam to list all of my credit card payment option so they can gain access to them!
Lyft just let me do all the same stuff in 5 min. Now I gotta see if I can get my Groupon refund since I can use this stupid Uber service.

author: Os1OXXxdHukpo
title: 20$ COUPON: asifr4016ui
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “asifr4016ui”to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: raz673
title: No reason for location services change
content:
Update: This review will be posted every time there is a "bug fix" update that doesn't do anything other than remove bad reviews until their stance on unnecessarily tracking riders changes. 

There's absolutely no reason for Uber to track my location AFTER the ride is over. I do not want to share my location with Uber all the time, but now that's the only way to use the app. It's a completely sketchy move that does not benefit the user in any way. You can have an incredibly accurate, reliable app with the "Only While Using" location services option. 

The only real reason I can see for this is Uber wants to track user movements and sell the analytics to the highest bidder, which is deplorable.

content:

I have the Uber ride pass with the $3.99 for Uber pool if the trip is under $20.  Well when I request an Uber it'll show $3.99 while I'm on the trip it'll show $3.99 but once the trip is completed it'll be triple that price a few times even more, once it was $43.00.  And I'll email them and they'll give me every excuse in the book for the price increase. And its sad because they used to be a good honest company but when this ride pass expire I might have to cancel my account. I just hope the correct this problem.

author: Holena675
title: 20$ COUPON: as10369ue
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “as10369ue” to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: uzovexpq368
title: $20 coupon: bryanc1372ue
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the promotions tab on the app and enter the coupon there. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing!!!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: Qicchen11355
title: Fare discrepancy!
content: I have tried to contact uber about this and they kept hiding behind their dynamic pricing algorithm as their excuse... Last week, i used uber for the first time and since i was referred by my wife i received a $20 credit. We were in the city and decided we want to take a uber back home. I opened the app to check for prices. I saw that it would cost $52.09 to get home from where we were at. However, when my wife opened her app (at the same time standing right next to me), the price on her app says $46.05. Since, i had the $20 credit we decided i would book the ride. I found this fare discrepancy to be unfair and maybe even unlawful. We were hailing a car at the same time, same location, to the same destination so why is the price on my app higher(by more than 10%)? I took screenshots on both of our phones in hoping that uber will honor the lower price however all they have done is offer up more excuses. They told me that supply and demand, time of day, traffic conditions and construction can all affect pricing and i don't have problem with that explanation except we were standing at the same location, go to the same destination at the same time. That makes no sense to me. I ask everyone to test this out for themselves. Honestly, i think maybe uber mark up my price because of the $20 credit they gave me which they don't disclose and will never admit to...

author: Char22344449275
title: Lost item in car..terrible experience
content:
I am extremely frustrated with my entire experience with Uber this past month. On Dec 30, 2016, I left my iPhone 7 in an Uber drivers car. I immediately called the Uber driver on the morning of Dec 31st and left a voicemail explaining the situation with a number to get back to me on. I called every day since then for a total of 35 times, all of which never resulted in an answer or call back. Meanwhile, I had been emailing Uber explaining the situation. On Jan 4th, Uber emailed me letting me know they got a hold of the driver who would be dropping off the phone. On Jan 6th, uber emailed me saying: "Your driver mentioned that he already dropped the item in our Greenlight Hub. However, your driver was worried that the item might not be logged properly under his name." I wrote back asking what this even meant and if Greenlight Hub had my phone available for pick up. I never got a straight answer as to whether or not the phone was at the Atl hub or not. They continued to write back to me stating they were trying to contact the Atlanta office and that they would get back to me with a case number once they figured out who he left the phone with and where exactly it was. In multiple emails they write: "We don't currently provide phone support in Uber Greenlight hub in and we still don't have a case number in order for you to claim the item." They basically stated the phone could not be picked up without a case number. 

These back and forth emails continued for 3 weeks up until January 24. At this time, I was thinking that although the driver stated he had the phone and would drop it off, that he was ignoring my voicemails and calls and was lying to Uber to keep the phone. When about to go to my local police office to file a stolen phone report, I did a final repeat call to the driver to see if there was any possible hope that he would answer so that I could figure out if my phone was dropped off or if it was still in his possession. At that time, he did finally answer, after 3.5 weeks of me calling, and stated he dropped the phone off at the Atlanta hub the day after Uber contacted him saying there was a phone left in his car. So sometime between January 4-January 24 the phone was dropped off at the hub office. I would have been more than happy to have drove to the Atl hub to pick up the phone when it was dropped  off; however, Uber never confirmed with me that the phone was there. 

Thankfully, the Uber office did have my phone and I was able to get it back. 

I am extremely frustrated with this entire process. I spent $700 to purchase a new phone and had to go through the hassle of buying a new phone and loosing all my information on my original phone. I never got a direct answer about whether or not the driver had even dropped off the phone at the hub office. There was no number I could call to speak with a person directly rather than back and forth emails between multiple Uber employees, all of which never contacted me letting me know that the phone was available for me to pick up. 

I am a loyal customer to Uber because I truly do love your service, but the way this situation was handled has changed my views. I'm sure that it's hard for the Uber employees emailing to communicate with the Atl office employees since they were not in the same building as where the phone was, but I continued to get the run around in emails. I wanted to provide my feedback in hopes that the process can somehow be fixed so that other people do not have to go through a huge ordeal, similar to my situation, to retrieve their lost items.

author: BorrowedCake
title: $20 coupon: “jadej26”
content:
If you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon "jadej26" and get $20 off your first ride! Seriously!! 

Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it likely won't cost you a thing! 

The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: lokiTheTrickster
title: Air Travelers Beware of False Support
content:
Uber is great when it works... but never use it from an Airport.

Uber claims to pickup at most airports, but are not officially allowed by most airports. As a result there is no legit pick area (Uber's own website lies about this and specifies pickup areas that don't exist on the airport map, and airport staff have no idea where to send you either). If you use Uber from an Airport it will only be a waste of time before you give up and take a real cab.

This has been the case for me at many big airports: ORD, MSP, PDX.

author: Koyublue19
title: Rhett Snow Uber Driver here
content:
Hey guys, I've been uber driving around North Carolina for quite a long time now and it's always been great. The new people, the gas money and all. Yet the last couple of people I drove off have been quite disturbing. I mean, they were basically going to some old house out in the woods. I really didn't want to get into it but I think I saw something on my mirror sitting in the back just a second ago.
I know this sounds crazy but I could have sworn it was a pig man or something. So I'm not sure whether I'll ever drive there again, whether I'll ever uber again even. It felt quite disturbing even if it was just my imagination, you know? 

Edit: Something's in my house. I don't know why I'm writing this here but I feel like if someone was to ever see this, they could tell my story. I don't know where else to write or what to do right now. Did I hear a pig sound? 
I'm calling 911.

Edit2: the cops came yet the house was empty. They told me to lay low and just chill that I probably imagined it. They did now however hear any pig sounds. I feel like tonight might be my last, I'm not sure how to sleep while I can feel the pigs head breathe over my head. I can't see anything but it all could be just some fear of the dark, and some stress I've been having lately.
But why would I imagine a pig sound? 
I will write an edit 3 in the morning. If I don't.
...

author: Average user
title: From : I wish all services were this good! To: don't think I'll use it again
content:
After years of evangelizing Uber I'm sad to say today was my last ride. 

The app to start with us cool in that it gives you a great view into the ride status, payments, and reviews. On the bad side it has become so buggy that it's not useful. Today the app showed the car would be at my house within 8 min and 20 min later changed out the driver for someone else that would be there in 8 min. The second driver arrived around 10-15 min after so in total I waited over a half hr for the car and missed my meeting. 

The app crashes often and the Uber's customer support is nonexistent now that the telephone number has gone away. I've been charged for rides I didn't take and it takes me longer to ask for the reimbursement than it's with. They now track you even when you're not using the app which is a major security problem and should just be outlawed to only give never or always track. 

It's sad to say it but I am ready to try another ride app. I hope they are better!

content:
Simply put the latest update has some sort of bug where upon making a request for an Uber it became continuously stuck on the searching for ride screen. As I went to send some messages and emails to notify others of my delay I discovered that not only was the Uber app stuck on the search mode, but it had actually tied up all outgoing transmissions (was still able to receive incoming). This is a big flaw!!!

Took a hard restart to clear the issue. For clarification I have an iPhone 7 Plus, so it's not an outdated hardware issue (I just updated to the latest Uber app yesterday).

author: JfergusonKG
title: Prime example of: don't fix it if it ain't broken
content: This new design is terrible for what the app is. This app is meant to let you quickly and easily order a ride. The old app was simple and easy to use. Now they've replaced it with something more "fancy" and "futuristic" looking, at the expense of ease and speed. If you want to select the exact location for a pickup, no more move the pin on the map. Now to get to that you have to select a couple of things first. And instead of clean screens, now things are transitioning from all over the place and different things (such as the GPS) flash at you. Each time I move to a different menu I have to pause and figure out what it is yelling at me now. Instead of being able to quickly and easily order a ride, I now have to take time to work the app. Bad redesign of an app that didn't need it.

author: SerenityAngel90
title: Meh
content: I use Uber mainly to get to work on when the buses aren't running early in the morning or late at night. I live in Southern California and if I work on Saturday and Sunday, I schedule an Uber ride for 6am (buses dont start running until 7am). I have had instances where the driver would randomly cancel on me or literally message me telling ME to cancel before THEY are going the other direction. Why accept the request. I've seen how the driver app works and I know you do not have to accept the request. Luckily, I've never been late for work. Coming from work I've had instances where the driver went the wrong direction and blamed me. Told me to cancel and I got charged $10!!! I am low income where of the driver cancel, it would have charged him $5. Then was rude to me and hung up! It gets a 3.5 because when I'm in LA it has been reliable and has car pool, but when I need it for work, probably 40%. I only recommend Uber for heavy populated areas or big cities and metropolises. Hometowns, small towns, etc...not much reliability.

author: uqxzntle368
title: $20 coupon: 0jsbk
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “0jsbk" to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon there under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: Markx23
title: FREE First Ride Promo Code: 70kks
content:
Uber is a ridesharing app for fast, reliable rides in minutes—day or night. There's no need to park or wait for a taxi or bus.

If you’ve heard of Uber, then you’ve likely heard something about an Uber promo code, which grants new users crazy amounts of free ride credit when they sign up for the app for the very first time.

If you still haven’t used the app, you’re in luck. There’s never been a better time to become an Uber user than now, so cash in on this promotion while it lasts.

From what our research indicates, applying the Uber credit code “70kks” to your account before you take your first ride is one of the best ways to get a discounted first ride. After applying this Uber promo code for new users, you will see a free ride credit pop up in your account.

While the amount of free credit is currently $15, we’ve seen it jump up even higher than that on some occasions. But our advice is to just apply the promotion and request a ride, because once you apply the credit, it is good for 30 days.

Applying an Uber promo code

A $15 Uber credit will get you almost anywhere you need to go for free, or at worst, put a significant dent in your final fare and save you $15. We use $15 credits all the time and they get our team pretty far, no matter what city we are visiting.

Actually applying an Uber credit code is easy, and can be done in a few simple steps:

Download the Uber App – You can get it from the Google Play or App Store
Select Promotions Tab – Head on over to the tab labeled “Promotions”, then tap Add Promo Code
Enter Uber Promo Code – Enter the promo code in the box, then tap Apply
Three easy steps and you’re on your way. If you’re having trouble, however, see the tutorial below that walks you step-by-step through the Uber rider signup process.

author: Shane McFarland
title: Scheduling disappeared
content:
I downloaded Uber on Oct. 9th, 2016. On that day, I was allowed to schedule an uber 30m in advance from my location. 

Today, I redownloaded uber and from the same exact location, there's no such option. 

Even worse, UBER THEMSELVES are giving me two different answers. One uber help page says no, and another uber help page (both official) says yes, but then proceeds to loop me back to the sign in screen every single time. 

I KNOW this was a feature last month, and I KNOW people other than me are complaining that it's gone, and I KNOW some people still have the choice because my girlfriend updated and then showed me the exact location, and she had the option. 

I'm just wondering what on earth is going on with this update?!

author: ufasfhkj368
title: $20 coupon: arezooa
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “arezooa" to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: BrooksTalley
title: Totally broken unless you give up 24/7 location data
content:
Older versions of the app allowed users to choose "while using the app" for location privacy. The current version forces users to choose between "always" and "never".

If you choose "always", Uber will be able to track you 24/7, even if it has been weeks since you used the app. There is no legitimate reason they could want this.

If you choose "never", the app is non-functional. There is no way to enter a pickup address. You cannot use the service.

I am deleting the app and recommend against anyone installing it. There are plenty of competing services that are less abusive to their users.

author: ukftttcp368
title: $20 coupon: harshp6993ue
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!

author: FeliciaG23
title: Contact company & poor ratings
content:
I've used Uber in Las Vegas & other places in the states I have traveled. I recently went overseas & encountered all sorts of problems. The drivers were fine when I could get the app to work. My issue was my acct is set up with an American #, well due to data roaming it was financially smarter for me to get an overseas phone. There is no option to add an alternate #. So when I tried to update my number it made me verify & then kept giving me a user error/ unable to save. So when I tried to create a new acct on the OS phone, it told me the # was already associated with another acct & to contact customer service. Which I did - repeatedly! You can only email them. I emailed the issue, got an email back saying please provide screen shots. When I hit the reply button like stated & submitted the screen shots I would get an email back saying: the email your replying from doesn't match the email of the original!!!! I went thru this like 10 times! Utter frustration. To the point I stopped using the service bc I had to carry around 2 phones just to use their service! My daily OS phone to set the pickup AND the American phone to contact/ or be contacted by the driver! Ridiculous! They need a better system. 

They also need to stop drivers from rating you poorly if you don't tip as the service encourages. If I'm clean, where I said I was & not high maintenance why are the drivers not giving 5 stars? Oh because they wanted a tip. One of my drivers told me I had a poor rating & suggested I tip better. I'm very disappointed with all this.

author: trustablereviews
title: $20 coupon: "jm9407UE”
content:
If you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon "jm9407UE" and get $20 off your first ride! Seriously!! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it likely won't cost you a thing! 

The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: mnmtheshhhh
title: Borderline fraudulent business practices
content:
I am a longtime uber rider. And I am very, very angry about the way they show the available ubers in the map view before you choose to call a ride. Oftentimes, especially for pools, the map will show many drivers within  a few minutes of my destination, and the eta will show 2-3 min. But then I call it and it sometimes takes 7-10 min. On top of that, they make you pay to cancel a ride. I have heard that many of the cars in the map view are fake, just to entice you into ordering a car which you think will arrive much sooner than it actually will.

To sum up: this company lures you in by falsely claiming there are fast rides in the area, the sticks you with a ride that's 10 min out, then makes you pay to cancel it if you can't wait that long. This is honestly borderline fraudulent behavior and I am surprised this company has not yet been caught doing it...

author: Fototico
title: Not good for traveling in some countries
content:
I still can not understand why Uber won't let you mark your destination using a pin rather than entering an address. It makes no sense. 

While traveling within the US where the street addresses are pretty good, it's not a problem. None the less dropping a pjn would be nice. 

Now, traveling in other countries is not easy at all most of the time.

Here's what I am talking about. The app let's you use a pin to mark your pickup location. It even lets you move that pin around. But it does not do the same for the destination. Making it impossible to often enter a destination location.

I'm visiting Mexico often. I know the streets and locations of places I want to go to but I can't using uber. Even when I have the address of the place, most often it can not find the place if you enter the address. I know where it is on the map but can't drop a pin. It really is frustrating!

Addresses there are not easy to understand. For example, a friend owns a luxury apartments in a Tijuana's wealthy neighborhood. His gas bill as one address, his electric bill as another, and his cable bill as yet another. All for the same place. That is crazy! And guess what, I can enter all three address in Google maps or in this app and nothing comes up.

The developers of this app need to fix that ASAP! Seriously! Dropping pins for destinations is a must in some situation.

Lyft allows you to move the destination pin on the map and that is one of the reasons why when I travel I use it more than Uber. Unfortunately, it only lets you do it in Lyft Line. The equivalent of Uber pool. Both services need to address that issue and educate customers on how to use the app. As a driver I've had this conversation with many Lyft passengers and all tell me that it would be very useful. I imagine Uber passengers would like the same feature.

There's no more option to allow reading location only when the app is running. You told that you need location info within 5 minutes after ride. No, there's no reason I want to share that, and there's no reason I trust you that you only collect what you promised. I have disabled location sharing on this app. Doesn't that make the app practically unusable? Yes. But not that I'm going to care because I'll never use this service again. I just keep this app installed so every time it is updated, I'll come and post a 1-star review. And seemingly you are attempting to wash out all these negative reviews by updating this app every a few days. I'll tell you that won't work. You'll only remind more people leaving a negative review.

author: zZ56Dsy7x
title: 20$ COUPON: as10369ue
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon ‘as10369ue’ to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

content: I don't use uber often, only if I'm out of town or maybe once every three months here to get to and from a bar. I've been trying for two hours to get ahold of someone to fix this; I've sent three emails, filled out two forms, and called the customer service line twice. I even tried to register a new account using my secondary phone number and email, but the app refused to accept my payment. It wouldn't scan my card, gave me an error when I typed the info in manually, and won't even let me use my PayPal. Absolutely awful. Looks like I'm staying home tonight.

author: alvint
title: bad for your battery and bad for your privacy
content:
UPDATE 2: As others have pointed out, Uber is likely pushing new updates just to clear out the bad reviews. They're hoping people will lose interest after a while and they can get away with their deceptive privacy practices unchecked.

UPDATE: It looks like Uber was forced to remove the obvious lie from their app description, but with this version of the app they still can monitor your location at all times--not just when you've used Uber recently. And what about all the people who allowed the app to monitor their location because they believed the lie? The latest "feature" described in this update shows Uber never intended to keep that promise even for a second. Shame on them.

Original review:

I'm an iOS developer and the  description about how they'll use your location information is simply not true. With this configuration not only can they monitor your location for up to 5 minutes after you use the app, but also for up to 5 minutes *practically any time they want*, whether you've used the app or not.

Additionally, apps that monitor your location all the time are one of the bigger causes of battery drain, even on newer devices.

To the developers:

Just be honest--you're yet another company who wants to snoop in on where people go and make a few extra bucks selling that information to the highest bidder. Many people will use the app anyway.

The really irritating thing is that you easily could have left the original option (to get location info only while the app is being used) so that tech savvy people could change it in Settings. Instead you chose to explicitly remove that option and try to force people to accept something that benefits you at the expense of their batteries. Deleted. If you want my business you'll have to bring the option back. Aside from Lyft, there are still plenty of cabs in D.C. and thanks to the competition the cabs are much better than they used to be.

author: 0Y8265g9s
title: 20$ COUPON: as10369ue
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon ‘as10369ue’ to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: BorrowedCake
title: $20 coupon: "JADEj26”
content:
If you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon "JADEj26" and get $20 off your first ride! Seriously!! 

Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it likely won't cost you a thing! 

The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: PhaJ1thae
title: 20$ COUPON: as10369ue
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon ‘as10369ue’ to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: uznhjeoa368
title: $20 coupon: UberALCYLU
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: matthius1
title: Now requires users to let Uber track them 24/7 even when not using the app
content:

I set it to "never" again as soon as I'm in the car. This nonsense has already caused me to use another ride service twice since this version rolled out. 

This must be one of the worst "upgrades" ever accepted on the app store. The new (actually from another awful recent update) is incomprehensible and offers no benefit for the confusion it causes, and this version takes a steaming dump on users' privacy for no good reason. 

I really hope some one in Uber-land bothers to listen to their customers in the future. A quick look at the reviews for this version shows I'm not the only one who is upset about this! Alternative ride share apps are only one tap away!

author: 1574gvcfm
title: Cheaters and liars!
content: I work for uber ! I've been trying to get a rational explanation of why,  they sent me from fort lee New Jersey, to Kennedy airport in New York, a forty minute commute there. 28.00 dollars in toll just going to the destination.  When returning, I was not allowed to go online in New York, so I had to commute back to New Jersey. It costed me another 28.00 dollars to return.  Where in tolls alone , i spent 56.00 dollars . And 55 minutes to return. Uber only payed me 46.00 dollars. I've been trying to reach them over the phone for 2 days.  I have had no luck getting any representation to help me. I have been also texting them. They ignore my question completely.  according to uber , we are going to make between 10-30 dollars an hour. This trips adds up to 129.00 dollars. I only got paid 46.00. Nobody has reached out to me. My eight hours working for uber has payed me $ 4.35 an hour . After all my expenses. I have brought everything to there attention, and they still continue to ignore me. I believe and trusted them. I've been lied to and ignored , I feel destroyed and disrespected by them. I feel I was taken advantage from them. They know what there doing. And I'm ambarresed to have allowed myself to be taken advantage of in such a way. I never thought that we were going back into a time of slavery. In fact it's worst , It's not just that uber did not pay me what I deserved, but that I had to pay it out of my pocket, for services that they offer. There a 2.8 stars in the apple add. According to uber rules and regulations. They cannot go under 4 stars . And there a 2.8 . Uber please pay me what you owe me. That's all I want . Thank you. Have a good day. Sincerely one of your employees you stole from.

author: uznhjeoa368
title: $20 coupon: UberALCYLU
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

title: UBER APP LIKES/ DISLIKES 🚗🚗🚗
content:
first off, HERE IS A FREE Uber ride (up to $20) CODE : lissettes422ue

WHAT I LIKED 😇 :
• you get to see who my driver is and their star ratings
• you can see where my drivers vehicle is heading on their way to pick me up
• you get to call/text your driver
• you get a message saying how long it should take your driver to pick you up
• I did add a payment method but wasn't charged anything because of a promo code I was using
WHAT I DISLIKED 😤 :
• you must add a payment method even though you have a promo code
• you don't get to see who your driver is until they're on their way but you can always cancel & find another driver
• the price sometimes go up and up and up but sometimes it does lower down so take advantage of a good price lol

I understood this and thought it was a good business decision. However I never thought you would completely remove the location service option of "only use when app is open." I am now only given the choice of always or never. Given I don't want an increase in my cell phone bill I have to now manually turn the location service on and off. Please bring back the other option for those of us that need to keep our data usage under control. As the user we should have this right to choose. 

Also, it was noticed you've now made typing in an address/pinning a location now extremely hard when location service is not on to force the user to change the setting. Poor experiences like this are not acceptable.

First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: jfm429
title: Bad Release Notes
content:
The application's release notes are uninformative.

When I update an application, I expect to see release notes describing what's changed. These are important for users because changes and new features can affect how we use the application. If the release notes say nothing except "Thanks for using the app, we update regularly, blah, blah, blah..." then I have no idea what the changes are.

It's not that hard to write good release notes. Just list any new features and visible changes. These can be brief, but must indicate clearly to the user what has changed. Then, indicate if there were bug fixes and, optionally, what they were. Not every bug needs a specific note, but if it was a major bug, it's best to mention it so that users know it's been fixed. Finally, add news, general information, and marketing copy as desired. This is the least important part, and developers should be careful not to be so creative that they detract from the usability and readability of the release notes, but a little flair isn't a bad thing.

Because of the lack of release notes, I've given this application one star. I hope the developers can see the value of release notes and start providing them for the benefit of their customers. Release notes are not optional; they're possibly the single most important way to communicate with your customers. Use them properly and your users will thank you for it.

author: GRE tears
title: The pin drop feature is stupid and insufficient
content: So I've been using Uber for a long time now because it's so convenient, but I'm so tired of this one dumb feature of the app. Every time I try to use the pin drop feature to show drivers where I'm at, they end up in weird locations around me but can't ever find me. I've tried pinning on nearby streets and that hasn't helped. The way I understand it, the driver doesn't actually see the pin's location, they just get directions to the nearest generated address, which of course may be significantly off. But it gives the user the idea that the pick up location is precise, which is false (and leads to avoidable frustration). The pin feature only makes sense when there are no nearby landmarks and when the roads are spread out. There needs to AT LEAST be the OPTION to be able to search for the pick up location via name or address. Sometimes all a driver needs to know is "Marriott" or "Target" and it clears up 99% of any confusion. PLEASE take this into consideration for the next updates.

author: ulacmzed368
title: $20 coupon: XOACA
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon "XOACA" to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the promotions tab on the app and enter the coupon there. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing!!!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! author: merrimacga
title: Don't use Uber unless you want you account hacked and your credit card stolen
content:
Awhile back I signed up for Uber but never used the account. Then this past Sunday, someone in another country used my account, and the credit card on it, for rides 3 times. I found out because my credit card company contacted me to confirm the transactions. I'm still working this out with them but in the meantime my card has been cancelled and I can't use the account. I contacted Uber too and it was like pulling teeth from a baby, both trying to find a way to contact them and to get a resolution, which I am still waiting on. Eventually they say they put a temporary hold on my account so no one else could use it. But they didn't offer to do anything about the charges. And they wouldn't cancel my account by phone. I sent them the request in writing but with no response.

My advice: don't use them. Their security is lacking and their customer service is horrible. You can't trust them. Save yourself the physical and financial headache...there are much better services out there.

author: uznhjeoa368
title: $20 coupon: zge3ui
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “zge3ui" to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: Arrggh Isle
title: Downgraded to Old Version
content:
Do not update. 

Privacy: Broken with new location choices of only "Always" or "Never". 

Battery: Killed. (See above location settings.)

Danger Level: Sky high. 
First of all, to save battery while out, you have to turn location off because Ubers GPS kills a full charge (iPhone 6) in 3 hours of on-use. So now when you leave a place, on the street that you don't know, you open Uber. But location is off (they removed the "While using app" location setting option), so now Uber doesn't know where you are so you can't request a ride. This is dangerous and stupid. The options for location in system settings should always include a "While using app" setting -- if not I usually delete the app. 

Rider Centered: Broken. 
Can't request a ride until you type a location, which you may not yet know exactly; like when you say "Let's go downtown. I'll call an Uber." and then you decide between spot A or B, or look it up, or get the address from friends you're meeting. It is not at all odd to not know an exact address right when you request. The new system just does not match what actual riders do.

Also see above about location. This is an example of moving away from "rider centered".

Uber now attempts to force riders to walk to "nearby convenient pickup locations" rather than where the h*ll you are. Nearby convenient locations for drivers to pick up waiting riders already has an app...it's called a Bus Stop!

Overall this update is very much a step backward for Uber. 

Do not update if you value your time, your payment settings, your actual safety, your ease of requesting a ride, your battery, the accuracy of maps.

author: RevMarket
title: Old Version Better
content:
I appreciated the second to last version better.

In that version as a driver I could see where all other drivers were so I could go to where there was no coverage. The last version and this version do not allow this feature. I have to act as if I am go to go from one point to another before I can see other drivers in close proximity of a certain circular area. 

The people who are ranting about the Uber experience shouldn't, in my estimation, be bemoaning their experience here. If I mam correct this is where we write concerning the app. 

Now to answer those who have bemoaned:

As a driver I have many concerns but you would do well to do a support ticket to address those issues rather than here. If one support person does not answer your needs ask to raise it to the next level. 

As a driver, I ask if my customer if they have a preferred route. Or if they want to bring it up on their device and give me turn by turn instructions. Your are paying so you have the right and responsibility to tell us what you want. If using GPS, which is not under Uber's total responsibility, remember it is what it is. If you see or hear something wrong then speak up and do it before we get to a point where we cannot remedy it until we have to use another route. 

As for cancellations, there are some that want to be "The Cancellation King." (See YouTube)

On another note our riders do put in current location and it puts us somewhere else than where they are or want to be picked up. If you know that GPS always puts drivers other than where you want then text or call your driver well ahead of time so they know there will be an issue. Or move the map so it is more precise, rather than the back of your dwelling. 

Riders should be ready and outside so we don't lose money waiting. Some drivers feel that if you are taking away our income by making us wait then you deserve to be charged on other way around. Let's all be responsible to each other. Be as visible as safely is possible. Some believe that if you make us wait more than 5 minutes you deserve  to learn the hard way. If you make us wait you should be required to pay a cancellation fee. Also you will have to request and wait for another Uber, who will be further away from you than the current one was.   

When you see that your driver is 2 minutes away you should be outside waiting. All of your group should be outside waiting together. If you ask for an UberX don't have 5 passengers. If you are under 18 and don't have a person over 18 with you then you cannot ride Uber.

Don't put us in the position of having to cancel your ride. If I am already close to your area then be ready to come out immediately. There are times in the city where my last stop was at your very location. You should see that on the map before you request a ride. If you are not ready than wait till you are to request a ride. Or tell the driver they can start the ride while they wait for you. 

These are just some common helpful instructions. Take what you want. Be helpful and responsible and then maybe we wouldn't have the issues you have been having. It's your ride take control of it.

Please remember to have cash to tip. Or ask if you can tip by using PayPal.

author: Lilsam33

I contacted Uber to see if there was another way to do so in the new app as I could not tell. I received a response saying that you can't "Schedule a Trip" currently but check back soon. How does that help me when I need to schedule a ride for next week? Looks like I'll be needing to use a competitor. As an Uber VIP, let's hope that competitor doesn't win me over because I'm ready to say goodbye to Uber!
