author: ulacmzed368
title: $20 coupon: XOAXA
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon "XOAXA" to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the promotions tab on the app and enter the coupon there. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing!!!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

title: I finally tried Uber needing a ride, left out in sun and ended up walking miles
content:
I wish I could give 0 stars!  

Visiting family in Dallas, TX from NYC, I was dropped off by family to do tourist stuff.  Since they were at work when I needed a ride, I decided to sign up to Uber finally after many NYC friends swore by Uber over the years.  Long story short, I was stuck in bad area in the sun for over 30 minutes waiting on SMS verification code for account but Google maps was stuck on request for driver.  When I tried to cancel Google maps, it warned me I might be charged.  No customer service phone number for Uber, only a basic online form which sent email and blamed my phone carrier for blocking short SMS verification!   Abhorrent.  If no cabs around and no public transportation, YOU ARE BETTER OFF WALKING IN TEXAS HEAT as opposed to waiting for a car that never comes aftwr giving them your credit card!   Deleting my account and CC info now

author: S2DH
title: Uberpool Has Become Aggressive
content:
I'm the past I've given this app 5 stars. Cheap rides were amazing in the past, and most regular uber rides are still decent. However uberpool has become aggressive and penny pinching. I can't cancel rides where my driver is taking twice the predicted ride to show up, and they still take me to pick up and drop off multiple riders on route even though they already made me late and are making me even later. It can be seen on the uber app that rides are making me later for my events. They know what they're doing but they don't care. When uberpool first came out, it was relatively direct, they didn't take you for bad roundabout pickups, and they let you cancel if your driver is late.

 I may still have to use this app under some circumstances for lack of alternatives, but I will be avoiding it where I can.

author: Matt in Brazil
title: I hate having to leave a negative review as I used to love Uber so much
content:
I have been suing Uber for a number of years and initially it was a game changer. For years I have complained about taxis turning up late, their cars being unclean, their ride drivers etc.

So when Uber came along I though this was the answer. As a regular traveller I have used Uber in cities all over the world and until the last 6 months my praise could not be high enough. But recently standards have started to fall. All of the complaints I have had about taxis I now have for Uber. I suspect their biggest problem is that they've just got too big and cannot control he quality whilst they still have to meet their continued growth targets.

Issues I've had include drivers taking other passengers and i still receive the charge. Drivers calling me telling me they have another job (not sure how they're assigned to me then) and they cannot tell when they will pick me up so I should cancel and book another (so I would incur a fee that they would receive, when they can also cancel, but refused to do so). I've also had the usual dirty car, ride driver, clueless driver (no idea what traffic signs mean) and dangerous drivers. The pickup locations also make no sense - i have tried to change the pickup location on the map, contact the drivers in advance... anything I can but the drivers will not turn up at my address. Instead I constantly have to walk 400 yards around the corner to meet the drivers - several times getting soaked in the rain. 

My biggest complaint however is the customer service. Just try making a compliant. The response is unbelievable - often making no sense. They REFUSE to answer questions even when you are specific. There is no option to raise a complaint or ask for assistance ahead of a driver arriving. So if you're stood waiting three times the quotes time there is nothing you can do other than cancel and pay a fee. If someone else gets in your car - again nothing you can do until the journeys over and they've taken money out of your account.

I'm sad to say I'm going to give other services a try. I'm not expecting anything different but Uber's response to my complaints and basic questions has been absolutely shocking.

author: Lienlac385
title: 20$ COUPON: as10369ue
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “as10369ue” to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: Louie 0143
title: BEWEAR: PLEASE READ!
content:
I downloaded Uber once but chose not to use it after seeing the prices. I put in my address and that's it.  No personal information or card/payment information.  This was in February. 

I received a call from my bank on Saturday (April 8) telling me that my account was almost empty, being around $7.25. We discussed this and found that Uber has been charging me. I HAVE NEVER USED UBER ONLY DOWNLOADED THE APP!  

Today, April 10, I received another call. Uber is still charging me after the bank closed my account. My account is now -$400 and has been closed.  Uber has taken almost $1,000 dollars from me. I HAVE NEVER PURCHASED AN UBER. 
This happened in a span of four days.

If you are going to use Uber, please be careful.

Let us know when you fix this and maybe I'll use Uber as much as in the past. Until the man Lyft will be my 'go to' app.

author: Traloi623
title: 20$ COUPON: as10369ue
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “as10369ue” to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: Firstappreviewonapple
title: I wish I can give negative stars. Take lyft instead
content:
Uber used to be so good but within the  last couple of months their choice in drivers has gone down and their customer support has become completely atrocious. Today I got charged for a trip I didn't even take. The driver was incredibly rude. Said he would pick me up, never did. I see he's halfway through the trip and I try calling him. He yells "where are you??" And I said I was still in the parking lot of the requested address. He said to stop calling this number and hung up. After that he rejected all my calls. 

When I contacted Uber support they said "due to my account history" they couldn't refund me the money. When I asked for documentation about it, they couldn't provide it. I sent them screenshots of my location TIMESTAMPED. Clear evidence that I wasn't on the trip. They didn't even acknowledge it and kept sending me the same canned response. I was determined though and kept asking to speak to a supervisor and eventually they said "we will not see eye to eye and are closing this discussion." How absurd. It's not even the money at his point it's the principle. Uber just STOLE money from me and didn't do anything about it. 

Do you want this kind of treatment? Do you want Uber to take your money and do nothing about it? Do you want to arrive late to where you're going and get completely frustrated about it? Then sure, install the app. 

If not, take lyft. Anything really is better than this garbage. Public transportation is much better.

author: Compass&Quill
title: If I Could Give Negative Stars, I Would
content: Between the app itself (some drivers have told me it often shuts down or freezes), and terrible drivers (today's driver literally didn't know the meaning of "U-turn" and can't understand the GPS directions), I'm afraid to use Uber if I need to get anywhere on a schedule. Today I ordered a car at 7:41, and was told it would arrive in 5 minutes. I watched the car on the app map drive in circles for 13 minutes, then gave the driver a call. She was a few blocks away, but drove around for another 8 minutes before finding me. I could have walked faster.

author: User Acceptance Tester
title: Poorly Designed App
content:
The app prompts riders to drop a pin, which leads to poor quality pick up data. Riders then have to confirm the address over the  phone or text the proper address.

The app vehicle tracking function has unacceptable lag, confusing the riders.

If riders want to submit their photos for easier, faster pick-ups, they are not allowed to do so.

Riders have to use third party apps for cashless tipping - really inconvenient.

There is no mandatory security recording in the vehicle to assure the riders' safety.

The app looks poorly designed, busy with too many offers and promotions.

author: uftbelcp368
title: $20 coupon: 99qtk
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

title: Starts good, turns horrible
content:
Your first ride always is good, prices start of dirt cheap. The more you end up using it, the worse it gets. Drivers always cancel and when riders do they have to pay 2$ fee even if it's the driver's fault. When you complain they only give you a stupid useless apology. 4 times in a row I have had to rate drivers 1/5. The only response I get is sometimes a refund and a stupid excuse about standards they don't uphold. To be honest I would recommend using Lyft if you're in the US, or your country's alternative. Been 2 year user, before I used to be in Dubai. Service there was absolutely superb, here no one cares about anything in terms of comfort, easiness, service, or even cleanliness sometimes. 
Would leave 0/5 if possible. I do not recommend for users within the US

author: Uber Commuter
title: Find a better solution
content:
I pay more money to wait longer and go a shorter distance when it really should be the other way around.
It takes 25 mins in a car to get to work. I'm waiting 20 mins to get a ride to work and most of the time if I'm waiting longer I'm more likely to get cancelled on mid-wait usually making me late to work because I have to call another ride and wait 20 more minutes. Even if I call a ride over a hour before I'm suppose to be at work I'm late. Its not great for the rider or the driver. Also if I cancel on a driver because it's 20 mins away please do not pair me with the same driver. I obviously need one that's closer or just a different driver.
The navigation rarely works. 
These are not one time incidents this is a daily occurrence. 
The interaction with the application is terrible. Most of the drivers are super nice and pleasant but dealing with the process of getting a ride is extremely frustrating. 
There's also no where to give real time feedback. I'm sure you get plenty of emails a day but there has to be a better solution to get these reoccurring issues filtered out.

author: uqqkomoi368
title: $20 coupon: Uber82ue
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon there under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: Poshaspice
title: Sneaky sneaky uber!
content:
OMG so I thought it was just my app that was acting weird, I even deleted it and downloaded it again, but after reading these other reviews it's obvious uber is just pulling a fast one. They completely changed their system with this latest app version. I have been using Uber for the last two years religiously, but the last two weeks it's been god awful! They no longer show you when a ride is inflated so your prices jump up out of nowhere, even after you order. A driver will cancel on you then boom an inflated rate comes up next! Or the app keeps saying there are no cars available, then would send a car without notifying me, drivers press no show and I keep getting charged an extra $5 not even knowing there was a driver waiting for me! Which FYI they do not refund, they give you a "credit."  This has happened numerous times this week. 
Uber go back to your old version or I'm officially switching to Lyft! Your service was so reliable before, it's too much of a hassle now and keeps making me late.

author: sgoericke
title: Unusable - Wait time functionality broken
content:
The following defect mostly makes Uber Pool extremely difficult but also makes all other ways of taking Uber confusing.

When requesting a car, exiting the app (while leaving it running in the background) and returning to Uber, the display of how far away the driver is has disappeared. This makes it seem like the driver has canceled. However, the driver is usually still on the way with no way to tell for the user. This creates all kinds of confusion and can result in cancelation fees (if the user requests a new car and now has two cars coming). 

One time, I was even pooling with myself (because my car had dropped off the map but was not in fact canceled and was still on its way to me). The system should be smarter than to partner me with myself - you have my user info after all.

I will no longer ride Uber until this is fixed.

Overall it's difficult to translate the physical world to a map interface, so kudos for the strong effort, but there are a few kinks to iron out.

author: Okayfast
title: VERY UPSETTING AND ANNOYING EXPERIENCE
content:
What a horrible service!!!!!
My Uber driver NEVER showed up and they charged me for the ride anyways! After waiting 5 minutes for the guy to pick me up, I realized that the app showed that I was "on trip," so I called the guy to ask him what happened and he told me he didn't see me, but he was going to be there soon, and then he hung up! I waited another 5 minutes and the app showed then that "I had arrived" so they charged me! I waited a little longer hoping that the driver was still going to show up, but it didn't happen! I reported this to Uber Support, worried that this guy would do the same to other people, and they answered me with a fits-all kinda email saying that "they have reason" to believe I did take the ride! And the conversation when on until I got tired of explaining the situation! I even sent proof! But it was pointless! I can't take seriously a business that doesn't have a decent customer service! Ridiculous!

author: uxdesiger2017
title: $20 coupon: "jm9407ue”
content:
If you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon "jm9407ue" and get $20 off your first ride! Seriously!! 

Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it likely won't cost you a thing! 

The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: glowingz
title: Delete this app.
content:
On January 28, 2017, when Trump instituted a ban on refugees entering the U.S., the NY Taxi Workers Alliance went on strike.  Lyft striked in solidarity. In addition, Lyft vowed to donate one million dollars to the ACLU.  

Uber, on the other hand, chose to take advantage of the situation and continued service, even temporarily suspending surge prices to get more customers.  I will no longer use Uber as a service and I hope others will join me in deleting this app and deleting your accounts.  Profiting off of this international crisis is despicable.

content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

Uber needs to focus on updating its technical areas more than updating the looks of the app. I went on Lyft and it let me set up a ride with basically one click and with no problem. So lyft is better for me.

author: PoodgeRocks
title: Rapist Driver!
content: I was in a car with 3 other female friends and asked the driver his craziest uber drive. He proceeded to tell us about the time he picked up a women who was out of her mind drunk and took her back to his house. She said she didn't want to have sex with him but took off her clothes and climbed in his bed, he then said she begged him to have sex with her. He said he didn't even want to have sex with her after the 3rd time but did it anyway. All of us in the car were visibly uncomfortable and I even made a sarcastic remark about him "not" being a rapist. I've heard stories about how Uber will continue to employ sexually aggressive/ rapist drivers but I've never felt more relieved to get out of a car, and also never more afraid of someone knowing where I live. Cherry topper, he tried to write his wrong by telling us a story about how he stopped a rape by jumping on a mans back and not calling the police. I will never EVER use this Uber, I'd rather walk!

author: PShea1
title: Terrible update
content:
Living in a large city with high rises, you are never located on the map properly. This update brings a terrible way to pick your current location. You have to put in your destination, then it automatically selects your current location. You then have to select your current location to drop the pin. Not a major problem I suppose, but really annoying when an app takes 1 step forward and 2 steps back. This will be pretty annoying in urban areas to jump through the extra hoops when Lyft just lets you move the pickup location immediately.

Update 6 months later. Last three days Uber has sent the drivers on a wild goose chase through alleys to pick me up in Chicago. Permanently switching to Lyft who hasn't don't that yet.

author: IAmAKat
title: Do NOT upgrade to new version!

author: Tyler S. got screwed by Uber
title: I hate Uber
content:
Here's my message to Uber:
"My Saturday night turned into a disaster trying to get an Uber ride. I was in downtown San Jose the night of 3/4/17 when I called my first Uber at 10:53pm. I didn't realize it at the time, but apparently the app put my "current location" on the opposite side of the block (with buildings in between so I couldn't just walk over there). And the drivers were plentiful in that area so I couldn't have walked there fast enough anyways. So my first driver, Antonio, went where the app had my location and I obviously wasn't there, so he canceled my trip (without texting or calling me which is frustrating). The app notified me that my trip was canceled. So I request the ride again at 10:57pm. This time I notice the location was incorrect, so I called my driver, Hironmoy, and explained that I was on the opposite side of the block on 1st Street in front of the Continental. He said okay, but then went to the wrong spot anyways. Then he called and asked where I was. I explained again my location and that the app had it wrong. I don't think he could understand me so he canceled my trip. Now I'm getting frustrated. So I call for the trip a third time at 11:08pm, this time manually typing in the address of the building I was standing in front of. Unfortunately Hironmoy was my driver again. I watched him drive past me 2 times!!! He just never even stopped...he was making laps around the block. So watching the app, I was prepared to basically run in front of him and flag him down on his next lap, but he never made it back a third time. He stopped and literally sat there for about five minutes. I texted him and requested he cancel the trip and explained that I would get a different driver. I never heard back from him. So I canceled it and called for the trip a fourth time at 11:23pm. This time the driver came right to the location in under a minute and everything worked like it was supposed to. The problem is I got 3 cancellation fees and had to stand outside in the cold rain for 30 minutes just to get a ride. Again there were drivers everywhere so it was very frustrating that it was such an ordeal to get a ride. while watching everyone else coming and going in there Uber rides. I expect Uber will reimburse me for the cancellation fees and I would appreciate a credit for the hassle and poor experience. If not, I will give Lyft a try and no longer use Uber. Please let me know what you can do for me."

The response I got:
"You were appropriately charges a cancellation fee"

The obviously didn't even read my message and just sent me a blanket statement response. 

Goodbye Uber, hello Lyft.

author: Trungthuc573
title: 20$ COUPON: as10369ue
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “as10369ue” to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: KF221
title: Mix of issues
content:
The idea here is good- being able to request a ride and hop in is great.

But in practice, this app is a mess. Why on earth would the map say 6 minutes, when, in reality, it takes at least 15? I don't care that it theoretically takes 6 minutes, if the driver were to drive without traffic or lights. I care about the ACTUAL time it takes. Change this! I mean who gives a crap about how long it should take? 

Second, the map itself... this cannot be that difficult to fix. If you are in an area that has side streets (let's say somewhere near a mall) - the Uber map doesn't process these streets. I can't tell you how many times I've watched my Uber driver go in circles for ten minutes because the map doesn't know where to take them. 

The price surges and drivers cancelling rides- just be honest and tell your drivers this is not meant to be a real job where you make tons of money. It's a business idea for YOU to make money. If you wanted to create real jobs, you'd pay them more. 

Good luck - I'd be curious to try Lyft for a while..

author: Khochiu89
title: 20$ COUPON: as10369ue
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “as10369ue” to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: Flava Fade
title: Pros, Cons and What Uber Really Needs
content:
Pros

The app is easy to use
You see your price ahead of time.
Short wait time for rides
Most drivers are nice and polite
Reasonable response time if you have an issue.

Cons

If you have an issue, Uber decides what your issue choices can be.
The new "floating pricing" where the price for the same ride can be different every time you hail a ride. 
The Uber map can foul up drivers frequently
Uber lacks an "area knowledge"  standard when hiring drivers so drivers are always using their phone directions which don't always work very well. 

What Uber Really Needs

A subscription option, which is the best for those who don't have cars or frequently ride.

author: trustablereviews
title: $20 coupon: "jm9407UE”
content:
If you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon "jm9407UE" and get $20 off your first ride! Seriously!! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it likely won't cost you a thing! 

The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: Lance J.
title: Nuts
content:
I have used Uber quite a bit in the past 3 years... but now they've run off the rails. Their privacy posture is truly nutsoid. Perhaps that's good for scoring some VC bucks, but there are a lot of competitors out there that are cheaper and just as capable and that seem to do a much better job respecting user privacy. I certainly don't want drivers know where I am going after a ride, nor do I want Uber to be capable of following my every step (and draining my battery to zero). 

So goodbye. It was fun to give you a couple thousand $$$, but it's time to graduate to a firm that's respectable.  Happy to say I used Lyft for the first time today and it was basically the identical experience - but for less money and without the personal privacy abuse offered by Uber.

Original Review: 
Since the app and service are tightly coupled, my review is for both. 

Overall, very good. Generally better than a cab. I have had one problem driver - crazy guy - but likely no less crazy than some cab drivers I have had. 

App could be easier to use, but it is quite good.

author: fugly_mofo
title: Disable Location Services - Set to Never
content:
New Uber App, now with Trump Support!

Uber now offers only the false dilemma of "ALWAYS" or "NEVER" using your location data. They do this for nefarious purposes. 

You should use Uber with location services completely disabled. It actually works better this way in fact, because you can just input the exact destination you want to be picked up at instead of having the app always try to guess where you are. 

Give it a try, disable Location Services for Uber under Settings > Privacy > Location Services > Uber - set to "NEVER"

If they give us the "While Using The App" option back I'll stop posting a one star review every time they update the app. Until then, F-Uuuuuuuber!

author: Cantim795
title: 20$ COUPON: as10369ue
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “as10369ue” to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing! The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver. The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

It's frustrating that my rating dropped from a perfect 5.0 to a 4.2 recently as I didn't tip the drivers with cash when I was on a work trip to NYC, and the impact was pretty significant. Usually if there are 3-5 cars visible on the map I'll get a pick-up accepted within 2 minutes but right now it's making me wait for 5 minutes or more!

I understand the rating system is to protect the drivers from annoying customers or troublemakers but if I need to tip to keep my rating up with drivers then this defeats the purpose of Uber's no-tip policy.

author: Arrival2016
title: $20 coupon: uberparker41
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon code above to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the promotions tab on the app and enter the coupon there. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing! 

The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important information like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. Uber pool is now even more cost affective than taking public transportation.  After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away.

author: Matt2244668800
title: Drivers scam by cancelling fares
content:
My driver cancelled my fare the second he arrived. I was ready to leave so I was watching his progress on the app the whole way. As soon as he hit my location, boom he cancels the fare. This in turn caused me to be charged a $5 cancellation fee. And when I reapplied for a ride, of course the same driver gets it (he is just sitting in the parking lot 30' from me after all) so he essentially gets a double fare. It's a scam, plain and simple. 

This company used to be awesome, but I guess they are getting greedy and not paying their drivers which gives them the incentive to scam their customers. Great business model.

author: Anthony199010029
title: Poor design. Not user friendly. Slow.
content:
This app makes me feel that software engineers and graphic designers are a bunch of overpaid and incompetent employees. 

I usually don't write reviews about apps but this is such a failure in everything from user experience to design that I needed to take the time to write this review. 

The new logo itself is uglier and less futuristic. What are you trying to convey? Some plain ugly background, a complete regression. 

The app requires more swipes to find the appropriate cars. The pin has been removed. I live in an apartment complex and I pin it at the entrance and walks toward it until the driver comes. Now, it shows my building which is far away from the entrance and inaccurate for the driver who is now likely to call me to ask me stupid questions about my pick up location. 

So essentially now I need to walk to the entrance and ask for a uber there and wait. How convenient! 

I mean it's so stupid. Did you guys have meetings and you thought this through? 

I am an app developer myself, I am so unimpressed by the work being done, without a doubt I could do a much better job. That's not corporate level work. More like something I did Friday night completely drunk.

Seriously, I wanted to work for uber as an engineer but the upgrade is so bad that I am questioning leadership and how such a poorly designed and not user friendly app was ever approved. 

Speed? I don't see any change, same 3 seconds to wait when I open the app. It actually seems like it lags a bit more as the map doesn't load automatically. 

Ridiculous. Deleted.

Uber is great. The only problem that I see is that in San Francisco, for some reason the phone GPS is not accurate and doesn't work as expected and this affects Uber app as well. So, be sure to drop the pin in a correct place otherwise you will confuse the driver and he/she cannot find you.

author: ufasfhkj368
title: $20 coupon: arezooa
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon “arezooa" to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: HS7
title: GROSSLY OVERCHARGING RIDERS
content:
As a driver, I'm able to view what the rider pays and the breakdown between ubers commission, black car fund (NYC), sales tax, and obviously my payout. 

Ubers Payouts in NYC used to be 25% commission and 8.875% black car fund. Lately they have been overcharging the rider and paying the driver as little as 50%. 

I've had trips where the driver payout is $14 but rider is charged $26. Ubers commission alone is $10. For another ride, the total fare was $106, Uber commission was $33. The reason why this happens is Uber grossly miscalculates the route, or outright OVERCHARGES the rider. They do this on X rides to subsidize their pool rides. Honestly it is such a shame, such sleazy tactics. If we use faster routes, Uber ends up keeping the difference, rather than crediting the passenger or paying the driver. According to this, it is in our best interest to take the LONGEST possible route. 

Do yourself a favor as a rider and calculate the mileage and time driven. Then look at your overall cost. The rates are listed publicly I'm each region. YOU WILL BE SHOCKED AT HOW MUCH MONEY THEY'RE TAKING. It's straight manipulative, deceptive and demeaning. This has to change and stop. 

On top of that their support downright disgusting; they have a system where as soon as they respond to a question it is selected as RESOLVED. I've had completed Quests where I have not received my bonus, they listed as resolved and say wait 24-48 hours, after that they say wait till next pay statement, how is this issue resolved if I haven't received the funds nor is it reflected in the balance? It should instead say responded, or replied back to. 

UNBIASEDLY this is the WORST rideshare company. Everything I have said is OBJECTIVELY true.

author: Benjamin from CA
title: $20 First Ride Code that helps a blind guy
content:
First time Ride code is benjamina584ue

I was introduced to Uber almost 3 years ago and can say the service is excellent. I am blind and have been relying on them to help me get places especially during times that our local public transportation is not running. Before Uber came to my area I was forced to rely on our local taxi service which is extremely unreliable as well as extremely expensive. In all my travels I only had one issue and customer service took care of it immediately. I can honestly say even if you choose not to use the promo code I gave above you should definitely give Uber a try. For those who do use the coupon I greatly thank you. I use the referrals I received from it for situations such as when I am required to work late and the buses have stopped running.

author: manhattanIovestory
title: $20 coupon: UBER-7UE
content: First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon "UBER-7UE" to get $20 off your first ride!!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!!! The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button!!! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again. The customer support is also fantastic!! I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

They have fought the odds to get to safety, to feel included in the American Dream and to provide a better life for their families than they could have otherwise. author: MGhostSoft
title: Watchout potential overcharges!
content:
YET ANOTHER ATTEMPT TO WASH OUT ALL THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS! No, you will fail, I will remember posting this review every time, and you will lose customers during holiday season, and forever.

Uber is overcharging $4-$6 more for trips to airports, because when you search airport in the app the destination is in the middle of runway, effectively making the route several miles longer. I've contacted Uber regarding this but never received any response. And now you are asking to collect location info at background. There's no more option to allow reading location only when the app is running. You told that you need location info within 5 minutes after ride. No, there's no reason I want to share that, and there's no reason I trust you that you only collect what you promised. I have disabled location sharing on this app. Doesn't that make the app practically unusable? Yes. But not that I'm going to care because I'll never use this service again. I just keep this app installed so every time it is updated, I'll come and post a 1-star review. And I still remember that you reserved hundreds of Lyft cars then cancel them and repeat. I will keep reminding people his.

author: SeriouslyDave
title: Good in Malaysia but... problems
content:
I enjoyed how cheap and easy it was to get around in Malaysia with Uber, but there are several reasons I'm considering alternatives. A few are:

- Uber needs an option for enabling location services only when using the app. I am forced to do this manually today.
- Uber emails receipts to me in Russian Cyrillic text. I do not speak or read the Russian language.
- Uber offers no way to review a previous driver once you start a trip with a new driver. That is a shame because a good driver is missing a five-star review.
- Uber does not let me change my name or set a profile picture. I don't even know how it got the name that it has for me now.

--

author: uftbelcp368
title: $20 coupon: T72ZP
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon "t72zp" to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

Just being totally honest. I've experienced sweet and loving drivers to extremely prejudiced racist drivers. But, I guess that's part of the 'trip', right? Some drivers aren't willing to even wait for the passenger to order food. Overall, I would like the standard of the drivers to be increased tremendously, and also-- a driver somehow hacked into my account and got $500+ and spent it in NEW YORK!! Unbelievable, if you don't expect me to get a refund your ridiculous.

author: AppSearchIQ
title: $20 coupon: "jm9407ue”  👍👍
content:
If you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon "jm9407ue" and get $20 off your first ride! Seriously!!  Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it likely won't cost you a thing! 

The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: ismaelmoya1
title: DRIVERS WONT PICK YOU UP FROM THE AIRPORT
content:
I just had the worst experience using your app. I know you are not responsible for the behavior of drivers, but you should be aware of what happened today to find a solution for what I went through at 12 am at Orlando's Int Airport. 
I asked for an Uber and the drivers location did not change for about 10 minutes. So I called him. He sounded like he was sleeping and I woke him up. He asked me for my destination and I gave him my address over the phone. Waited another 10 minutes and he was still not moving from his original location. I called back twice and he let it go to voicemail. I cancelled and ordered another Uber. This driver called me as soon as I confirmed my pickup location. He asked me to give him my address through text. I told him I will not do that. He said he was real close and could pick me up. We disconnected and then he called back asking again for my address. I asked him what the deal was with asking for my address if it's already on the app, he couldn't give me one. He said your app does not provide the address. He hung up on me and also didn't show up. 

I live about 8 miles from the airport. It must not be worth it to your drivers to pick someone up and drop them off to a near location. I was stranded at the airport because I was counting solely on your app. That tells me I shouldn't trust your services if the reliability is so minuscule. 

If I don't get a response from you I will not ever use your services again and will not encourage any of my friends or family to use your services either.

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: justaknife
title: Now needs location all the time
content: Previous versions of the Uber app only used your location while you were using the app, but the latest update now requires it all the time, with no "while using" option. Uber says they only keep using your location for five minutes after a ride, but their app requests your location even outside of this timeframe. Look in Location Services privacy after not opening the app for a day-there's an arrow next to the app, indicating they've accessed your location. This dishonesty is completely unacceptable. I'm uninstalling Uber.

author: bbcbgjj
title: $20 coupon: ad1052ue
content:
First of all, if you haven't taken a ride yet make sure use the coupon "ad1052ue" to get $20 off your first ride! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the promotions tab on the app and enter the coupon there. Might as well try it out since it probably won't cost you a thing!!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver's face, phone number, and car make and model. It's amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don't see why you would ever use a yellow cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it's still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn't have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I'm very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations and not on the app customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!

author: BeautySecret
title: Location only while using the app- ha no longer
content:
It's all or nothing now. The settings options now is your location is shared always or never. There's no reason for always on - it drains my battery faster too. Don't update. Plus the GPS is totally wrong, one time sending the driver from the highway exit to pick me up and then had him turn around and go downtown and then back to my exit then back downtown again with the address and pin drop changing. Another instance the driver was a block away then it redirected to a suburb nearby and after 20 mins it finally let me cancel the trip and order a new ride. Also, the GPS randomly decides which route is best and whenever/wherever there's the most traffic that's the way it sends you, but when there isn't a lot of traffic it sends you the "correct" route that's faster and $5+ cheaper. Some drivers try to argue with me about taking the route I want to take- I'm not getting on the highway to travel southwest then northeast for 20+ mins when my route is direct and never ever more than 10 mins. 
All in all- this app is becoming worse and worse with each update.

author: MGhostSoft
title: Watch out overcharges!!
content:
When you search the airport of your city, check the route carefully because possibly the destination is set to the middle of a runway and the route is several miles longer than it should be. As a result, you're paying $4~$6 extra for the distance you won't travel. I reported to Uber several month ago and never heard back.

And, do they think people are used to the "Always on" location tracking? No reason for me to allow them to track my location 5 minutes after drop off, and no reason to trust them only doing what the claimed to do.

And, people like me still haven't forgotten that Uber requested hundreds of Lyft cars then cancelled them and did so again and again. What a mean company.

Not that I'm still using this app. In fact, I have not used it ever since I found the overcharging trap. Not to mention the location tracking. I'm just keeping this app installed so that I can get back and leave a 1-star review whenever it is updated.

author: promodiscountsunitied
title: $20 coupon: "UberBEN44”
content:
If you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon "UberBEN44" and get $20 off your first ride! Seriously!! 

Enter it right before you request a ride in the promotions tab. Might as well try it out since it likely won't cost you a thing! 

The app is easy to use and intuitive, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make/model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water and candy! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have car chargers at your ready! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a cab again. Even if you want to get a black car on the occasional night out, it’s still cheaper and more convenient than hiring your own private driver.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away, and price is usually the cheapest.

author: NoNagging
title: Location Policy is Anti-Privacy
content:
I've been a long time fan of Uber and a month ago I would have rated five stars but their insistence on collecting location data on us for five minutes AFTER we finish our ride is ridiculous.  To combat that policy I turned off location tracking altogether and starting manually entering my address whenever using the app but it seems they didn't code the app well to respect privacy settings as Apple requires as the app will hang crash and generally misbehave when you run it this way (to the contrary, when this occurs I can turn location back on and everything works well again). Uber, there are a few things you can do to get back in my good graces 1) the option for "while using app" should be made available in privacy locations settings, "never" and "always" are not the only two options 2) collecting location data after a ride should only be done on an opt-in basis and 3) should I decide to use the "never" privacy option as Apple intended your app should work bug free. Until then I'm a reluctant user of your app (as the rest of the service is still MUCH better than taxis) but only one star for you given how difficult it is to use the app and still maintain my privacy.

Also, 273 mb???  Really?  What else are you doing that a relatively simple app requires 273 mb?

content:

The new update makes it harder than ever to find how to split with other riders, and over complicates everything in general. 
Over the years when I've had issues with drivers starting fares before I got in the car, picking up the wrong person and charging me for it, or purposefully missing turns or taking longer routes. I've complained to uber multiple times but often they only reply with an email that had nothing to do with what I said and stated the issue as "solved".
I used to love uber but honestly Lyft provides better customer support and a user friendly app.

author: Sisters325
title: Bad customer service
content:
Über used to be my number one ride requesting app. In the last few months 3 incidences made me change my mind. And ultimately delete the app altogether.
I requested a driver, and for some reason he was driving AWAY from me, I called him multiple times but the phone was off. Wasted 20 min. So I canceled and got charged a cancellation fee, although the problem was from their side.
2- The next time my driver took a bad route, and was rude: he did not follow the Google instructions or mine, as he is an "expert" and "I know these streets" and I spent my morning in long u-turns trying to get to work.
3-The final blow: I requested a ride for next morning, I saw the regular price and accepted, the next day AFTER I got in the car, I received a text informing me that surge pricing is in effect, and I'll be paying x3. Therefore I was forced either to end the ride or pay. I contacted customer service, and every time they explain what surge pricing is, and that I am the one who accepted it!!! How can I accept it if it was not shown to me? They use words like "transparent pricing", "dynamic pricing" and I all see is: your money is gone, deal with it!
Thank you über, this is where we say goodbye.

author: uftbelcp368
title: $20 coupon: harshp6993ue
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: Cat_Boba
title: Great customer service
content:
Use the following code for a free ride (up to $15): f1fjp

This review is more about Uber and it's customer service, rather than the app. I've been using Uber for a few years now, and I've only had two major issues. Both problems were resolved promptly by customer service. The first issue was when a driver was taking way longer than expected to pick me and my friends up. I ended up cancelling and putting in a different request, but then I was still charged for the first one for some cancellation fee I think. Well, considering the whole reason I cancelled was because we had to wait much longer than anticipated, I didn't feel it was fair that I still had to pay. Customer service agreed and refunded the money back to my account (to be used for future use).
The second issue was with a reckless driver. The drive was less than 5 miles, but he swerved in and out of lanes on the highway and made abrupt stops. I sometimes get really bad motion sickness, and I somehow managed to hold in my puke during the ride. As soon as I got home, I threw up in my front yard. (Not my most lady-like moment...) When prompted to rate my ride, I complained about the driver. Within minutes, I was completely refunded!
Overall, I don't have any major complaints, but I do commend the Uber customer service.

author: agroagra
title: Congratulations, you just lost my business!
content:
Here is why I will not be using this app ever again, and why Uber risks going under for good:

I called an UberX for my girlfriend, was quoted $11 and had a driver on his way with an estimated arrival of 11 minutes. About 4 minutes later, the driver cancels and Uber tells me that the rate is now $24, due to it being peak driving time.

If it's not obvious, let me explain why that is completely unacceptable. You have me waiting, you cancel on me, and if that's not already rude, you now say that the rate is more than DOUBLE the original quote!

If that's not an example of poor customer treatment, I'm not sure what is. This is a fatal flaw in the system, and it serves only to benefit the driver and Uber. 

Uber, you've lost my business permanently, but let me give you some advice on the way out: 

If you plan on being in business 5 years from now, you will build a way to compensate your passengers via an *automatic* voucher system to adjust for price hikes when it's the DRIVER'S fault for cancelling. And no, having to call you and complain just for a "we're sorry" promo code is too much to ask for when we're talking about an app that is supposed to provide an instant-pay-instant-serve experience. Circumstances like this should be automatically corrected. It's possible with current technology and a little bit of willingness to provide a proper customer experience. Figure it out now or someone else will.

Please solve this by rolling back versions or something, this is an unmitigated disaster.

I am writing regarding an issue that I had with a driver this week. 
This driver has some pretty extreme rage issues, but even more troubling is Ubers lack of concern. 
It's a long and boring story, but here's the short version. The driver prefers to lay on the horn at the car in front of him instead of going around. Why?....."Why should I?" Then he proceeds to tell me to "Go f*** myself", floors it and leaves. 
This was not on a public street, but in a very busy casino here in Las Vegas. It was very crowded and everyone heard him and gasped. 
As I said, Uber doesn't see this issue as concerning and aren't too worried about what it says about their brand with this kind of behavior and the giant U mounted in the windshield. 
Seeing how low the bar is to continue being an Uber Partner, I'll be using Lyft in the future.

author: Cozmot
title: Terrible, useless app
content: Uber has managed to turn a decent app into a hopelessly useless app. Before the recent update, you could someone in Uber driver to your exact address. But now, after you input your pick up address, the app forces you to "re-confirm your pick up address." And from a pick list, your only options are nearby intersections. How do you get an Uber driver to come to your exact address? Select a nearby intersection, and then text the driver your address when she or he is on their way. If you're lucky, the driver will get it in time, but not always; they often are waiting at that nearby intersection. What's the easiest way to get a driver to come to your exact address? Use Lyft; Uber makes them seem like geniuses.

author: PaulC72
title: Cancels,fees,privacy....I'm done with uber
content: Uber has allowed itself to become an arrogant and terrible company. From the ever increasing fees to cover their various initiatives, to their disrespect of customers' privacy, uber seems to have declared war on its customers. But the absolute worst, and most unacceptable, is the fact that at least one quarter of the rides I request show a driver enroute and then canceled. I know for a fact that my rating as a passenger is very high; sometimes I don't take long trips on Uber and it's apparent that many of the drivers have better things to do than take people a couple of miles. I've met some great drivers, and some not so great ones.

author: uftbelcp368
title: $20 coupon: harshp6993ue
content:
First of all, if you haven’t taken a ride yet make sure you use the coupon above to get $20 off your first ride!! Enter it right before you request a ride. Go to the Payment tab in the app and enter the coupon under promotions. Might as well try it out since it won't cost you a thing!

The app is simple, easy to use and intuitive by design, giving you important info like the driver’s face, phone number, and car make and model. It’s amazing how quick and seamless the entire process is. A car comes to your door within minutes of pressing a button! The drivers are real people, they are very polite and their cars are clean! Some even come with complimentary water, gum and candy!!! Even if you want to charge your phone, a lot of drivers have phone chargers at your ready!!! UberX is definitely cheaper than your average cab. After all this, I don’t see why you would ever use a yellow cab again.

The customer support is also fantastic. I got overcharged on one of my trips and I didn’t have to say anything more than a comment on my driver feedback to get a full refund. I’m very happy and I hope Uber continues to exceed my expectations in not only the app but customer service!! I also prefer Uber much more than other competitors, mainly because they have so much more supply and cars are always just a few minutes away!!!

author: Lance J.
title: Flaws ruin Uber, lots of better providers.
content:
I have used Uber quite a bit in the past 3 years... but now they've run totally off the rails. Their privacy posture is truly nutsoid. And full time GPS drains batteries too. Uber doesn't seem to care.

But I am happy to report one AWESOME  thing about this change - Uber convinced me to try Lyft and Fasten. Both are excellent, less expensive alternatives to Uber, and without the personal privacy abuses offered by Uber.

Thanks Uber, for showing me that there are better fish in the sea. 

I'm pretty sure that Uber hopes that all the negative reviews are by robots working for the competition, and that Uber is working hard to hire an army to counter attack. Nope. There are just a lot of disappointed customers.  Fix your service and the reviews will improve.

Original Review: 
Since the app and service are tightly coupled, my review is for both. 

Overall, very good. Generally better than a cab. I have had one problem driver - crazy guy - but likely no less crazy than some cab drivers I have had. 

App could be easier to use, but it is quite good.
